loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en: Nyamaa is 38 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering transportation service to local people since 2011. His wife has currently undertaken her maternity leave. His daughter holds the position of teacher at a high school. This autumn his family purchased a house and built a garage next to it. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam, and cotton for garage protection/insulation. The insulation shall protect the garage from coldness and heavy storm during the harsh winter time. Nyamaa is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to insulate his garage.

loans.name: 06 - 06 - 02 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food.

Phương is 54 years old, and she is married with two children. Phương is the group leader of the 06.06.02 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her children are grown up.

In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for three years.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, children to find good jobs, and business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food.

loans.name: 07.04.01 Phu Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sơn works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future .

Sơn is 63 years old and married with two children. Sơn is the group leader of the 07.04.01 Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents; her children are grown up.

In 2012, Sơn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Sơn has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Sơn has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Sơn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sơn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, business to do well, and children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future .

loans.name: 07.01.22 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lam has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes for resale. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main harship that Lam faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lam is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Lam is the group leader of the 07.01.22 Phú Sơn1 solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

In 2012, Lam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lam has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Lam hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en: Elpedia owns a farm and grows and harvests bananas and coconuts to earn a living. For eleven years, Elpedia has earned well for the needs of her family and was able to repay her previous loans used to improve the farm. Recently, she requested a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay plowing costs for a greener farm. She hopes it will help her manage the farm better, return a good harvest, and provide a stable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay plowing costs.

loans.name: Jesee

texts.en:
Jesee is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as a motivated person. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal for resale. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards.

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gertrudis Elizabeth

texts.es: Gertrudis, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa, Cortes.  Hace 5 años decidió tener su propio negocio y confecciona ropa de vestir y ropa para cama, además vende productos de catálogo que le piden. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando un segundo ciclo de préstamo para comprar materia prima como telas, hilos para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y compra de productos que le han encargado por catalogo. Su sueño es que su hijo estudie y tener una vida mejor en familia.
texts.en: Gertrudis is 39, a single mother, has a son and lives in the municipality of San Francisco de Yojoa, Cortes.  5 years ago she decided to start her own business and make clothing and bedding, she also does catalog sales of products.  Her sales are informal. She is requested a second cycle for a loan to buy materials such as fabrics and threads to make clothing and to buy catalog products to sell.  Her dream is that her son goes to school and to have a better family life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabrics and threads to make clothing and to buy catalog products to sell.

loans.name: Glenda Leticia

texts.es: Glenda, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida.  Siempre le ha gustado el comercio. Hace dos años que vende ropa usada, como blusas, pantalones, ropa de cama, sandalias y otra mercadería que le piden los clientes. Las ventas son realizadas de manera ambulante de casa en casa. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar dos fardos de ropa usada mixta para vender en esta época navideña.  Su plan es aumentar las ventas, seguir con el negocio y poder hacer un local fijo para poner la venta.
texts.en: Glenda is 25, she is single and lives with her mother in the municipality of Arizona, Atlantida.  She has always liked commerce.  Two years ago she started selling used clothing; such as blouses, pants, bedding, sandals and other merchandise requested by her customers.  Sales are done informally by going from house to house.  The loan requested is a third cycle and is for 15,000 HNL that she will use to buy two lots of mixed, used clothing to sell during this Christmas season.  Her plan is to increase sales, continue with her business and be able to establish a permanent location for her business.

loans.use: to  buy two lots of mixed, used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 34 years old and married with three children.

Oliva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Oliva has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Oliva aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Geronima works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and running a general store. Geronima is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, bamboo sticks, etc. for her food vending business.

Geronima has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, aged 51, is a married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cecelia has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past three years.

Cecelia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more food items like sugar, salt, seasonings, cooking oil, eggs, soft drinks, etc. to add to her stock to sell.

In the future, Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like sugar, salt, seasonings, cooking oil, eggs, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dora Francisca

texts.es: Doña Dora, tiene 64 años de edad,  es soltera, vive en el municipio de san Pedro Sula.  Toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio para obtener sus ingresos. Tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la venta de café con pan, café negro y con leche y pan de toda clase. La venta la realiza en un puesto en el mercado donde la conoce mucha gente y su producto tiene demanda. Esta solicitando 3,000 lempiras para comprar una hielera y dos termos grandes para mantener el café caliente y cubrir la demanda que sus clientes.  Ella piensa ahorrar para comprar una percoladora y hacer el café directamente en el mercado.
texts.en: Dora is 64 years old, she is single, lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  She has devoted her whole life to commerce to earn her income.  She has been selling coffee with bread for 18 years, black coffee or with milk and all types of bread.  She sells at the market where she knows a lot of people and her products are in demand.  She is requesting 3,000 HNL to buy a cooler and two big thermos to keep the coffee hot and meet the demand from her customers.  She plans to save to buy a percolator and make the coffee directly at the market.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and two big thermos to keep coffee hot for sale.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 55 years old and the mother of 9 children. Her son owns an electricial shop in which he sells electrical tube rods, bulbs and energy saver bulbs of various brands. He provides services to his clients for electrical goods also.  For the growth of his business and the desire to get the maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods.

Therefore, Musarat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can be empowered to buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers. This is her fifth loan with BRAC. She wishes to take a huge loan next time. She hopes that her son will be able to grow his business soon.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods to resell

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old, married woman and the mother of seven children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community and makes enough through business to contribute to the family income. 

Parveen requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 42-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; one child is too young and fully dependent upon their mother. 

Her husband owns a clothing business and his practice is to buy fabrics from wholesalers and sell it to the retailers. He has lot of customers who like to buy fabrics from him. Sometimes he purchases fabrics from out of the city to minimize the cost and sells it to the retailers. He has good reputation in the market and his current customers refer him to the other retailers as well. As a result, new customer demand is increasing day by day but he does not have sufficient funds to buy more fabrics.

Therefore, Shagufta requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand.
She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. She hopes that the savings will much increase and she will complete the remaining construction of her house. Her dreams are for the bright future of her children, establishment of her business, and better living standards for her family. Shagufta is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: 12-07-01 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Tâm is 54 years old and is single with three children. She has no dependants as her children are grown up. She is the group leader of the 12-07-01 Quảng Tâm solidarity group, which consists of four members. Tâm lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province. 

Tâm operates a food stall selling snacks. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Tâm is the lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make snacks to sell. This is Tâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants and harvests bananas to sell to earn a living. For the past six years, Jocelyn has earned well enough to be able to cultivate the vacant areas of her farm and also successfully repay her previous loans from GDMPC that she used to improve the farm. Recently, Jocelyn borrowed a new loan to pay for additional fertilizer and replanting costs of bananas. She is always finding ways to improve the farm to secure a stable source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: To pay for additional fertilizer and replanting costs of bananas

loans.name: 12-08-01 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nhung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell .

Nhung is 64 years old and single with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 12-08-01 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. 
Nhung supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell

loans.name: 12-08-02 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hồng operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishes and shrimp to resell .

Hồng is 38 years old and single with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 12-08-02 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Hồng first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fishes and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: 07.01.23 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Thuận has a retail business selling coal. She is requesting a loan to purchase coal to resell.

Thuận is 45 years old and married with two children. Thuận is the group leader of the 07.01.23 Phú Sơn1 solidarity group, which consists of three members. Thuận lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuận has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuận has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thuận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase coal to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 50-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as an intelligent person. She operates a retail store where she sells hay. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are both male and female. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be that running the business can be tiresome. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add more stock of hay to sell. 

Her business goal is to have an international business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 80,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more hay to sell

loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past two years. Siena earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell in her general store business. 

Siena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenaida is 31 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Zenaida has a direct selling MSE products business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of MSE products like shoes, blouses, body spray, etc. to sell to her customers.

Zenaida has been in this business for two years. Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more MSE products like shoes, blouses, body spray, etc. to sell

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 27, is a responsible mother, and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her first loan with the BRAC and Kiva. 
Her husband owns a scrap shop; he deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses, he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods, and does not have scrap to sell to get money.

Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.
 
She is very impressed with this honorable support, and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 48 years old and has seven children. Librada is married and has three children who are still in school.

Librada is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Librada requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and additional piglets for her business.

Librada has been pig fattening for seven years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her  business.

In the future, Librada would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and piglets

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Ishrat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Ishrat is very thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: 12-07-02 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Văn is 46 years old and is married with one child who she supports with her business in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Văn has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Văn is the leader of a 5-member group, the 12-07-02 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. She is applying for a loan to purchase general items such as milk, candy, sugar, etc. to sell. This is Văn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Văn hopes her business to do well, her child to do well in school, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase general items such as milk, candy, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like slippers, shorts, bags, etc. to sell. 

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years. Elsa earns more income from food vending and her general store.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, shorts, bags, etc. to sell

loans.name: Papaelei

texts.en: "Papaelei is a 77-year-old widowed woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Papaelei has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development  (SBPD) since 2011. With her profits, Papaelei hopes to improve her business and to earn more money to support her family and her children as well."

loans.use: to buy chemicals, knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes.

loans.name: Askarjon

texts.ru: Аскарчон позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он сотрудничает с Арванд уже более двух лет. Первый свой кредит Аскарчон получил для ремонта своего дома. Начиная с апреля месяца начинается рабочий сезон для Аскарчона, он занимается производством кирпичей, эта работа требует много физических сил. Его жена не работает, она является домохозяйкой, заботиться и ухаживает за детьми. Чтобы иметь хороший заработок, которого будет достаточно на удовлетворение всех имеющихся нужд семьи, Аскарчон занимается дополнительным бизнесом. Он занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продаёт скот. Сейчас он только начинает этот бизнес и надеется, что это поможет ему улучшить экономическое положении своей семьи. Поэтому Аскарчон обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Askarjon is a positive and hard-working man. He has worked with Arvand for more than two years. Askarjon's first loan was used to renovate his house. In April, Askarjon's seasonal work begins. He makes bricks, which requires a lot of physical strength. His wife does not work. She is a housewife and takes care of the children. To make an income sufficient to meet his family's needs, Askarjon works a second job. He works in animal husbandry. He raises and sells cattle. Now he is just starting this business and hopes that it will help him to improve his family's economic situation. Therefore Askarjon approached Arvand for a loan to buy a few head of cattle. He thanks Arvand in advanced for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Qobiljon

texts.ru:
Кобилчон трудолюбивый и ответственный мужчина. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Кобилчон живёт в маленьком посёлке, где мало учреждений для предоставления работы населению. Поэтому Кобилчон самостоятельно занимается делом, которое приносит ему доход. Дети Кобилчона учатся в школе, и для этого также нужны денежные средства, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым для учёбы. И таким образом, для того, чтобы иметь хороший и стабильный доход на проживание Кобилчон занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже как несколько лет он работает таксистом. У него имеется для этого собственная легковая машина. Но эта машина служит ему уже долгое время и много раз приходилось её чинить. 

Поэтому сейчас он планирует купить новую, более улучшенную машину для ведения и расширения своего бизнеса. Этот бизнес приносит Кобилчону хороший доход, но его хватает только на проживание  и обучение детей. А для того, чтобы купить новую машину требуются денежные средства. Поэтому Кобилчон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины для ведения и расширения своего бизнеса. Он очень благодарит Арванд и Kiva за поддержку.
texts.en:
Qobiljon is a hardworking and responsible man.  He is married and has three children. Qobiljon lives in a small town, where there are few opportunities for work. Therefore, Qobiljon has his own business that brings him an income.  Qobiljon's children are in school, and he also needs money to provide his children with everything they need to study.  Thus, in order to have a good and stable income for living Qobiljon is engaged in his own business.  For several years he worked as a taxi driver.  He has this own passenger car, but he has been operating this vehicle for a long time and he had to fix it many times.  

Now he is planning to buy a new and better car to maintain and expand his business.  This business brings Qobiljon a good income, but it is only enough for food and shelter and education of his children. In order to buy a new car needed extra funds. Therefore Qobiljon came to MDO Arvand to get a loan to buy a car in ofder to maintain and expand his business.  He very grateful to Arvand and Kiva for the support!

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 53-year-old lady; she is a very poor and needy woman. Her elder son provides construction services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo which has depreciated from time to time.

Now her son is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Kousar requests a loan for her son so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again.  She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her son will earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan. 

Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner because they will empower her son to buy new construction material.

loans.use: To buy building material to provide construction services by her son.

loans.name: Azizjon

texts.ru: Азизчон молодой 23-летний мастер, умеющий устанавливать параболические антенны. Он работает данной деятельностью в течение 6 лет. Азизчон холост. Он живет с матерью в доме дяди в городе Куляб. Его отца давно нет в живых. Азизчон с юного возраста привык сам зарабатывать. Он очень смышленый и трудолюбивый человек. Сейчас Азизчон планирует начать новый бизнес и выбрал область выпечки. Азизчон на большом местном рынке своего города приобрел пекарню и собирается там выпекать и одновременно продавать лепешки. Он научился этому ремеслу у своей тети, которая до сих пор занимается этой деятельностью. Чтобы начать свой малый бизнес, Азизчону не хватает собственного сбережения. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Азизчон на сумму кредита хочет купить муку и дрова и приступить к производству лепешек. Он не бросит свою прежнюю работу и по получении заказа будет устанавливать параболические антенны. Азизчон мечтает заработать на собственный дом и обзавестись семьей.
texts.en: Azizjon is a young 23-year-old skilled in installing satellite dishes. He has been doing this for six years. Azizjon is single. He lives with his mother in his uncle's house in the city of Kulob. His father is long dead. Azizjon has been working from a young age. He is very intelligent and hardworking. Azizjon now plans to start a new bakery business. Azizjon bought a bakery in a large city market where he is going to bake and sell flat breads. He learned the craft from his aunt who is a baker. Azizjon does not have enough savings to start his small business, so he applied for a loan. Azizjon wants to use the loan to buy flour and wood and begin baking flat bread. He will not stop installing satellite dishes. Azizjon dreams of earning enough to buy a home and start a family.

loans.use: buy flour and firewood for baking flat bread

loans.name: Mahmadsafar

texts.ru:
Махмадсафар является продавцом. Ему 32 года. У него в своем районе Гиссар имеется магазин, где он занимается продажей деревянных окон и дверей. У него хороший торговый бизнес, приносящий хороший доход. Он занимается продажей окон и дверей в течение 5 лет. Благодаря бизнесу Махмадсафар обеспечивает семью - жену и двоих маленьких детей. Раньше он жил в родительском доме, где живет несколько семей. За счет своего бизнеса Махмадсафар завершил постройку собственного дома и недавно переехал туда с женой и детьми. Он очень ценит свой бизнес и сейчас хочет расширить его, но на это у него нет достаточных средств. Махмадсафар просит кредит. Он хочет привести новый товар и таким образом увеличить продажу. Этот кредит для него очень важен.
В будущем Махмадсафар планирует открыть собственный цех по производству деревянных и пластиковых окон и дверей.
MLO Humo and Partners желают ему дальнейших успехов в его бизнесе.
texts.en:
Mahmadsafar, age 32, sells wooden windows and doors.  He lives and works in the Gissar district of Tajikistan and has his own shop.  His business is doing well and brings a good income.  Mahmadsafar has been involved in this business for the past five years, and his job allows him to support his family -- his wife and his two young children.  

Mahmadsafar and his family used to live in his parents' house, where several families also lived.  Thanks to his job, Mahmadsafar was able to build his own house in which he recently moved with his wife and children.  Mahmadsafar's business means a lot to him, and he would like to expand it.  However, he doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, he is taking a loan to bring new merchandise in and increase his sales.  This loan is very important to him.

In the future, Mahmadsafar plans to open his own workshop and get involved in the production of wooden and plastic windows and doors.  MLO Humo and Partners wish him success in his business.

loans.use: to buy wooden windows and doors, as well as metal doors, to develop his business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором живет вместе с родителями и сестрами. В семье их 6 человек. Дилором жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 29 лет. Она не замужем. Дилором занимается собственным бизнесом. Она продает сим- карты для мобильных телефонов. Дилором успешно введет свой бизнес уже более 4 лет. Она общительная женщина и имеет много друзей. Скоро, у ее близкого друга свадьба. Дилором хочет купить подарок на память другу. Дилором не имеет денег для покупки подарки. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки подарки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilorom lives with her parents and sisters. There are six people in her family. Dilorom is a cheerful woman. She is 29 years old and unmarried. Dilorom has her own business. She sells SIM cards for cell phones. Dilorom has successfully managed her business for over four years now. She is a friendly woman and has a lot of friends. It will soon be her close friend's wedding. Dilorom wants to buy a present for her friend but Dilorom does not have money to buy her friend a present. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to buy a present. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a present for her friend.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en:
Farangees is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia. Here is her story.
"My name is Farangees. I have graduated a high school in Khorog, Tajikistan this year and enrolled the American University of Central Asia.
I would like to describe how active am I in the social life. I love being involved in different extracurricular activities. I volunteer in my school and in the Youth Center of Khorog. My responsibilities both at school and the Youth Center are the same: I teach Math and English language. At school I teach to younger students, but as for the Youth Center, there are students of different ages attending my classes. Before applying to the American University of Central Asia, I have conducted a small research and interviews with the currently enrolled students, trying to identify the amounts of funds required for studying at AUCA and living in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. I leave in the family of 7, including myself. I am the eldest child in the family, meaning that I bear the responsibility to support my younger sister and brother and my parents now, when I already grew up. Therefore my family is not able to afford full tuition fees at AUCA. I need KIVA loan to ensure that I will not have to think about finance while I pursue my degree. I think it is worth mentioning that from the very beginning, when I just heard about the American University of Central Asia, I started thinking of studying there, as lots of people study there from all over Central Asian region, and it is one of the best Universities in the region. AUCA gives lots of opportunities to all the students one of which is Kiva loan. The loan helps students to cover their tuition fees, which is a great help to those students who cannot afford paying the fees fully."

loans.use: To pay for my higher education.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola has been involved in agriculture for 10 years and grows mainly crops. She sells her crops to the local people in a market. With the profits she earns from sales, she helps cover family expenses. She lives with her family in her own home. When the farming season is over, the borrower has been busy with animal husbandry.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies to help with her cultivating activity, such as fertilizers and seeds, so she can improve the cropland to earn more income. What she sells now is not enough to cover these expenses, so the loan will help her continue covering household expenses without limitation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Me llamo Marcela, tengo 44 años, llevo 19 años de casada y tengo dos hijos uno de 19 y 15 años, ademas de que soy la menor de 6 hermanas. Actualmente me encuentro viviendo en la casa de mis padres aunque ya tenga mi casa propia pero la verdad donde vivio me queda centrico tanto mi trabajo en un mercado de flores y estoy también cerca de la escuela de mis hijos.
Me dedico a la compra y venta de forrajes y flores exóticas de temporada yo compro directamente con los productores de flor que vienen de Veracruz,Tabasco,Texcoco,Puebla,Tenancingo y Guerrero
Estoy solicitando el prestamo para surtir mejor mi negocio. Mi principales logros es tener mi propio negocio, una familia hermosa que hemos salido adelante.
texts.en:
Marcela is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

“My name is Marcela. I am 44 years old and have been married for 19 years. I have two children, ages 19 and 15. In addition, I am the youngest of six sisters. I am currently living at my parents’ house even though I have a house of my own. The truth is that my parents’ house is centrally located near my work at the flower market and also to my children’s school.

I buy and sell grasses and seasonal exotic flowers. I buy them directly from the flower producers that come from Veracruz, Tabasco, Texcoco, Puebla, Tenancingo, and Guerrero. The loan I am requesting will be used to buy more stock for my business. My main goals are to have my own shop and to help my beautiful family move forward.”

loans.use: to buy a variety of flowers.

loans.name: Komatutura Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of six farmers called Komatutura B Group  based in the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up her hand is Susana. She is 32 years old and married with four children who attend school. Susana has been a member of the group for three years and she is the group’s chairperson. Susana has been learning better farming methods with her group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on her farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains season. She is however constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable her to purchase farm inputs. She believes that the use of farm inputs will increase her yields and she will not only get enough food for her family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of eight farmers called Amani Group based in Kuria West District. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Joseph has been the leader of this group for two years now. He is 50 years old and is married with two children who both go to school. Joseph will grow sorghum, millet and maize on a one acre farm during the 2014 long rains. He is therefore requesting a loan from Kiva. He will buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer with the loan given. This will enable him to have a bounty harvest. He will secure food for his family and sell the surplus. He will spend that money, not only on paying back the loan, but also on paying school fees for his two children going to school.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Umoja Getongoroma Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of three farmers called Umoja Getongoroma based in Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Joseph, who is raising up his hand, has been a member of this group for three years. He is 23 years old and married with one child. With the loan from Kiva, Joseph plans to buy farm inputs to grow maize, sorghum and millet on a one acre farm. The harvest, which he hopes will be very good, will provide food security for his household. He plans to sell the surplus and invest the money in a business to increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Kemera Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of six farmers called Kemera and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Joseph, 35 years old, is married and has four children. He has joined this group for the first time. He is the one raising his hand in the picture. He is very excited about the 2014 long rains season and he hopes to implement better farming methods to increase his farming yields. It is for this reason that Joseph is asking for a loan. He needs to purchase farm inputs for his one acre farm in order to grow maize, millet and sorghum. He is optimistic that he will obtain enough food from the yields and then sell the surplus to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Bidii Kilimo Group

texts.en:
Bidii Kilimo is a Nuru International group of three farmers based within the Kuria West District. They have come together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Robi, pictured raising her hand, is 35 years old, and has been a member of this group for two years now. She is married with two children. Robi is asking for a loan to purchase farm inputs, which is one way of implementing better farming methods that could lead to increased yields. If she gets good yield of sorghum, millet, and maize during the harvest of the 2014 long-rains season, she will be able to provide enough food for her family and sell the surplus. The money she gets from the surplus will be invested in a business that would increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Nyamemba Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of two farmers called 'Nyamemba' and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.


The person raising his hand is Wambura. He is 52 years old and married with eighteen children, fifteen of whom attend school. Wambura has been a member of the group for three years, and he is the group’s chairperson.


Wambura has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase the hybrid seeds and fertilizer. 

He believes that the use of farm inputs will increase his yields. In this way, he will not only get enough food for his large family, but also will sell the surplus and invest in a business to obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees and other domestic uses.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Umoja ni Nguvu group is a Nuru International group of three farmers in the Kuria West district of Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. The group members collectively guarantee the loan.

Charles is the leader of the group. He is 26 years old and married with five children.  

He has been farming for about 10 years. He has been part of this group since 2010. The loan from KIVA will help him acquire farm inputs, which should increase his production of maize, sorghum, and millet. 

Charles hopes to obtain enough food for his family and sell the surplus and then invest the money in a business. He hopes to use the profits to pay school fees for children.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Tutaweza Group

texts.en:
Tutaweza is a Nuru International group of eight farmers in the Kuria West district of Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They plan to obtain loans through Nuru International to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Tutaweza will collectively guarantee the loan.

Beatrice, who is raising up her hand, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member of the group since the year 2011. She is 35 years old and is married with two children who go to school. The loan from Kiva will enable her acquire farm inputs which will enable her to obtain high yields. Beatrice, just like other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre. She will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in ¼ acre each. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to join a savings and loan institution so she will be able to save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus. This will give her more financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Kwigogo Group

texts.en:
Kwigogo is a Nuru International group of ten farmers in the Kuria West District in Kenya. As a group, the members of Kwigogo collectively guarantee the loan.
Esther, who is raising her hand in the picture, is the chairperson of the group. She's been a member of this group since 2010. She is 55 years old and is married with five children who go to school. The loan from Kiva will help her acquire farm inputs which would enable her to harvest higher yields. Esther, just like other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre. She will grow maize in 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to join a saving and loaning scheme to save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus. This will give her more financial independence and help her absorb financial shocks in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Mavuno B Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of four farmers, called Mavuno B, based in the Kuria West district of Kenya. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.
The person raising his hand in the picture is Peter. He is 26 years old and married with one child. Peter has joined this group for the first time and hopes the production on his farm will go up due to the extension services he is going to receive through this group. He is very excited about the 2014 long rains.
Peter has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rain seasons.  He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase the farm inputs. He believes that the use of farm inputs will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to invest in dairy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Kengate A Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of five farmers called Kengate A, which is based in the Kuria West district of Kenya. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up her hand is Beatrice. She is 42 years old and married with eight children; five who attend school. Beatrice has been a member of the group for three years, and she is the group’s chairperson.

Beatrice has been learning better farming methods within her group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on her farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. She is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable her to purchase the farm inputs. She believes that the use of farm inputs will increase her yields, and she will not only get enough food for her large family, but will also sell the surplus and invest in a business to obtain money to pay for her children’s school fees and other domestic uses.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past four years. She knows the stitching techniques very well. She sews garments for nearby factories and her husband brings the clothes to the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has became out of order due to continuous use. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

Rehana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Rehana has her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, lace, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a 43-year-old lady who lives with her spouse and 7 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is a responsible mother with 2 young dependent children. She wants to save money to provide a better standard of living for her children, but it seems impossible because of her low income. She belongs to a very poor family and needs to feed her huge family. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years.  His income is insufficient to feed his family. His auto rickshaw needs to be repaired and maintained, but he does not have enough cash to fix the problem.   Therefore, Rani requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can repair his auto rickshaw. 

Rani hopes that she will be able to save money until her children are grown.  She wishes to  provide a higher education for her children.

loans.use: to repair and maintain the auto rickshaw used in their business.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 46-year-old lady who lives with her husband and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She requests a loan for her husband who drives a Moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is not powerful and is used for short distances. The polyester body is not strong enough to deal with rough road conditions and needs to be replaced.

Shagufta requests a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy a Moto rickshaw. 

She hopes that she would be able to save enough money to provide a higher education for her children. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled rickshaw.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 36-year-old house wife who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 4 children. Her husband's  restaurant business is the only source of income for the family. He provides a variety of food to his customers who love the food he cooks. 

He needs to purchase a variety of vegetables, chicken, and oil to cook food to sell in the restaurant. However, purchasing the supplies is difficult due to the lack of money. Therefore his wife, Parveen, requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to help her husband to purchase a variety of food items to sell. The profit will enable her husband to grow his business in the future. 

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, chicken, and oil to cook food to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 52 años de edad,  estudio hasta 3 grado de educación, esta soltera, desde hace 16 años se separó de su esposo y cada uno tomo caminos diferentes; ella se quedó con su 4 hijos luchando desde entonces para mantenerlos. Actualmente en casa, solo viven 2 de sus 4 hijos los otros dos están con sus propios  hogares.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco en el cantón, de donde ella es originaria. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde muy joven, su madre de ella le enseño esta actividad. También, tiene otra actividad económica  y es  la de cuidar a un niño pequeño en una casa de una vecina, de la misma comunidad de donde ella vive, para desempeñar el trabajo la cliente recorre  aproximadamente 5 kilómetros diariamente, para vender en el negocio se involucra una hija de ella.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más pescado, debido a que desea  abrir un puesto de venta de pescado en el depillo de su comunidad y no tener que andar vendiendo lejos de su casa. El préstamo mejorara su vida, porque evitara salir lejos exponiéndose a la delincuencia u otro peligro.

Sus sueños son tener su propio negocio, en un solo lugar hacer su casa de un material mejor; ya que actualmente es mixta y para su familia es que su hija que está estudiando saque una Carrera universitaria y se gradué y cumpla sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old and she got as far as the third grade in school. She is single: she and her husband separated 16 years ago and each followed different paths. She kept her four children and has been fighting since then to support them. Currently only two of her children live with her, as the other two have their own homes. 

She works selling fish in the canton where she is from. She has been doing this work since she was very young; her mother taught it to her. She also has another job taking care of a young boy in the house of a neighbor who lives in the same community as she does. To do this work she travels about five kilometers each day, and one of her daughters takes charge of selling in the business.

She is requesting a loan through the Fundación Campo to buy more fish, because she wants to open a stall in the community market so she doesn't have to travel so far from her home to sell it. The loan will improve her life, as she will be able to avoid going so far and exposing herself to crime and other dangers.

Her dream is to have her own business and to build her house in one place, from a better material, as it is currently of mixed materials. For her family, her dream is for her daughter who is in school to get a university degree, graduate, and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 32-year-old woman living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and, because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible however, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Ghazala has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 5 children.

She has taken a loan for her husband, who owns a shop in which he sells utensils. He wants to buy different kinds of knives as well, but his financial condition discourages him from making further purchases. 

Therefore, Suriya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase different kinds of knives such as paring knives, boning knives, carving forks, filleting knives, ham knives, steak knives, serrated bread knives, chef’s knives, etc. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of knives to sell

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 28-year-old house wife who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 4-children. Her husband's  food stall in the market  is the only source of income for the family. He is an expert cook and sells a variety of delicious vegetables and chicken in his shop. 

Asma's husband is interested in offering a larger variety of items to his customers.  This will help him increase his net income and savings as well. However, this is difficult due to the lack of money. Therefore his wife,Asma, requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase a variety of needed food items. Her husband wants to use the profits to expand his business in the future. 

Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of needed food items to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is a 55-year-old married women with four sons. Her husband owns a clothing business and sells a variety of ladies' dresses in the main market. He works vary hard to provide for his family's needs. 

He needs to purchase a variety of winter clothes to sell. However, this is a problem due to lack of funds. Therefore, Surriya requests a a loan from KIVA and their partner BRAC Pakistan. Surriya hopes that the loan will help her husband's business. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 40, is a mother of four children. Her husband's  embroidery shop is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a variety of new  embroidery material to resell. However, that is difficult due to a lack of money. This loan will help him to offer a greater variety to his customers and will enable him to continue to work efficiently and professionally. 

Nasreen requests a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.  He will purchase an embroidery machine and a variety of new embroidery materials. Nasreen is happy that she will be able to help her husband to acquire a loan. 

She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and a variety of new embroidery materials.

loans.name: Lourdes Marianella

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 21 años de edad, soltera y vive con sus padres en la calurosa ciudad de ICA. Lourdes es una persona muy responsable y empeñosa, ella trabaja como ayudante en el mercado de santo domingo, negocio el cual se dedica a la venta de tubérculos, Lourdes siempre brinda la mejor atención a sus clientes.
Lourdes está muy agradecida con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de una refrigeradora para su casa y de esta manera mantener sus alimentos en buen estado.
El sueño de Lourdes es formar su familia y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 21 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the warm city of Ica. Lourdes is a very responsible and dilligent person, and she works as an assistant in the Santo Domingo market, in a business that sells tubers. Lourdes always provides the best help to her clients. 

Lourdes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as she will invest the money in buying a refrigerator for her house so she can keep her food in good condition. Her dream is to have a family and own her own house.

loans.use: to buy household appliances

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta 4 grado, ya que sus padres eran pobres, y no tenían recursos para darle esa oportunidad, ademas no le tomaban importancia a que ella estudiara. Ahora esta casada, su esposo es albañil, y le ayuda en la elaboración del pan. Tienen 2 hijos, quines están casados y tienen su propia familia.

María tiene 26 años de dedicarse a la profesión de panadera. Oficio que aprendió gracias a que cierto día, una señora amiga suya y que era panadera la invito a que trabajara con ella en la elaboración de pan. Así fue, como poco a poco iba aprendió el oficio hasta que un día decidió poner su propia panadería. Comienza su día a los 2:00 am para preparar todos los materiales, e iniciar a hornear el pan, porque a la 1:00 pm, llega su hija para iniciar con la comercialización del mismo.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, huevos, levadura, bandejas donde colocar el pan, y otros materiales. 

Los sueños de María, son mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, la cual esta deteriorada, y necesita de una buena reparación. Ademas, sueña ampliar el negocio y tener una sala de ventas en el mercado de la cuidad.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and got as far as the 4th grade in school. Her parents were poor and didn't have resources to give her this opportunity, nor did they prioritize her education. Now she is married. her husband is a builder and he helps her make bread. They have two children, both of whom are married and have their own families. 

María has been a baker for 26 years. She learned the profession thanks to the fact that one day, a friend of hers who was already a baker invited María to work with her, baking bread. So, that was how, little by little, she learned the work, until one day she decided to set up her own bakery. She begins her day at 2:00AM to prepare everything and to start the bread baking, because at 1:00PM her daughter arrives to start selling it. 

The loan will be invested in buying flour, shortening, sugar, eggs, yeast, trays to put the bread on, and other supplies.

María's dreams are to improve her house, which has deteriorated and needs some good repairs. She also dreams of expanding her business and having a sales point in the city market.

loans.use: to buy flour,, shortening, sugar, eggs, yeast, trays to put bread on, and other supplies

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 32-year-old married woman living with her spouse and 3 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives by living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gent’s clothes. He has been running this business for many years and cherishes his whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not build up a good relationship among his customers, and this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.

Now, with the increase in their needs, they consider it necessary to grow the business, but the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband. Therefore, Mukhtaran took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase a more stylish variety of clothing so that he could attract his customers.
 
Mukhtaran thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 53-year-old woman living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and, because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, however, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Irshad is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 39-year-old mother of eight children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a religious, sympathetic, honest and hardworking lady. 

Her husband runs a small herbal store in a nearby town to  help the poor. He can provide the necessary herbal medicines to treat minor diseases for a low fee. This business earns income to run his household.

Samina's husband wants to buy herbal medicine in bulk but does not have enough capital to invest because a large part of his savings is needed for  household expenses.

Therefore, Samina requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy herbal medicines.  She hopes that the lenders will support this noble work.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicines to sell in their herbal store.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 41-year-old lady who lives with her six children in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son makes baked products such as bread, biscuits, and cakes at home to sell to the bakeries. Previously, her husband operated this business but now her son takes care of the business. Due to an increase in the prices of ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, and eggs, Shamim requests a loan for her son so that he can replenish his inventory.
  
Shamim thanks Kiva because they provide her with a beam of hope to modernize and improve her son's business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bakery products.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.  Don Julio trabajo por varios años en la empresa privada y al ser despedido ahora apoya a su esposa en su negocio. Hace 15 años estableció una pulpería con su esposa donde vende granos básicos, verduras, lácteos, embutidos, pastas, refrescos, pan, manteca, harina, etc.  Por motivo de la época navideña ha solicitado un préstamo por 30,000 lempiras para surtir de productos como carnes, pan, refrescos, recargas saldo para celulares, productos enlatados y otra mercadería para vender. Su meta a futuro es convertir la pulpería en una bodega para obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Julio is 47 years old, married, has four children, and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Julio worked for several years in the private sector, and now that he has been fired he helps his wife with their business. 15 years ago he and his wife started a small grocery where they sell staple foods, vegetables, dairy products, sausages, pastas, soft drinks, bread, lard, flour, etc. 

Because of the Christmas season, he has requested a loan of 30,000 HNL to stock up on products such as meats, bread, soft drinks, cell phone credit top-ups, canned products and other merchandise to sell. His future goal is to expand the store to make a better profit.

loans.use: to stock up on products such as meats, bread, soft drinks, cell phone credit top-ups, canned products and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
2013-251

	Banco Mujer Emprendedoras presenta la solicitud de crédito, por tercera oportunidad, está conformado por 9 mujeres,  quienes han trabajado desde hace 8 años como grupo organizado en Fray Casiano, zona  de alta pobreza en Puntarenas, Región del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica. Han  demostrando buen manejo de los conceptos de trabajo grupal (solidaridad, ahorro; además de coordinan actividades generando fondos),  tiene reglas claras de trabajo. Ellas han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.3 para la solicitud de este préstamo y la integración  de 1 compañera que había participado en el primer préstamo con Fundación Mujer también se da la salida de 1 integrante del  crédito anterior del Banco Mujer Emprendedoras.

 
	 Su trabajo y  esfuerzo les ha permitido tener la actividad de comercio ambulante  mejor consolidada, situación que se corrobora en la visita realizada a cada una de las solicitantes. 

Yesenia, integrante del grupo, invertirán su crédito  en la compra de sandalias, ropa, artículos de belleza y mercadería en general, incrementando su inventario  y cubriendo pedidos para la época de navidad  y fin de año, siendo una gran oportunidad para las ventas. Además, realizan ventas de comida y rifas que les permiten incrementar su ahorro y apoyar a sus familia en los gastos del hogar y estudio de los hijos, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes son madres solteras y jefas de hogar y su aporte económico es muy importante para la calidad de vida de ellas y la de sus hijos e hijas. 

	Yesenia es una  mujer muy luchadora y gracias a la organización interna del grupo logra realizar  la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal,  lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio para la obtención del dinero para el pago. Ella es la presidenta, la  consideran una buena líder  y   esperan contar con esté préstamo para seguir creciendo cada día.

	Son mujeres luchadoras, que por medio de la organización han logrado superarse y mejorar los ingresos de sus familias, apoyando  el estudio a sus hijos y a sus parejas contribuyendo  en la economía familiar, ellas han logrado hacerse sentir en la zona donde residen, son conocidas por sus actividades de fin de semana, donde vende comidas en la comunidad dando trabajo a otras personas (familiares principalmente)para la elaboración de estos platillos, típicos de la zona costera costarricense, como vigoron, frito, ceviche y los tamales comida típica costarricense de la navidad.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras

Fray Casiano, Puntarenas

2013-251
The communal bank Mujer Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women] presents its third loan request. This group consists of 9 women who have worked for 8 years as an organised group in Fray Casiano, an area of great poverty in Puntarenas, in the central Pacific region of Costa Rica. They have shown a good understanding of the concepts of group work: solidarity, saving, as well as coordinating activities to generate funds. They have clear rules on the work. The women have asked for loans and understand the working of the group model. They have a board of directors and the documents were prepared to request this third loan, to have one new companion join who had participated in the first loan with Fundación Mujer, as well as have one woman leave who took part in the former loan with the communal bank Mujer Emprendedoras. Their hard work and effort has allowed each of them to be better street merchants; this fact was evidenced during a visit with each one of the members.

Yesenia is a member of the group and she will invest her loan in buying sandals, clothes, beauty products and general merchandise, thus increasing her inventory and meeting orders placed during Christmas and New Year, which is a great opportunity for sales. In addition, these women sell food and raffles, which allows them to increase their saving and support their family with the household costs and with their children's education, since the majority of the members are single mothers and heads of their household, and their economic support is very important to their own quality of life as well as to that of their sons and daughters.

Yesenia is a tenacious woman and, thanks to the internal organisation of the group, she manages the weekly repayments which allows them more leeway to obtain money for repaying the loan. She is the president of the group and they consider her a good leader and hope to get this loan in order to continue growing daily. They are hard-working women who have managed to succeed and improve their families' incomes by means of this group. They support their children's studies and support their partners with the family costs. They have managed to make their presence felt in the area where they live and are known for their weekend activities, when they sell food in the community. This gives work to others (mainly family members) through the preparation of these dishes which are typical of the coastal area of Costa Rica. They include vigorón (boiled yuca or cassava mixed with crunchy pork rinds and covered with a spicy cabbage coleslaw). traditional pig soup, shellfish and tamales, which is a sort of steam-cooked corn dough and often served at Christmas.

loans.use: to buy sandals, clothing, beauty products, and general merchandise.

loans.name: Abundio

texts.en: Abundio is a young entrepreneur who provides motor transport services in his community. In the three years since he's been in business, Abundio has earned enough money to support his parents. He was able to repay his previous loan used for his motor transport business. Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to repair his motorcycle. He always finds ways to augment his living. He plans to use his profits to acquire a new motorbike for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Amily

texts.en:
Amily works hard to support her family. Amily is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Amily has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Amily has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Amily would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Estevania

texts.en: Estevania is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as kitchen tools including buckets, dish racks, pots, spoons, plates and so on. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $30. Estevania is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy kitchen tools such as buckets, dish racks, pots, spoons, plates and so on.

loans.name: Juntos Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
María, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en una aldea del municipio de Lepaera, Lempira junto a sus dos hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura  y hace 10 años cultiva  café. Esta producción  la vende a los intermediarios y a los beneficios de café de la zona. Ha solicitado otro préstamo que es el quinto ciclo y es por 20,000 lempiras, con los cuales va comprar fertilizantes para darle mayor asistencia a los cultivos de café con el fin de aumentar la cosecha, sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida. 
El préstamo es en forma grupal y es por 53,000 Lempiras, con el cual van a comprar fertilizantes y sembrar mas café. El grupo se llama Juntos al Desarrollo y lo forman tres personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de café, en la foto se encuentra a la izquierda don José, Iván y María a la derecha.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in a village in the Lepaera municipality in Lempira.  María has spent all her life working in agriculture and, for ten years, she has been growing coffee.  She sends her product to intermediaries and coffee processing plants in the area.  María has applied for her fifth loan, of 20,000 Lempira.  With this loan she will buy fertilisers to help her coffee crops.  Her aim in this is to increase her harvest and her income, and to improve her quality of life.

This is a group loan for 53,000 Lempira.  It will be used to buy fertilisers and a to sow more coffee.  The group is called "Juntos al Desarroll" and is made up of three people who live in the same community.  The three members all grow coffee.  In the photo, from left to right, are José, Iván, and María.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers for coffee crops and to plant more coffee.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, ya que su madre no le pudo dar la oportunidad de continuar estudiando, dado que su esposo los abandonosy ella cubría con todos los gastos del hogar.

 Manuel esta acompañado, su esposa es comerciante, tienen dos hijos y ya asisten a la escuela.


Manuel inicio a trabajar desde los 15 años, en una fabrica artesanal de ladrillos, en ese lugar trabajo aproximadamente 12 años, y se retiro dado que sufría frecuentemente de infecciones en las vías urinarias. Sin embargo, el dueño de la ladrillera, lo recomendó con un amigo, que posee una venta de granos básicos y Manuel ingreso a trabajar en ese lugar, ya tiene cuatro años de estar laborando como vendedor de granos básicos. El recorrido de su casa al lugar de trabajo, es de 4 km de distancia, y los recorre en su bicicleta, su horario de trabajo es de 8 am a 5 pm.


El  préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir un muro de contención, a lo largo de su terreno, ya que cerca de su vivienda, corre una creciente de agua, y en las épocas de invierno, el peligro aumenta, por la gran cantidad de agua que baja de las áreas mas altas. La necesidad que lograra cubrir Manuel, es reducir el peligro, de que una corriente de agua, ingrese a su vivienda y alguno de sus familiares sufra un accidente.


La planificación de Manuel, es ayudar a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando, ademas de eso, tiene las intenciones de seguir con sus estudios de educación básica, los fines de semana. También de su trabajo, cancelar el crédito para así; optar nuevamente a un crédito, para cumplir otros de sus sueños, el cual es tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 32 years old and only completed up to sixth grade at school as his mother could not help him to keep studying.  Manuel's father abandoned the family and Manuel's mother had to cover all household costs.

Manuel is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children, both of whom are in school.

Manuel started working in an artisan brick factory at the age of 15.  He stayed there for around 12 years but had to leave as he frequently suffered from urinary tract infections.  However, the owner of the brick factory recommended Manuel to a friend who sold basic grains and Manuel started to work with him.  Manuel has now been selling grains there for four years.  From his home to work, Manuel must travel four kilometres, a distance he covers on his bicycle.  He works from 8am until 5pm.

Manuel is applying for a loan in order to build a retaining wall all along his his property as nearby there is a growing river and, in the winter, the risk of flooding increases as the water flows down from higher altitudes.  Manuel needs to reduce the dangers posed by this water, so that it does not enter his house and result in someone in his family suffering an accident.

Manuel plans to help his children to continue studying.  In addition he intends to continue with his own basic education at the weekend.  Manuel wants to pay off this loan so that he can take out another in order to achieve other dreams, one of which is to have his own business.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall all along his his property as nearby there is a growing river.

loans.name: Erika Yaned

texts.es: Erika, es una mujer campesina que desde pequeña se ha dedicado a realizar las tareas del campo, que sus padres le enseñaron. Gracias a ello, hoy en día posee ganado lechero cuya producción es vendida ya sea de manera líquida o transformada en cuajada y quesos, lo que le genera los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su familia, que está conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
