Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una vaca productora de leche que le están vendiendo a buen precio y que podría aumentar la producción con 50 litros de líquido diariamente, esto le da la oportunidad de vender más producto y por lo tanto recibir mejores ingresos para su familia. Erika con su empuje y perseverancia, desea seguir trabajando arduamente para cumplir cada uno de sus sueños como poder adquirir más cabezas de ganado lechero y así poder ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a otras personas del sector; lo que para ella significaría lograr que su negocio sea más rentable, lo que le permitirá asegurar un futuro más próspero y exitoso para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erika is a farmer who has been working off the land since she was young, having been taught by her parents. Thanks to this, she now owns dairy cattle whose products she sells, be it milk or curds and cheese. This generates enough of an income to support her family, comprised of her husband and her two children who she has brought up with effort and dedication. 

Erika is currently requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow which is being sold at a good price. With this purchase she can increase her yield to 50 litres of milk daily, which would give her the opportunity to sell more products and receive a greater income for her family. With her drive and perseverance Erika would like to keep working hard to make every one of her dreams reality, such as acquiring more heads of dairy cattle to offer employment opportunities to other people in the region. For her this would make her business more profitable and ensure a more profitable and successful future for her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Aida

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de las Vegas Santa Bárbara junto a su nieta. Lleva 10 años de tener su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, manteca, azúcar, refrescos, churros, productos de aseo, enlatados, pan, verduras condimentos  etc. Para mantener activo su negocio ha solicitado varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el sexto ciclo en la institución y es por 16,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar granos básicos, azúcar, lácteos, refrescos, churros, manteca, pan y otros para surtir el negocio y aumentar la ventas en esta temporada navideña. Su plan es mantener el negocio activo y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and single, having been widowed. She has one son and lives in the council of las Vegas Santa Barbara with her granddaughter. She has run her own grocery store for 10 years where she sells food items such as grains and legumes, butter, sugar, soft drinks, churros, cleaning products, canned food, bread, vegetables, condiments, etc. 

To keep her business afloat Maria has requested various loans and she is currently in her sixth loan cycle with the institution. She has requested 16,000 lempiras to buy grains and legumes, sugar, dairy products, soft drinks, churros, butter, bread and other items with which to re-stock her business and increase her sales over the Christmas period. Her plan is to keep her business afloat and make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy grains and legumes, sugar, dairy products, soft drinks, churros, butter, bread and other items to re-stock her store

loans.name: Shreefan

texts.en:
Shreefan is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. 

She has ten years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María Esperanza es una señora muy emprendedora y luchadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante de 35 años de edad la cual es casada y madre de 3 hijos quienes viven bajo su mismo techo 2 de ellos están en la escuela de la comunidad cursando diferentes grados de educación y al salir de sus actividades escolares colaboran con sus padres en el campo. María Esperanza aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura por medio de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura y venta de café desde hace más de 8 años. Sus clientes son los compradores directos (beneficios) quienes se encargar posteriormente de revender a otros mercados tanto nacionales como internacionales. La tierra que trabajan en compañía de su esposo y su hijo es propia gracias al esfuerzo que ellos han hecho para no trabajar ajeno estando ubicados sus cultivos a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando.
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos en un mejor futuro, con mejores oportunidades, mejores condiciones de vida para que pueda apoyar a sus familias, generar mayores ingresos para cubrir lo necesario y más. Sus metas seguir ampliando más sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra y sembrar más plantilla de café con lo cual generara mayores ingresos. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual asistirá sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
María Esperanza is a very entrepreneurial and hard working woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She is 35, married and mother to three children who live under her roof. Two of them are in the community school in different grades and, upon finishing their school work, collaborate with their parents in the countryside. María Esperanza learned her job and farm work from her husband who has been dedicated to farming and selling coffee for more than 8 years. Their customers are the direct buyers who are later in charge of reselling to other national and international markets. The land that she works in the company of her husband and son is her own thanks to the efforts they have made to not work outside. Their crops are located 3km from their house which they walk to.

She dreams of seeing her children with a better future, with better opportunities and better quality of life so that they can support their families, generate greater income to cover what they need and more. Her goals are to keep expanding more her coffee crops through the purchase of more land and sowing more coffee plants with which she will earn more. So today, she is requesting a loan with which she will tend to her crops giving better assistance to implement agricultural inputs like fertilizers, coffee formula, fungicides that prevent the contamination of vermin and illnesses.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like fertilizer, foliar fertilizer, urea etc. to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ingrid Anayancy

texts.es:
Ingrid de 29 años de edad, estudio solamente hasta 4º grado, porque en esos días, estaba en auge el conflicto armado que se vivía en el país y por motivos de seguridad, sus padres prefirieron, no mandarla a estudiar. Actualmente, esta casada y tiene una hija de 4 años. En su casa viven sus padres, pero ellos no dependen de ella.

Ingrid, tiene un negocio de tortilleria, el cual tiene 5 años de estarlo trabajando, a lo largo de estos años a ganado muchos clientes, quienes todos los días se acercan, para comprar dicho producto, el cual es indispensable en la dieta diaria de los salvadoreños. Este actividad la aprendió de su madre, recuerda que cuando estaba pequeña su madre preparaba la masa, para elaborar las tortillas y ella se acercaba para ayudarle. Ingrid, solo se ha dedicado a este negocio, su madre también se involucra para ayudarle en el negocio, el cual esta ubicado en su casa y tiene dos horarios de trabajo al día, el primero es de 10:30 am hasta 1:00 pm y de 4:00 pm hasta las 5.30 pm.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para remodelar la vivienda, ya que a causa de los terremotos que ocurrieron en el país, quedo grandemente destruida y no ha podido repararla por completo. Con el préstamo, se ayudara a que  Ingrid y su familia habiten en buenas condiciones.

Como toda madre, ella tiene planificado brindarle todo el apoyo a su hija, desea que se supere  y que no atraviese las dificultades que a tenido que pasar. También desea, seguir en el negocio y así poder cancelar el crédito, para tener acceso a futuros créditos, los cuales ayudaran a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 29, only studied up to fourth grade  since in those days the armed conflict in her country was booming and for security reasons, her parents preferred to not send her to school. Currently, she is married and has one 4 year old daughter. Her parents live in her house but they are not dependent on her.

Ingrid has a tortilla business which has been operating for five years. Over the years she has gained many customers who come every day to buy said product which is indispensable in the daily diet of Salvadorans. She learned this work from her mother. She remembers that when she was little, her mother prepared the dough to make the tortillas and she came to help her. Ingrid is dedicated only to this business. Her mother also engages to help her in the business, which is located in her house and has two operating hours. The first is from 10:30AM to 1PM and then from 4PM to 5:30PM.

The loan will be used to remodel the house since due to the earthquakes that occurred in the country, it was left greatly destroyed and she has not been able to repair it completely. The loan will help Ingrid and her family to live in good conditions.

Like all mothers, she has a plan to provide all the support to her daughter. She wishes that she gets ahead and does not face the difficulties that she had to confront. Also, she wishes to continue with the business and be able to repay the loan and to have access to future loans which will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to remodel her house since due to the earthquakes that occurred in the country, hers was left greatly destroyed and she has not been able to fix it completely.

loans.name: Industrial Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Industrial Poty solicita su préstamo del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, la cual encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente.
La Sra. Wilma es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una pequeña Despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy entrada la noche. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y poco a poco poder crecer en su negocio y seguir luchando por su familia y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en productos varios para la venta, como ser carne, verduras, hortalizas, frutas y demás, y de esa forma seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group Industrial Poty is requesting its first loan in the women entrepreneurs program. They are from the city of Curuguaty, which is growing. This is the reason the members of this group want to fight to continue its growth and give the area where they live a better environment.

Wilma is one of the members. She has a small store where she works every day from the early hours of the morning until very late in the night. Her goal is to continue working and little by little grow her business and continue striving for her family as well as provide work to other people.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in various products for sale such as beef, vegetables, and fruits among others. This way she can continue working.

loans.use: to purchase beef, vegetables, and fruits among other items.

loans.name: Mayda Antonia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza.
En este lugar vive  la señora Mayda,  tiene 43 años, está casada  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos dos hijos de 20, 17 y 8 años de edad, todos estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo tiene una lubricadora y lavadora de carros.
Doña Mayda y su esposo trabajan juntos en su negocio,tienen una lubricadora y lavadora de carros,el se dedica a lavar y cambiar de aceite a los vehículos mientras ella ahí mismo vende toda clase de repuestos, llantas y lubricantes. Les ayudan dos personas a quienes les pagan un sueldo mensual, tienen muchos años este negocio y es lo que les permite salir adelante.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como siempre logran surtir de mercadería su local, con sus ganancias como siempre son para los alimentos y todo lo necesario para  el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos. Este crédito es para comprar llantas, lubricantes y otros repuestos de carros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 15 años y le gusta por los beneficios que le dan en la institución.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its breathtaking views and its beautiful pools of fresh water which are visited by many tourists, the members of the New Hope Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

In this place lives Mayda, who is 43 years old and married. She and her husband have three children ages 20, 17 and 8, who study in the university, high school, and primary school. Her husband has an oil change and car wash business. 

Mayda and her husband work together in her business, which is an oil change/ car wash business. Her husband is in charge of completing the aforementioned tasks and she works selling the lubricants, oil, tires, and other spare car parts. They are assisted by two other people, whom they pay a monthly salary. They´ve had this business for many years and it is helping them get ahead.

She will use this loan to purchase tires, lubricants, and spare car parts. She has been part of the communal bank for more than 15 years and she enjoys it because of the benefits the organization provides.

loans.use: to purchase tires, lubricants, and spare parts for automobiles.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela de 52 años de edad  posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en el lugar donde ella reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vede las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; Adela es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia y todo eso lo hace para que ella y sus hijos  puedan tener una mejor vida, es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos , ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Adela  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: Adela is 52 years old and owns a tortilla-making business which is very well known in her area. She has a lot of customers because she sells the most delicious, hot tortillas, with the quickest service, and at very affordable prices. Adela is an enterprising woman who dreams of success, which is why she always remains one step ahead of the competition, all so that she and her children can have a better life. She is a single mother who lives in a rented home with her two children. She wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy wholesale maize. Adela hopes that this will allow her to provide her household with financial stability and offer her family fulfilling lives.

loans.use: to buy wholesale maize.

loans.name: Zakara

texts.en:
Zakara is a 44-year-old married woman and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a bookstore in which he sells stationery items, pencils, books and registers and copies. He has maintained many contacts with the schools, colleges and academic institutions, who refer their students to his bookstore. His demand for stationery items, copy paper and lead pencils has increased; this is the reason why he wants to keep more stock in his bookstore. But the major problem is that he does not have enough funds to buy more stock for his bookstore. 

Therefore, Zakara requested a loan from Kiva’s field Partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy more stock for his bookstore.

Zakara seems very happy after taking out this loan; she thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part to support her.

loans.use: To buy various books and stationery and make copies to sell in their bookstore.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is 51 years old married woman. She runs a small beauty parlor in the corner of her home with the help of her daughter. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  

Over time Khursheed has attracted a regular list of customers who help her earn income to support her family. She needs more customers. 

It is for this reason that Khursheed requests a loan of Rs. 40,000 through Kashf Foundation to buy more hair and skin care products.  

Khursheed is confident that her business will improve as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy more hair and skin care products.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga runs a general store in their community and she earns well for the family and has been repaying her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. Dominga always find ways to augment their living and is faithful in managing her business in order to support her husband's income. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She wants to use the additional revenue as working capital to gain multiple income sources.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married. Her husband is a welder. Mary Jane manages a hog raising business, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns a net income of 3,500 PHP per hog. Her profits are used for their food expenses and capital for her direct selling business, which she operates to earn additional income. 

Mary Jane wants to improve her business but does not have enough capital, so she is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase hog feeds. She hopes that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds.

loans.name: Felipe Ariel

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 56 años y vive en la ciudad de Camaná, Trabaja como agricultor en su pequeña parcela en la cual siembra variedades de cultivos, lo cual le permite llevar un sustento para su hogar.

Felipe está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo Felipe podrá comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, entre otros para poder sembrar y poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo y así poder seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un fundo agrícola”.
texts.en:
Felipe is 56 years old and lives in the city of Camaná. He works as a farmer on his small plot, where he sows a variety of crops, which allows him to earn a living for his household.

Felipe is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support, Felipe will be able to buy compost, fertilizer, and seeds, among others, to be able to plant and maintain his crops and therefore continue working and fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have a farming business".

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, and seeds, among others.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Restituta works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling firewood and bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Restituta is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood and bananas to sell.

Restituta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and bananas to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a farmer who hails from Ndaragwa, an area with a very cool climate. She is married, has two children, and has been farming for three years. Her primary income comes from producing and selling milk, eggs, and crops like vegetables and cereals. In farming, she enjoys dairy farming because of the high milk production from her cows.

Cecilia chose Juhudi Kilimo for funding because they help farmers in acquiring asset finances so that farmers can be able to change their livelihood. This loan will help Cecilia to expand her dairy farm and add more cows which in turn will produce more milk, and that will give her more income.This will improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, age 41, is a mother of four children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market. It is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of embroidery products in his shop, including a variety of colourful thread, cloth, etc. Presently the stock of his shop is almost finished. Therefore, he needs to purchase a variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money, he finds this difficult. 

For that reason, Salma, a member of two-person borrowing group, has requested a loan to help her husband. This will help him to continue his work and to continue generating income to sustain his family. Salma is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of embroidery materials to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una mujer joven, que para apoyar al presupuesto familiar, lograr independencia económica,y poder superarse ,ella vende productos por catálogo en su comunidad y barrios aledaños.
Ella atiende las labores domésticas en las mañanas y después del medio día, hasta como a las seis de la tarde, coloca sus productos, y cobra.
Ella vive en una comunidad rural, en la cual casi ni haay fuentes de trabajo asalariadas, por lo que la venta informal de productos es una alternativa de genaración de ingresos.
Laura es una gran vendedora, que ha dado su habilidad y esfuerzo a otras personas de su comunidad, que le brindan la mercadería, pero el margen de ganancia es reducido, por lo que ella ve como oportunidad ei accesar a un crédito, que le permitirá tener un pequeño capital propio y así incrementar el margen de ganancia y contar con inventario variado y acorde a las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Laura is a young woman who sells catalogue items in her neighbourhood and in nearby areas in order to help out with the family's budget and to achieve economic independence and get on in life. She does the domestic chores in the mornings and from midday until 6pm she sets out her products and collects payments. She lives in a rural community where there are hardly any sources of salaried work, which means that informally selling products is an alternative method of generating income.

Laura is a good saleswoman who has passed on her skill and effort to other people in her community so they can offer her goods, but her profit margin is reduced, which is why she sees getting a loan as an opportunity which would allow her to have a small amount of capital of her own. This would increase her profit margins and permit a more varied inventory that would cater to her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy products for catalogue sales such as clothing, items for personal use and household goods.

loans.name: Marsilineth

texts.es: Lineth es una joven de 21 años de edad, soltera, se dedica al comercio desde hace dos años, esto lo aprendió gracias a su novio que le ha apoyado desde el principio. Por el momento su cuñado la lleva en carro a distribuir la mercadería y su novio que tiene amplio conocimiento le ayuda a comprar los artículos solicitados por su clientela. Ella necesita este dinero para comprar diferente mercadería que ya le han encargado. Esto le ayudara a superarse como persona con el propósito de continuar estudiando, crecer con su actividad productiva y tener un vehículo para transportarse ella sola, ya que se siente capaz de realizar las ventas ella sola. Eligió Fundación Mujer porque tiene un trato personalizado y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Lineth is a young single woman of 21. She has been in business for two years. She learned this thanks to her boyfriend who has supported her since the beginning. Presently her brother-in-law drives her to distribute her merchandise and her boyfriend who has a lot of knowledge helps her to buy the items requested by clients.

Lineth needs a loan to buy various merchandise that people have ordered. This will allow her to better herself with the goal of continuing her studies. She wants to increase her productive activity and have a vehicle to drive herself as she feels she can make the sales by herself. She chose Fundación Mujer because of it's personal service and lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to re-sell.

loans.name: Arely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arely, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo, en casa de alquilada, para apoyar en los gastos familiares de su hogar, inicio por cuenta propia el negocio de comedor, ya tiene un año realizando dicha actividad y poco a poco su negocio va creciendo.
Invertirá en la compra de aceite, gas propano, frijol, arroz, carnes, embutidos, bebidas, etc., esto le ayudara a continuar preparando los diferentes tipos de comida que ofrece a sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar las ganancias para tener ingresos extras que utilizara para cancelar las cuotas de deuda.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia para dar a su familia un ambiente mucho más seguro.
texts.en:
Arely is married and lives with her husband in a rented house. In order to help with the household expenses she start a small eatery on her own initiative. She has had one year's experience doing this and little by little her business is growing.

Arely will invest in the purchase of oil propane, beans, rice, meat, sausages, drinks, etc. This will help her continue to prepare the various types of meals she offers to her clients. She hopes to increase her sales and her revenue so she can have extra income which she will use to pay off the loan. Her dream is to have her own house to give her family a safer environment.

loans.use: to buy oil, propane, beans, rice, meat, sausages, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a resident of a rural village called Sahapara in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri . She is a 41-year-old woman, married to Niranjan who is 48 years old and engaged in a small business. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. They are raising two sons who are students of grades 11 and grade 9 respectively. They live in their own kachha house (a house made of straw, mud and wood).

Dipali's husband is a contractor and takes orders to repair apartments.  Dipali is involved in sewing at home and sews different types of women's dresses and sells them in the local market. The husband and wife together, somehow, manage the household expenses.

Dipali has a very old sewing machine that causes inconvenience for her work.  Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a new sewing machine.  Dipali wants to expand her business and sew modern dresses.  Obviously, these dresses will cost more than ordinary ones, and her income will increase.

Dipali's goals are to give additional financial support to her family, give better education to her children, and expand her business with the profit generated from this business.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 42-year-old woman from the village of Petkati in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is married and raising three sons together with her spouse. She and her husband both attended school up to grade 8.  Their sons are receiving education in grades 12, 10, and 10 respectively. They have a small kachha house (a house made of straw, bamboo, mud etc.)

Kalpana's husband, aged 57 years, is doing a small job under a building contractor.  His income is too low to cover the basic needs of their family. To help her husband Kalpana is involved in animal husbandry.  She has been involved in this business for five years. Through hard work in her business now she has two dairy cows. She supplies milk to her neighbors and thus earns money. Yet she is unable to give sufficient financial sustenance to her family.

Kalpana has applied for this loan from BJS to purchase another cow to start up a dairy products business; selling products like butter, paneer (fresh cheese), curd, etc.  The products have a good demand in the present market.

She dreams of earning a lot of profit from this business to fulfill her dreams like educating her children properly, supporting her family financially, and purchasing more cows to expand her business.

Kalpana and her husband are grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for helping them.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and start a milk products business .

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan, age 51, is a married woman. She has done hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to attract a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.  Gulshan is in her 8th loan cycle with good credit history. 

In this way, Gulshan will be able to cater to more customers consistently.  She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.  

Gulshan dreams for her children's bright future and also desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a married woman who has managed a beauty parlor for two years.  She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Because of the excellence of her work Nargis has become very famous in on her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, Nargis is interested in buying more cosmetics products for her beauty parlor.  But because of her low amount of cash on hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 50,000.

Nargis is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. She expects to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Sakin Bibi

texts.en:
Sakina is a 39 year old hard working woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of one child.  

Her husband owns an academy that currently needs furniture for students.  Its old furniture is in very bad condition. He doesn't have enough savings to purchase furniture for the academy.  Therefore Sakina has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. 

She hopes that the loan would be helpful to her husband's academy.  Sakina dreams to provide a quality education to her child. She is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for husband's academy.

loans.name: Mugdlain

texts.en:
Mugdlain is a 48 year-old married woman who makes shoes.  She makes shoes in beautiful colors, designs and sizes at home and then sells them to the people in her community at reasonable prices. 

Mugdlain has a regular list of customers and makes enough income to support her family.  To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Mugdlain requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase leather, plastic soles and heels in different sizes along with spools of thread in various colors to increase her production. 

The loan will help her handle the growing demand for her shoes and enable her to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase leather, plastic soles and heels in different sizes along with spools of thread.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for the people of her community for many years.  Kausar uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the demands of her customers.  For this reason Kausar requests a loan of Rs 50,000 from the Kashf Foundation.  Kausar is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good credit history. 

Kausar intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela, de 69 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, es viuda y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en una casa propia la cual construyo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. El trabajo de Ángela consiste en la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche, papel higiénico, azúcar, aceite y otros productos para el hogar como sábanas, ollas, sartenes, bandejas y otros. Su tienda está instalada en el frontis de su casa y es la única de su barrio por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas y sus ganancias económicas estables. Lleva trabajando en esta activad mas de 10 años. Se inició vendiendo productos en pequeñas cantidades, ahora vende mucho más y le va muy bien,ya que tiene muchos clientes, le agrada disponer de su tiempo ya que así puede cuidar a sus menores hijos, se siente satisfecha siendo ella misma quien genera su fuente laboral es por eso que desea seguir adelante y con el paso del tiempo establecer una tienda muy amplia para que exhiba mejor sus productos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y huevos para que continúe vendiendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Ángela, age 69, is a kind and hardworking woman.  She is a widow and has children, two of whom who are already living independently.  She lives in her own house, which she built with a lot of effort and work.  Ángela’s work consists in the sale of grocery items such as rice, sugar, milk, toilet paper, sugar, oil, and other products for the home such as sheets, pots, frying pans, trays, and others.  Her store is set up in the front room of her house.  It is the only one in the neighborhood, so her sales are assured and her earnings are stable.  She has worked in this job for more than ten years.  She began selling products in small quantities; now she sells much more and it is going really well for her.  

She has the help of her husband, with whom she organizes her working day.  It is going really well for her because she has a lot of customers. She likes to arrange her time because in that way she can care for her young children. She is satisfied being the source of her own work. It is because of this that she wants to keep getting ahead and with the passing of time establish a very large store so that she can display her products better.  At this opportunity, she is asking for 1000 soles.  She is very happy to know that she will have this financial support, because in this way she will feel more secure moving forward with her business.  At the same time, she is committed to making her payments on time.  With this loan, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, and eggs so that she can continue selling them in her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, sugar, milk, and eggs

loans.name: Heyne Antonio

texts.es:
Heyne es un joven de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos,el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Heyne se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Contabilidad.

Por iniciativa propia, Heyne trabaja como asistente contable en una empresa consultora de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.

Heyne se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que podra comprar  materiales de construccion y realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea mejorar el techado y ponerle piso a su hogar, de esta manera el y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Heyne seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Heyne is a young man of 21.  He is single and he lives in the city of Pucallpa with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic and he has a great desire to better himself.  Thanks to his hard work and his parents' support, Heyne is pursuing a degree in accounting.  

On his own initiative, Heyne works as an assistant accountant at a consulting business in his city.  He works every day for around eight hours and he believes it is going well because of his dedication and good work.  

Heyne is very thankful to Kiva's lendersm as it is thanks to the help they have offered that he will make buy construction materials to make improvements to his home, as he wants to improve the roof and install a floor in his home.  This will make his family safer and improve their wellbeing.  Heyne will keep working and applying himself to achieve his great dream of becoming a real professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés de 42 años es una persona  muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicado a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que lo buscan y lo prefieren. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Andrés is 42 years old and is well-known in his area for his modesty and dedication to his work. He has never given up and has always overcome his difficulties. He lives in his own home with his partner and their children. With hard work and dedication he owns a shop in which he sells household goods such as basic grains, milk, eggs, rice, and other items. He is very dedicated to his job and offers good customer service, which is why he has customers who come to him especially and who prefer him. 

He has found that he needs to restock his shop due to an increase in demand and he doesn't have the capital to do so, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as basic grains, instant products, sweets, drinks, etc. He has faith that the help he is requesting will be delivered quickly, and that he will no longer have to worry about supporting his household on a daily basis.

loans.use: to but more merchandise such as basic grains, instant products, sweets, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Doña blanca de 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar,  Blanca es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca is 59 years old, and lives in her own home with her family. Blanca is a very responsible, hard-working woman, who has managed to move forwards with her family. She has a shop in her home selling foodstuffs such as bread, soft drinks, oil, vegetables, fruit, sweets, and other basic items such as soap and shampoo. 

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more stock for her store, so that she can better serve her customers and in this way increase her sales, which is a priority in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, oil, vegetables, fruit, sweets, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es: El señor Irineo de 32 años de edad, vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijas pequeñas, su domicilio está ubicado en el Municipio de Colomi, está trabajando en el arreglo y mantenimiento de un taller eléctrico de vehículos, cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en el rubro, Actualmente solicita un crédito de Bs. 6000 para comprar repuestos(Focos, fusibles, filtros, agua destilada, liquido, bocinas, enchufes, fusibles, correas, cables, bujías, octana, botequines, extinguidores, etc.), para su taller electrico, con el cual podrá mejorar el desarrollo de su actividad y además ofrecer más productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Irineo is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two young daughters.  His home is located in the town of Colomi.  Irineo works by repairing and maintaining electrical systems in vehicles.  He has 10 years of experience in this line of work. 

Irineo is currently requesting a loan of 6,000 BOB to buy spare parts (lamps, fuses, filters, wiper fluid,  speakers, plugs, belts, cables, plugs, octane, first aid kits and fire extinguishers, etc.) for his electric workshop.  This will promote the development of his business and also enable him to offer more products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts (lamps, fuses, filters, etc.) for his electric workshop

loans.name: Floresita

texts.en:
Floresita is 57 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Floresita is borrowing 7,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Floresita has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: San Jose De Tarros Group

texts.es:
Hector, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Nueva Frontera. Hector tiene un terreno donde realiza sus cultivos agrícolas, lleva tres años cultivando una fruta cítrica que se llama Maracuyá, esta fruta la procesa, saca el jugo y lo vende por libras. El anteriormente solo se dedicaba a cultivar maíz y frijoles, ahora abrió otro mercado. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonar el cultivo, también para comprar alambre para el ramal donde se guía la planta de maracuyá. Su plan es incrementar la producción y crecer con este tipo de cultivo para ayudar a su familia con las utilidades. 
Este préstamo lo ha solicitado en forma grupal con tres miembros más quienes también han solicitado 10,000 cada uno haciendo un total grupal de 40,000 lempiras.
 El grupo se llama San Jose de Tarros, los cuatro se dedican a la agricultura y cultivo de maracuyá y viven en la misma comunidad, en la foto se identifican de izquierda a derecha: a la izquierda esta José luego esta Enrique, sigue Héctor y José Anain a la derecha.
texts.en:
Hector is 33 years old. He lives with his wife with whom he has two children and resides in the town of Nueva Frontera. Hector has a piece of land where he grows crops. For three years he has been cultivating a citrus fruit named Maracuya. This fruit is processed, juiced and sold by the pound. Previously he was only dedicated to growing maize and beans. Now he opened another market. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers to fertilize the crop, as well as to buy wire for the branches to guide the maracuya plant. His plan is to increase the production and grown with this type of farming to help his family with the profits.

He has requested this loan as a group with three more members who also have requested 10,000 each, making the group total 40,000 lempiras.

The group is called San Jose de Tarros. The four are dedicated to farming and growing maracuya and live in the same community. In the photo,from left to right is: Jose, Enrique, Hector and Jose Anain.

loans.use:
to buy fertilizers to fertilize the crop and buy 
wire for the branches to guide the plant.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, like gasoline. Francisca is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business, and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 37-year-old married woman. Her financial conditions are not good; she has to think many times to start any task. In fact, her husband newly started to drive a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike); earlier, he was doing a job as a laborer in a firm. 

This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear jerks over roads. Now, the rickshaw body is needing to be replaced because its rattled during driving. This is the reason she wants to buy a new body for the Moto Rickshaw. She requested a loan so that her husband can maintain the rickshaw body, so that he could drive it smoothly. 

Rukhsana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body to continue transportation services.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Meet Rose, a farmer living in the Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya. She is married and has two children. Farming is the main source of income for her family. She has done farming for 17 years; she produces and sells milk and eggs. She enjoys milk production most because there are good returns. The challenge she faces is that during prolonged seasons of drought, there is less production.

Rose chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their good loan terms and better services, and they also improve the livelihood of small farm holders. This loan will enable her to purchase a dairy cow and thus, increase milk production. This will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es:
María, necesita capital para comprar materia prima para su negocio, invertirá en la compra de leche, cuajada, maíz, pollo, arroz, etc., para elaborar atoles, y tamales, para continuar manteniendo activo su negocio y tener a sus clientes satisfechos.
El crédito anterior el ayudo a comprar la materia prima necesaria para elaborar sus productos, lo que le ha dado la oportunidad de tener clientes nuevos, tener una mejor economía, con lo que ha cancelado sus deudas y continua dando su apoyo a su familia.
texts.en:
María needs capital to buy raw material for her business. She will invest in buying milk, curd, corn, rice, chicken etc. to make atoles (a drink made from corn) and tamales. She wants to keep her business active and satisfy her customers.

She used the last loan to buy raw materials needed to make her products. This allowed her to gain new clients, improve her finances. She paid off her loan and continued to support her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, curd, corn, chicken, rice, etc.

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, necesita capital para surtir el inventario de su tienda, comprara frijoles, arroz, aceite, entre otros productos, para mejorar la variedad de productos en su negocio y satisfacer a los clientes.
El préstamo anterior le dio la oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y estabilizar su economía, su familia tiene un mejor estilo familiar y ha cancelado sus deudas
texts.en: Sara needs capital to stock her store. She will buy beans, rice, oil, etc to improve the variety of products in her store and to satisfy her customers. The last loan gave her the opportunity to increase her sales and stabilize her finances. She was able to give her family a better quality of life and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice and oil.

loans.name: Melvin Vladimir

texts.es:
Melvin, se ha decidido por otro crédito por la facilidad de pago que le da la institución, invertirá en la compra de carnes, aceite, bebidas y verduras, para que en esta época de fin de año su negocio sea competitivo y pueda tener mejores ganancias.
El capital anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio y continuar aportando en los gastos familiares, su economía es más estable, sus deudas se han reducido.
texts.en: Melvin has decided to request another loan given the ease of payment that Padecomsm offers him. He will invest it in buying meat, oil, drinks and vegetables. He wants his business to be competitive in this end of the year season and make more income. He used the last loan to strengthen his business and continue supporting the family's expenses. His finances are better and he has reduced his debt.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, drinks and vegetables.

loans.name: Karen Guadalupe

texts.es:
Karen, es una joven soltera, vive con su mamá, debido a la necesidad de tener más ingresos para utilizarlos en sus gastos personales y ayudar en los gastos familiares, se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios como sastre todos los días en su residencia, por lo que no representa ninguna dificultad.
Invertirá en surtir su inventario en esta temporada  comprando variedad telas, zippers, botones hilos, broches, etc., lo que dará mejores opciones para atender a sus clientes, espera atraer a más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener más ganancias.
Su sueño es instalar una sastrería para tener más ganancias y también dar oportunidad de empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Karen is a young single woman who lives with her mother.  Given her need for a higher income in order to cover personal expenses and to help with household costs, Karen works every day as a seamstress in her home.  She has no difficulties with this work.

Karen will invest this loan in stocking up her business for the season - she will buy a variety of material, zips, buttons, threads and fasteners, giving her more choice for serving her customers.  Karen hopes to attract more customers, increase her sales and earn higher profits.

Karen's dream is to open a seamstress workshop in order to generate higher profits and to provide other people with work.

loans.use: to buy a variety of material, zips, buttons, threads and fasteners.

loans.name: Haneefan

texts.en:
Haneefan is a 38-year-old married woman who has sold milk with her husband for many years. 

She has one buffalo, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality.   Haneefan also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra profit.  

Haneefan has become famous for providing good-quality milk and she makes enough money to contribute to her family's income.  

Haneefan has improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.  Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000.  This will allow her to purchase one buffalo. 

Haneefan is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 56 year old married woman who has sold milk for many years. She has two milking cows and sells butter and milk to many of her neighbors. 

Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. But Bashiran is motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing.  

Bashiran has improved her business to meet her day to day expenses of life.  She is in her third year with Kashf Foundation and is happily running her business with its support. 

Now she requested for a loan of Rs 40000 to purchase one more cow.  Bashiran hopes to increase her production capacity of milk which ultimately helps her generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one cow.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 38 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She is very talented and excels at making envelopes.  

Sajida makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them at the local market.  Her husband's income is not sufficient to meet her family's needs.

To help her, Sajida is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy bundles of good quality paper along with packs of glue. 

Sajida expects an increase in business income as she expands.  She wishes to use part of her profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper along with packs of glue.

loans.name: Praneswar

texts.en:
Praneswar is a rural housewife of 45 years.  She is a mother of four children (two sons, two daughters).  She lives with her sons and her husband in their own kachha house (mud and straw-made) in the small village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  Her husband Upendra is 55 years old.  Both the husband and wife are uneducated and can only sign their names. Their daughters already got married and their two sons are students in grades 12 and 8.

Praneswar's husband is a cycle-van puller, who earns money by carrying goods and people in his van. He has been in this business for ten years. Now he cannot cover his all the family's expenses with his small income. Moreover, this year his cycle-van was damaged, so he cannot do his work properly and run his family in a decent way. To restore his monthly income, his van needs to be repaired.

Praneswar has decided to help her husband in his work.  She heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, who gives loans to rural women. She has taken a loan from BJS to repair the old van and also purchase a new one, so that they can give it on hire as another means of income.  She hopes that with the profit generated from it, her situation will be good enough to be able to support her family.

She hopes that her initiative will be lucrative and will raise family funds to give her children higher education and purchase another cycle-van in future.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To repair their old cycle-van and buy another one to rent out as a source of income

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
At the age of 48, Rehana is a widow and the mother of six children; one of her is shown in the photo.  

Her son sells general store items to different shops.  After eight years of struggle, his business now generates enough profit to meet the family's expenses. But more income is needed in the future.

Rehana contacted Kashf foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 for her son. The amount will be used to purchase more biscuits, sweets and juices in bulk to boost his sales. 

Rehana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business. Their dream is to maximize their profit from this business and have better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, sweets and juices in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con sus padres y su hermana en casa propia, ella se dedica  a la venta de panes y refrescos lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de panes y refrescos por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi poder ayudar en los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with her parents and sister in their own house. She sells bread and soft drinks as a street vendor at the different markets in her area of residence. She has good demand thanks to her good prices and friendliness. 

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy bread and soft drinks in bulk, which is her only income source. She plans to use the loan to help with household expenses and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad habita junto a sus hijos de 23 años, 22 años, 15 años y 12 años de edad. Su esposo falleció y es ella quien lleva la responsabilidad del hogar. Trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia ya que ella es quien lleva la economía del hogar. Se dedica a la venta de mariscos. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su comunidad. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio comprando más producto el cual le permita llegar a más clientes y así incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de mariscos como: camarones, conchas, y pescado. Tiene plena confianza que de esta forma logrará mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and lives with her children, who are aged 23, 22, 15 and 12. Her husband died and she is the one who is responsible for the household. She works extremely hard to support her family and she's the breadwinner. She makes a living selling seafood, and goes around the community in which she lives selling her goods.  


With the aim of boosting her earnings, she has decided to invest in her business by buying more products to sell to more customers, and in this way increase her sales and income. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of seafood such as prawns, shells and fish. She feels totally confident that this will enable her to increase her earnings and, as a result, her and her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seafood such as prawns, shells and fish.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in her community for a living. She always finds ways to augment her store income, and was able to successfully repay her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to boost her business. 

Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer, for the activity from which she earns aside from her general store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell through her buy-and-sell dry goods business, like plasticwares, slippers, and pants.

Marigen has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Marigen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell, like plasticwares, slippers, and pants.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en: Kanga's previous loan improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She is requesting another loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Lucia Del Transito

texts.es:
Lucía, solicita un crédito nuevo para comprar bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, entre otros productos, ya que es necesario mantener su negocio preparado para responder a la demanda de los clientes.
Con el crédito anterior surtió de nuevos productos su negocio, con lo que aumentos sus ventas, tiene clientes nuevos, ha cancelado sus deudas y sigue cumpliendo con los compromisos familiares.
texts.en:
Lucía is applying for another loan in order to buy drinks, basic grains, sweets, detergents and other products as she needs to keep her business prepared to handle customers' demands.

Lucía used her previous loan to stock up her business with new products.  This allowed her to increase sales and it brought in new customers.  Lucía has paid off her debt and continues to complete her household duties.

loans.use: to buy drinks, basic grains, sweets, detergents and other products.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El señor Ariel quien tiene 19 años es soltero y trabaja en calidad de propietario de su vehículo en el sector del transporte en una línea de microbuses, desempeña su actividad de lunes a sábado desde hace un año, obtiene buenos ingresos  por el servicio que realiza, vive en la casa de sus padres y poco a poco se está independizando haciéndose sus propias cosas,  cubre sus propios gastos y también se ocupa de financiar sus estudios. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la refacción y mantenimiento de su vehículo de esta forma podrá seguir trabajando y además de incrementar sus ingresos, lograra brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ariel is 19 years old and single. He works as an owner operator in the transport sector in a bus company. He has been working from Monday to Saturday for the last year. He makes good money for his services. He lives in his parent's home. Little by little he is becoming more independent doing things on his own and paying his own expenses. He is also working on financing his studies.

Ariel is requesting a loan to buy replacement parts and maintain his vehicle. In this way he can continue working and increase his income, providing better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Walter Geovanny

texts.es:
Walter, es casado y padre de dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en una casa familiar, para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a venta y reparación de llantas, es un negocio que tiene desde hace de 7 años lo aprendió de su papá, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema desempeñando su labor.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de llantas, parches y pegamento, lo que le facilitara dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, espera tener mejores ingresos con los cuales cancelara sus deudas y mejorara el estilo de vida familiar.
Su sueño es comprar su casa propia para dar a su familia un lugar seguro donde vivir.
texts.en:
Walter is married and a father to two children. He lives with his family in their own home and, in order to cover household costs, Walter makes a living selling and repairing tyres.  He has had the business for seven years, having learned the trade from his father.  Walter has had no difficulty in this work so far.

Walter will invest this loan in buying tyres, repair patches and glue, allowing him to offer his customers good service.  Walter hopes to have a higher income with which he can pay off his debts and improve his family's living conditions.

Walter's dream is to buy his own house in order to give his family a safe and secure place to live.

loans.use: to buy tyres, repair patches and glue.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Don salvador  de 45 años de edad,  estudio hasta  tercer grado de nivel académico, es casado,  su pareja se dedica a los domésticos.

Don Salvador trabaja en una institución que exporta café, tiene tres años de dedicarse a este trabajo también tiene como otra fuente de ingresos la venta de paletas en la casa. El trabajo a don Salvador le queda a una distancia de 5 minutos en motocicleta,  el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 7 de la noche. 

Don Salvador con el crédito solicitado en Fundación Campo,  comprara un vehículo ya que con el crédito anterior que se solicitó compro una motocicleta y le vino a mejor su estilo de vida, ya que Él antes viajaba a pie para su trabaja y cuando salía a vender paletas lo hacía a pie y hoy lo hace en su motocicleta.  La necesidad que satisfará este crédito es que el carro lo meterá a trabajar en cualquiera de los viajes que en la institución se da, ya que en ocasiones no se encuentran carros que jalen el café y eso implica más ganancias en su empleo 

Sus sueños es de hacerse de sus cositas,  con la ayuda que la fundación le da en otorgarle créditos y para sus  hijos espera lo mejor y que ella se prepare en el estudio y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Salvador is 45 years old and completed up to third grade at school.  He is married; his wife is a housewife.

Salvador works for an organisation that exports coffee.  He has been doing this work for three years and, as an additional source of income, he sells ice lollies from home.  Salvador's workplace is a five minute motorcycle ride from his home.  He works from 7am until 7pm.

Salvador is applying for this loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to buy a vehicle.  Salvador used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle and this has improved his living conditions.  Before he had to walk to work and when he went out to sell ice lollies.  Now he can do this work on his motorcycle.  Salvador will use this loan to buy a motorcycle which he can use for his work - he can run journeys for the organisation as on occasions there are no vehicles available to transport the coffee.  Having this motorcycle would represent a higher income in his work.

Salvador's dream is to buy this motorcycle with the help of the loans provided by "Fundación Campo".  He hopes to give his children the best he can and to prepare them to study at university and take on a profession.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is only 25 years old and is married. She is the mother of two sons who go to school (in grade 7 and grade 1). Her husband, Sadhan, is 30 years old and a driver by profession. Both the husband and wife are illiterate and can sign their names. They live in the small town of Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Kanika's husband earns too little to run a family well. Their earnings also can't give sufficient financial support to maintain all the needs of her family. Kanika is a very energetic and optimistic lady. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and education.

She has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase stones to supply to the building contractors. These kinds of stones are used in making buildings in rural areas. She and her husband have chosen this business, as it is a lucrative business nowadays.

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members, especially giving better education to her sons.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase stones for starting a business supplying stones to building contractors.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 46 years old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Balqees makes enough money to provide for her family.  To fully stock her store Balqees requests a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market in bulk at lower rates.  This will help Balqees meet the increasing demands of her customers more consistently. 

Balqees is in her 3rd loan cycle and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour .

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has been successfully run a small general store in her community for the last ten years. 

Razia offers various goods for daily use.  She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband earns an insufficient income to support his family alone. 

As Razia wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 50,000 to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market in bulk at lower rates.   Then Razia will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Razia is in her sixth loan cycle and has an excellent repayment history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a 45-year-old married woman who runs a small general store with her husband from her house.  She has 15 years of experience.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market, as he has many contacts. 

Rasoolan is the mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.  She wants to grow her business and has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand from customers. 

Rasoolan is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, el cual es una zona muy alejada de la zona céntrica y se encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente. Son de una zona bastante alejada y eminentemente rural.
La Sra. Nilda es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa y también un copetín, en el que sacrificadamente trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere sacar adelante a su negocio ya que es el sostén de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, leche, panificados y demás, y así seguir surtiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
The group called Oñondivepa is in its first cycle with the women’s communal bank program.  It is from the city of Curuguaty, which is an area very far away from the central zone.  It is currently a growing area, and because of this, the members of this group want to fight to go on growing and give the area where they live a better atmosphere and keep it growing slowly.  They are from a pretty isolated and especially rural area.

Señora Nilda is one of the members.  She has a small grocery store and also a food counter, where she works sacrificially everyday, beginning at a very early hour. She is a very tenacious person who wants to get her business ahead because it her family’s support.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of drinks, vegetables, milk, baked goods, and other items, and in this way to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, milk, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en: Tagi is 22-years-old and a single young lady with one adopted child.  She would like to start a small business tailoring clothes. In order to do this, Tagi needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, needles, threads and materials. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and support her family financially. She has been a member of SPBD since this year, 2013.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, needles, threads and materials.

loans.name: Solema

texts.en:
Solema is 22 years old and a single mother, with one child. 

She has a small business, selling fish in her community. She has three years with this business.

Solema needs a loan to buy a fishing net, spears, and fishing gear. She will use her profits to support her family as well as extending her business. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for a fishing net, spears, and fishing gear

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 45 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 25 y 23 años de edad, desde hace varios años posee un negocio de venta de refrescos y golosinas en el mercado que s encuentra cerca de su casa posee mucha clientela pues está ubicada en un lugar muy estratégico donde pasan mucha personas, catalina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas refrescos y golosinas por mayor y así surtir su negocio para darle una mejor atención a sus clientes, y ella pueda tener junto a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Catalina is 45 years old and is a single mother who lives in her own home with her children, aged 25 and 23. She has owned a business selling soft drinks and sweets in the market near her home for several years. She has many customers as she is located in a strategic position frequented by lots of people. 

Catalina is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale soft drinks and sweets in order to restock her business and offer a better service to her customers, so that she and her children can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale soft drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar est un éleveur qui s’active depuis maintenant plus de 10 ans. Il fait spécialement de l’embouche bovine et passe la plupart de son temps avec ses bêtes, il s’occupe personnellement d’elles. Oumar est actif toute la journée : le matin, il promène ses bêtes dans la campagne et le soir, celle-ci rentrent au bercail pour recevoir tous les soins nécessaires pour leur bon développement. 
Seulement pour augmenter le nombre des vaches et gérer leur alimentation, Oumar a besoin de faire un crédit de 500000F CFA auprès d’une Institution financière comme IMCEC.
Il faut noter que l’activité lui permet de mettre un peu d’argent de coté et de gérer sa famille en améliorant leurs conditions alimentaires.
Oumar aimerait diversifier son activité et rêve d’avoir une grande boutique d’alimentation générales.
texts.en:
Oumar has been raising livestock for over 10 years. He specializes in cattle and spends most of his time with his animals, taking care of them by himself. Oumar is busy all day: the morning, he takes his animals out to the pasture, and in the evening, they return to their stalls in order to be taken care of as needed for their healthy growth. 

Simply to increase his headcount and manage the fodder cots, Oumar needs a loan of 500, 000 West African francs from a [microfinance] institution such as IMCEC. It should be noted that this business allows him to save a bit of money and provide for his family, improving their nutrition. Oumar would like to diversify his business. His dream is to open a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Para generar los ingresos con los que sustenta las necesidades de su hogar, ella trabaja en el campo de la confección a terceros desde hace aproximadamente 18 años y esto se ha convertido en su única fuente de empleo e ingresos; cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada directa y de su hijo a quien le fue enseñando poco a poco para que pueda tener una fuente de ingresos permanente que le permita ser independiente. Lucila con su perseverancia y esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y, a pesar de las dificultades que se le presentan ella siempre tiene una actitud positiva frente a la vida, especialmente a la hora de contratar a una operaria que sea responsable y organizada que hoy en día es complicado. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar mejoras locativas y para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, entre otros), esto le permitirá optimizar mejor el espacio y mejorará las condiciones de trabajo, además tendrá los materiales necesarios para poder cumplir con la producción y así realizar las entregas de manera oportuna, lo que le dará la posibilidad de adquirir nuevos contratos para generar mejores ingresos.  Así es como Lucila ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y pretende que continúe generando ingresos para garantizar una estabilidad económica para disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su hijo.
texts.en:
Lucila is mother of one child and the head of her house since she and her husband separated. She has worked in the dressmaking business for approximately 18 years and this is her only job and income source to cover household expenses. She counts on a direct employee and also has the help of her son, whom she has been teaching the business little by little for him to have a permanent income source to become independent. Thanks to her determination and hard work, Lucila has been able to get ahead. She always has a positive attitude towards life despite all the difficulties that she encounters, especially when it comes to hire a worker who is responsible and organized, which is very complicated. 

She is currently requesting a loan to make improvements in her workshop and to buy supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, etc.). This will allow her to use the space more efficiently and to improve her working conditions, as well as to have the necessary materials to meet the demand and obtain new contracts to improve her income. This is how Lucila has been able to grow her business and how she plans to continue to generate income and guarantee a financial stability to enjoy a better quality of life with her son.

loans.use: to make improvements in her workshop and to buy supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, etc.).

loans.name: Ngani

texts.en:
Ngani is a married woman with two children, both of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell food supplements business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling bananas.
