A Isidoro siempre le gustó mucho lo que estudio, es por eso que ahora desea realizar un postgrado, pues está convencido que una de las mayores áreas de influencia para un trabajo en la ciudad donde vive, es justamente el área de la Industria Química, donde cree que por su gran diversidad de roles puede llegar a tener en un futuro, una amplia experiencia laboral.  Sus estudios universitarios los concluyo en 5 años y actualmente ya está titulado. 

Isidoro, aspira a ser docente universitario en la casa de estudios que lo formo y para esto necesita ayuda económica para poder cubrir los gastos que implica el realizar esta Maestría pues es de escasos recursos y sus ingresos son menores y solo alcanzan para ayudar a su familia en los gastos de la casa. El piensa que lo que le diferencia de otros postulantes es el deseo grande que tiene por superarse y cumplir nuevos desafíos, se siente esperanzado y con muchas ganas de poder comenzar un nuevo reto para su vida. 

Isidoro se declara emocionado de saber que hay gente que desea ayudar a otras personas apoyándolos con sus estudios. Si bien cree que la misma sociedad, el tiempo y los problemas familiares son obstáculos que a veces se presentan cuando se quiere salir adelante, también está muy agradecido de enterarse que existen personas de buen corazón que ayudan a jóvenes como él. Isidoro se enteró del programa a través de los comentarios de un amigo que conoció el mismo en una feria educativa.
texts.en:
Isidoro, single and 23 years old, was born in the Andres Ibáñez province in the department of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He wants to study for a Master's in Integrated Security, Environmental and Quality Systems Management at the Autonomous University of Gabriel Rene Moreno, a goal for which he requires a loan from EDUCA-PRÓ to finance his studies.

Isidoro works as the manager of the chemistry laboratory in the same university where he studies. He lives with his parents and siblings and has no other income. He occasionally has other activities, such as  giving assistance to students in the same career who need grading in their studies, and completing some supplementary courses for his career. The main goal he has in life is self-improvement and being able to finish his studies.

Isidoro has always enjoyed what he studies very much, and this is why he wants to complete a postgraduate degree. He believes that one of the best areas of influence for a job in the city where he lives is industrial chemistry. Because of the large diversity of roles, he believes he can have extensive work experience. His finished his university studies in five years and currently has a degree.

Isidoro aspires to be a university lecturer in the education center where he studied. For this, he needs economic assistance to be able to cover the costs associated with completing a Master's, because he is poor and his income is small and only enough to help his family with household expenses. 

He thinks that he is set apart from other candidates is his large desire to improve himself and meet new challenges. He feels hopeful and eager to begin a new challenge in his life.

Isidoro is excited to know there are people who want to help others and support them in their studies. Although he believes the same society, time and family problems are obstacles that sometimes occur when you want to get ahead, he is also very grateful to know that there are good-hearted people to help young people like him. Isidoro learned of the program through a friend who learned of it at the same educational fair.

loans.use: complete a Master's in Integrated Security, Environmental and Quality Systems Management.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao es casado de 34 años, nacido en la provincia Andres Ibáñez del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia desea culminar sus estudios de Licenciatura de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Privada Cumbre, motivo por el cual requiere un Crédito de EDUCA-PRÓ para terminar de financiar sus Estudios.  Trabaja hace tiempo en una casa comercial dedicada al rubro del cuero en atención al Cliente. Vive con su esposa e hijo, su padre y hermanos, no tiene otros ingresos económicos, ni actividades extra académicas. Una de sus mayores motivaciones para salir profesional es su hijo por quien trabaja y se esfuerza cada día. 

A Estanislao le gusta mucho lo que estudia puesto que a medida que avanza en su carrera  aprendió también el valor de ser organizado en la vida.  Sus estudios los inicio hace dos años y aunque ha tenido dificultades financieras para concluirlo, espera poder terminarlos muy pronto. 

Estanislao se encuentra trabajando, sin embargo necesita ayuda económica para poder cubrir los gastos que implica el culminar su carrera. El piensa que lo que le diferencia de otros postulantes es la seguridad que tiene en las decisiones que ha tomado en su vida, pues siempre se ha propuesto cumplirlas. Una vez culminada su licenciatura, le gustaría trabajar en alguna empresa del rubro de la Construcción; en el futuro se ve con un trabajo estable, digno y desarrollando su profesión. 

Estanislao se encuentra muy emocionado, feliz y agradecido por el apoyo de las personas que generan mejores oportunidades de vida a sus semejantes que carecen de posibilidades económicas.
texts.en:
Estanislao is a 34 year old married man. He was born in the Andres Ibáñez province in the department of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He would like to finish his Bachelor’s of Business Administration at the Universidad of Privada Cumbre. His motivation to finance finishing his studies led him to ask for a loan from Educa-Pro. While working at a marketing firm he’s been selling leather in the Customer Relations Team.

He lives with his wife and son, his father, and his brothers. He doesn’t have any other income or other academic pursuits. His son is a great motivation to become a profession, and for him he works hard every day.  

Estanislao likes studying since this is how he’ll advance in his career. He’s also learned the value of being organized. He began his studies two years ago and since these he’s had financial difficulties in finishing them. He hopes to be able to finish very soon.

Estanislao is currently working. Without a doubt he needs financial help to be able to cover the costs associated with concluding his studies. He thinks that what differentiates him from other applicants is how sure he is about the decisions he’s made in his life and how he’s followed through. Once he finishes his degree he would like to work in a construction firm. He’s sees a future for himself with a good stable job and advancing in his career.  

Estanislao is very excited, happy, and thankful for the support of all the people who create better opportunities for those who lack economic opportunities.

loans.use: to finish his Bachelors of Business Administration degree.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra lives in Totolapan Morelos with her husband, Alejandro, and their two children, Canaldo and Sergio.  Alejandra has been working for the last 10 years selling corn that the family grows.  She has a cart and goes around the neighborhood and neighboring town selling her product.  Alejandro works in the fields and since it is only him and the boys, he rents the land that he is not able to farm on.  Alejandra bought a piece of land 15 years ago before meeting Alejandro.  Once they started living together they started building and expanding the house little by little.  But with the kids and their strenuous work this has been slower than they planned for.  Today, the family lives in a two bedroom house with a living room and what they started building as a kitchen.  

Alejandro and Alejandra make around $700 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible for them. For the last three months they have been saving to finish building the kitchen with a proper roof that will protect the stove that they bought after saving for quite some time.  Alejandra needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials.  A proper roof and walls for the kitchen will protect their investment in the stove and will give the family a clean place where they can cook and eat.  The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new construction will give this family the home they have been dreaming of for so long.  Alejandra is aware that dedication and hard work is what makes dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her kitchen

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, es soltero de 22 años, nacido en el Municipio de San Javier, de la provincia Ñuflo de Chávez,  del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia desea realizar un curso de Técnico en Redes CISCO CCNA en la Universidad UPSA, motivo por el cual requiere un crédito educativo para financiar sus estudios.
Jaime trabaja desde hace 2 años en ventas de una empresa del rubro de Sistemas Informáticos. Vive con sus padres y hermanos, no tiene otros ingresos económicos. La principal motivación que tiene, es la superación personal y el poder ayudar económicamente a sus padres en un futuro.   
A Jaime siempre le gustó todo lo referido a componentes electrónicos es por esto que actualmente estudia Ingeniería Electrónica y quiere trabajar en el desarrollo de redes, por lo cual quiere realizar éste curso a nivel técnico superior, el mismo es fundamental para ampliar y complementar los conocimientos adquiridos en la Universidad. Actualmente le dedica aproximadamente 4 horas a estudiar e investigar temas de interés referidos a su carrera. 
Jaime aspira a tener mayores conocimientos para desempeñarse en otra área de su empresa, una que esté más ligada a su carrera y donde pueda desarrollar su potencial. Asimismo, desea en un futuro tener su propia empresa, pues eso lo haría sentirse realizado profesionalmente. Piensa que no existe algo especial que lo diferencie de otros postulantes y que lo haga merecedor a recibir un financiamiento para sus estudios, pues él cree en la igualdad entre los seres humanos, donde hace hincapié en que todos tienen los mismos derechos a la educación y a ser tratado dignamente por la sociedad. Se siente afortunado pues hasta el momento no ha tenido mayores contratiempos para poder estudiar, pero tomando en cuenta que ya tiene gastos en la universidad, la ayuda económica que pueda recibir mediante un financiamiento le beneficiará de gran manera para poder cumplir uno de sus propósitos dentro de sus aspiraciones personales como estudiante. 
Jaime está muy agradecido de antemano con las personas que desea ayudan a otras personas, dándoles la oportunidad de continuar con sus estudios y manifiesta que a él también le gustaría "Ayudar a otras personas a cumplir sus sueños". Admira la generosidad voluntaria en bien de otros.
texts.en:
Jaime is single and is twenty-two years old.  He was born in San Javier, which is located in the Ñuflo de Chávez province within the department of Santa Cruz in Bolivia.  He hopes to complete a network technology course "CISCO CCNA" at UPSA University.  He needs an educational loan in order to be able to pay for his studies.

Jaime has worked for two years in sales at an Information Systems business.  He lives with his parents and siblings and does not have another means of economic income.  His main motivation is becoming a better person and being able to help his parents economically in the future.  Jaime has always liked everything related to electronics, and so he is currently studying Electronic Engineering.  He wants to work in network development and therefore wants to complete this high-level technology course, which is also necessary to enhance and complement what he has already learned at the University.  He currently dedicates approximately four hours to studying and investigating interesting topics related to this profession.

Jaime hopes to expand his knowledge so that he can work in another area of the company, one that is more closely related to his career path and where he can develop his potential and skills.  He also hopes in the future to have his own business, which will make him feel that he is truly a professional.  

He does not think that there is something particularly special about himself that sets him apart to receive financing for his studies; he truly believes in equality among human beings, emphasizing that everyone has the same rights to education and to be treated with dignity by society.  He does feel very fortunate, since he has not had any huge setbacks in being able to study.  However, he already has a lot of university expenses, and the economic help he may receive will benefit him greatly in being able to complete one of his personal aspirations as a student.

Jaime is very grateful to the people that want to help others by giving them the opportunity to continue studying.  He says that he would like to "help other people to reach their dreams," and he admires the generosity and good of others.

loans.use: to complete a high-level technology course at the University.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre casado de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos  de 16, 19, 10, 5 y de 2 años de edad,  de los cuales cuatro están estudiando y el pequeño aun esta al cuidado de la madre, actualmente residen en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre que trabaja en el campo como agricultor, cultivando papa y otras hortalizas para el consumo del ser humano. Eligió esta actividad  porque desde pequeño su padre le enseño este oficio, que le ha traído buenos beneficios en cuanto a la economía de su familia. Como también comenta que esta labor le permite trabajar por las tardes como panadero.
El ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra semillas de papa y abono orgánico que servirá para su cultivo y de esta manera podrá mejorar la economía de su familia.
Su mayor sueño es incrementar sus ganancias a través de las dos actividades que realiza, con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Enrique is a 34-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and five children (ages 16, 19, 10, 5, and 2). Four of his children are studying and the youngest is being cared for by his mother. They currently reside in the Department of Sololá.

Enrique works in the countryside as a farmer. He grows potatoes and other vegetables for human consumption. Enrique chose this line of work because he learned the trade from his father. It has been a great benefit to his family's financial situation. Enrique says that being in this trade allows him to also work as a baker in the afternoons.

He is now requesting a loan of 3,500 GTQ in order to buy seed potatoes and organic fertilizer for his crop. This will help to improve his family's finances. His greatest wish is to increase his earnings through his two business activities with the intention of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 16 años y 21 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio, todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para ofrecer su mercadería (plátanos, quesadillas, queso, crema, y pollos). Cuenta con la preferencia de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea mejorar las condiciones del baño sanitario el cual está construido a base de lámina que con el tiempo se han deteriorado y necesitan cambio. Además, desea construir un muro de retención para evitar que el terreno se siga lavando. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo, cemento y hierro para construir el cuarto del baño y el muro de retención.
texts.en:
Ana, 46, lives in her own home with her husband and children, ages 16 and 21.  She is a merchant and works as a street vendor in the busy areas of her town selling goods such as bananas, quesadillas, cheese, cream and chickens.  She has many customers who prefer to buy from her.

Ana wants to build a new bathroom because the one she has is made of metal sheeting and becoming deterioriated.  She also wants to build a retaining wall to avoid landslides.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy sand, bricks, cement and iron to build both the bathroom and retaining wall.

loans.use: To buy sand, bricks, cement and iron to build a bathroom and retaining wall.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta y elaboración de tamales de pollo y gallina desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo a logra sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, doña María esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para la preparación de los tamales como: pollos, gallinas, verduras, maíz, aceite, hojas de huerta para envolverlos, etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo para seguirle dando a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
María, 59, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her two children.  For several years she has been making and selling chicken tamales to earn a living to support her two children.

María is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare tamales such as chickens, hens, vegetables, corn, oil and leaves for wrapping.  This will allow her to continue working so she can give her children everything they need.

loans.use: To buy chickens, hens, vegetables, corn, oil, and leaves for wrapping.

loans.name: Miguel Arcides

texts.es: Miguel de 36 años de edad  es carpintero desde hace 4 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa alquilada, posee cliente fija que lo buscan por que realiza un excelente trabajo, miguel esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar madera por mayor, barniz, clavos, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi el y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 36, has been running a carpentry business for four years from the rented home where he lives with his wife and three children.  He has regular customers who seek him out because of his excellent work.  

Miguel is requesting a loan to buy wholesale wood, varnish, nails, etc. so he can continue his work; since it is his only source of income and he wants to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wholesale wood, varnish, nails, etc.

loans.name: Maria Nicolaza

texts.es: María 29 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 13 años, 11 años y 1 año de edad. Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad y junto a su compañero de vida quien es agricultor mantienen la economía del hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda puesto que la cubierta del techo se encuentra dañada y el piso es de tierra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, grava y arena para comenzar la reparación del techo y encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
María, age 29, lives in her own house with her life partner and their children, ages 13, 11, and 1.  She has been selling vegetables at the local market for 13 years.  Together with her life partner, a farmer, they support the household.

She wishes to improve the conditions of her house.  The roof covering is damaged, and the floor is a dirt floor.  Because of these conditions, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, gravel, and sand in order to start repairing the roof and to set the floor of her house in concrete.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, gravel, and sand in order to start repairing the roof and to set the floor of her house in concrete.

loans.name: Tepa

texts.en:
Tepa is 43 years old; she is a single woman with one child.  She runs a small business selling noodles, snacks, long donuts, and popcorn in her community, and has been doing this for two years. 

Tepa has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, corn, vegetable oils, frying pans, etc.. 

She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital. With her earnings,Tepa will extend her business and support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, corn, vegetable oil, frying pans, etc..

loans.name: Joan Vianne

texts.en:
Joan is a 41-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a business selling fish in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Joan has requested a loan to buy a new fishing net and fishing gear such as spears, goggles, and hooks. She plans to use her profits to improve her business, support her family, and pay for her children's education. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to pay for a new fishing net and fishing gear like spears, goggles, and hooks

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos aun esta en edad escolar, Sofía es una persona muy responsable y generosa, ella trabaja en un hotel como cocinera, trabajo el cual lo desempeña hace muchos años, y sus clientes están muy contestos con la sazón de Sofía.
Sofía está muy agradecida con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de un estante para exhibir sus platos de comida y así tener más clientes.
El sueño de Sofía es tener su propio restaurante y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sofía, 48, is a single mother of three children, one of whom is still in school.  She is a very responsible, generous person who has been working as a cook in a hotel for many years attending to customers who really like her cooking.

Sofía is very grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan she will use to buy a food display counter to attract more customers.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant one day and also to see her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy a food display counter.

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn is married with two children; she sells fish in their community to earn a living. With five years in this business, Emmalyn earns little profit, an aid to her husband's income from working as a laborer. 

To improve her earnings, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more fish to sell. 

She wants to have a stall in the market in town where she could sell fish daily. She also wants to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a married woman with four children. She is 52 years old, and has one child who is still in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virgilia has a buy and sell candle business in the Philippines. 

Virgilia requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more candles to sell.

Virgilia has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more candles to sell

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya. He is a farmer, and has been farming for six years. He produces and sells milk and eggs.

In his short experience in farming, he loves taking care of his poultry and feeding them so that they can produce more eggs. With poultry, one has to be prepared because chickens succumb easily to poultry diseases.

Chris chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help farmers improve their livelihood; they also have an easy loan repayment schedule.

This loan will help him invest for his future because it will bring in more income, and hence give him a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business, and earn a higher income that she used to open a food kiosk.

She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.50,000 to buy more stock of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar

loans.name: Deysi

texts.en:
Deysi lives with her partner, Ramon, and two children in Totolapan Morelos.  Deysi works at a nearby town in a baking shop and has been there for the last four years.  She is known for being a hard working, loving mother and for selling delicious cakes during weekends at her home.  Deysi and Ramon work hard to give their children the opportunity they didn't have to study, at least through middle school, and have a better life.  Ramon is a construction worker and with the family savings has managed to build the home they have today, which fits their needs except for the bathroom which is in the middle of construction and offers no privacy for the family.  

Deysi and Ramon make around $650 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible to them.  For the last three months Deysi has been saving to build a proper bathroom especially since winter is arriving and bathing gets very uncomfortable then.  Deysi needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials.  The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction, and the new construction will give the whole family a more comfortable life.  Deysi is aware that dedication and hard work is what and will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building the bathroom in her house

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina lives with her husband Francisco in Totolapan, Morelos.  They have lived in this house for over 43 years.  At the beginning, the couple focused on making sure they gave everything they could to their kids to ensure they had a good life and a good education.  The house grew to their needs but without many luxuries.  Now that all the kids have left and that Catalina and Francisco are getting older, they want to make life a little more comfortable.  They work around the clock managing their own water purification business, which gives them roughly $500 USD a month.  

Since they are both self-employed and have few things of their own, according to other institutions they do not qualify for credit.  Catalina has been saving for the last couple of months to build a proper wall and roof for a particular room of her house.  She says she doesn't need much, but winter is coming and as they get older, cold weather is harder to endure year after year.  Catalina is asking for a credit to finish paying for the construction materials she needs.  Catalina and Francisco will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  They are both looking forward to having a concrete wall and roof.

loans.use: to buy materials to build proper walls and a roof

loans.name: Elica Paula

texts.en:
Elica is a single mom of two children.  She works selling food, "antojitos," in the market.  Raising two kids by herself has been rough, especially now that Zaira, her oldest, is a teenager.  However, she is determined to work hard and give her children a better education and a better life.  Elica currently lives in a house with a bedroom, living room, and a small kitchen where she prepares the food she sells.  She knows Zaira is almost a grown up now and needs her own space, and she is also aware that not having a proper bathroom is becoming a big inconvenience, especially for the young girls. 

Elica makes around $400 USD a month, and has no access to credit given she has no formal job and her income is low and variable.  She has been saving for the last three months to build a new bedroom for her kids and a bathroom for the family.  She is now asking for this loan to pay for materials needed.  The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new room will give the kids their own space to play, sleep and study and the bathroom will provide a healthier life and more privacy for the family.  Elica is aware that her kids are growing up and need their own space, and she wants to make sure they can have healthy and proper development during the rest of their youth.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bedroom and a bathroom

loans.name: Lavona

texts.en:
Lavona is a 23-year-old woman who is married, with three children. She runs a business, selling fish in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Lavona has requested a loan to buy a new fishing net and fishing gear, like spears, goggles, and hooks. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family and her children's education, as well. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since this year, 2013.

loans.use: to pay for a new fishing net and fishing gear, like spears, goggles, and hooks.

loans.name: Ramez

texts.en:
Ramez is a 20 years old and single. He is from Rafah city and lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. Ramez's father works in the public sector where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Ramez would like to improve the family's living conditions. He is requesting a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a water purification machine for his home. With this loan, Ramez will be able to provide pure water for his family since the water in his area is not clean.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice farming.  Jocelyn is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her rice retailing business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities with the help of her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Kheourn

texts.en:
Kheourn is 36 years old and married, with two children. Her children are receiving education at a local primary school. 

Kheourn and her husband have a few plots of land where they grow seasonal rice crops, which are sold in the local markets of Kampong Thom province. They are also involved in a traveling sales business, selling wood from a horse-pulled cart door to door in the regions of the province.

To continue running her business in a sustainable way, Kheourn is asking for a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to buy a horse and more wood for their traveling sales business. 

The income she expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan, she will save it for the future expansion of her family-owned business and further educate her children. 

She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a horse to pull her cart and more wood to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Elizabeth is requesting her fifth loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks such as laundry soap, shampoo, hair conditioners, canned goods, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.  Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy laundry soap, shampoo, hair conditioners, canned goods, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: This is Umazi. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy more goats for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. She is requesting a loan of KES 35,000 to purchase five goats for her business. She appreciates Kiva for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for her business

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, no estudio por motivos económicos y mejor se dedicó al trabajo de la agricultura, él es casado y tiene 4 hijos con su esposa; su  esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar, y cuida  animales domésticos,  sus hijos también trabajan en la agricultura por la mañana y en la tarde estudian.

José tiene  30 años de dedicare a este trabajo, ya que él trabajo de la agricultura es como él se gana la vida, de él y también la de su familia, él aprendió este trabajo ya que desde pequeño se ha dedicado a este trabajo y su padre le enseño. 

El préstamo lo utilizara, para la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos de maíz y frijol;  ya que el lugar donde él hace la parcela de maíz y de frijol no entra carro, para transportar el producto; ya que el paga mano de obra, para sacar el producto y llevarlo hasta su casa, él paga la tarea a $ 7 dólares ya cuando él lo prepara lleva la pate que le sobra para, venderla en el mercado y paga $15 dólares por viaje.

En el futuro planea tener la cosecha que obtuvo, de la parcela de maíz y de frijol. Tener alimento para su familia un año, el resto que le sobre ponerlo a la venta en el mercado, para obtener sus ingresos y sacar los gastos de inversión.
texts.en:
José, age 45, did not go to school because of financial reasons.  Instead, he devoted himself to agricultural work.  He is married, and he and his wife have four children.  His wife does the household chores and cares for the domestic animals.  His children also do agricultural work in the morning, and in the afternoon they go to school.

José has been doing this work for 30 years.  Working in agriculture is how he earns a living for himself and his family.  He learned this work when he was little.  He has devoted himself to this work, which his father taught him.

He will use the loan to gather the corn and bean harvest.  Cars cannot enter the land where he has the corn and beans to transport the product.  He will pay for labor, to collect the product, and to take it to his house.  He pays $7 for the work when he prepares it.  He will take the part left over to sell in the market.  He pays $15 per trip.

In the future he plans to have the harvest from his land with the corn and beans.  He will have food for his family for one year.  He will sell what is leftover at the market in order to get income and recoup his expenses.

loans.use: to pay to gather the corn and bean harvest.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar 46 años está casado con la Sra. Guillermina desde hace varios años, tienen una sobrina que vive con ellos desde pequeña, la misma fue criada como una hija de la pareja, y siempre les ayuda en todo lo que está a su alcance.
El Sr. Oscar se dedica a la olería, fabrica ladrillos de todo tipo para construcción, el crédito que pide lo quiere invertir en la compra de arena para la producción de los ladrillos.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 46-year old man who has been married to Guillermina for several years. They have a niece that has lived with them since she was a little girl and who has been raised as their own child. She always helps them with everything she can. 

Oscar works in the production of all kinds of bricks for construction and is requesting the loan to buy sand to make them. He is grateful for this opportunity that will be of great help to keep working.

loans.use: to buy sand to make bricks.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 34-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four children, three sons and one daughter, in a small, simple house in the city. 

Basel works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Basel would like to improve the family's living conditions and to buy all the needed items. 

Basel took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. By taking this loan, Basel will be able to provide pure water for his family since the water in his area is not clean. 

Basel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a 20-year-old woman, living with her family in a small house. 

Currently, she has a business, weaving and selling embroidered blankets, working at home. She started this trade five years ago, learning her technique in workshop classes. In the beginning, it was like a hobby and later, she decided to treat this as a business, besides her study. 

The youth loan she is currently taking out is to buy a sewing machine, which will improve her work, making it faster and increasing quality. She embroiders and sells her products in shops and for her customers. This allows her to generate income to support her family. 

Feryal is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, which will improve her work, making it faster and increasing quality.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 68 years old and married with six children.

Luzminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, and sardines to sell.

Luzminda has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Luzminda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace leads a group of five members living in Kyakatebe village.  These members grow similar crops such as maize, beans, groundnut and vegetables.  All the group members also rear domestic birds.  Grace and her group members have attended YICE's trainings in farming as a business and have acquired skills in better farming methods that improve their farm products.  They are requesting this loan to buy good quality seeds, pesticides, herbicides and fertilizers for their farming enterprises.  

Grace, first from left, is 35 years old.  She is married with 4 children, one of which has a mental disability, and she takes care of the whole family through providing basic needs.  She has been a farmer for fifteen years growing crops, and has worked rearing domestic birds for ten years.  Her dream is to use her profits to buy feed and exotic domestic birds to improve the quality of the breeds she has been rearing, sell them, and educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, pesticides, herbicides and fertilizers for their farming enterprises.

loans.name: Andrés Felipe

texts.es: Andrés es un joven emprendedor de 19 años de edad, que luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios decidió montar su propio negocio de video juegos, por lo que en el año 2012 abrió el establecimiento ubicado en un local que es propiedad de su madre, allí trabajaba todos los días prestando el servicio de entretenimiento para niños y jóvenes del sector, pero hace 6 meses fue víctima de un robo en el local, perdiendo todo lo que había construido con esfuerzo y dedicación y quedando sin capital para seguir con el negocio. Sin embargo, ha podido subsistir ya que también tiene un pequeño local donde vende gorras, pero éste no le genera la rentabilidad suficiente para su sustento. Por esta razón, Hoy en día solicita el apoyo de su segundo ciclo de crédito para reactivar nuevamente el negocio de video juegos en el mismo local, aprovechando que ya era reconocido en el sector; con el dinero desea comprar los activos fijos (play station y televisores), así podrá continuar generando recursos para aportar a la economía familiar. Andrés es consciente que para sacar adelante su proyecto debe trabajar con disciplina y mucho esfuerzo, además sabe que debe reforzar la seguridad del local para evitar un nuevo inconveniente, pero él, con su dinamismo y energía positiva sólo desea seguir avanzando con su actividad y hacer de su negocio un espacio agradable para los clientes que encuentran allí un buen momento de diversión, generándole una rentabilidad con la que puede aportar para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés, age 19, is an enterprising young man.  After completing his secondary education, he decided to set up his own video game business.  He opened his establishment, which is located at a place that his mother owns, in 2012.  He worked there every day providing entertainment services to children and youth in the area.

Six months ago he was a victim of a robbery at the place.  He lost everything that he had built with effort and dedication.  He was left without capital to continue in the business.  Nevertheless, he has been able to survive because he also has a small place where he sells hats.  However, this place does not generate enough for him to support himself.

For this reason he is now requesting the support of a second loan cycle in order to reopen his video game business in the same place.  He will be taking advantage of the fact that he was already well-known in the area.  He wishes to use the money to buy fixed assets (Play Station and televisions).  This way he will be able to continue generating resources to contribute to the family finances.

Andrés is aware that in order to get ahead with his project he needs to work with discipline and a lot of effort.  He also knows that he needs to strengthen the security of the place to avoid a new problem.

With his dynamism and positive energy, he only wishes to keep advancing with his business activity.  He wants to make his business a pleasant space where the customers can find a good, entertaining time.  He will be generating profitability with which he will be able to contribute to improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (Play Station and televisions).

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.es:
María Alejandra es originaria de la comunidad El Roble del municipio de El Jicaral donde tiene 15 años de residir, ya que anteriormente vivía a la orilla del río El Tamarindo pero para cuando el huracán Mith que se le llevó su casa le construyeron en esta comunidad su nueva vivienda donde hoy vive con sus dos hijos.
Su vida ha sido dura ya que es madre soltera, por muchos años se fue a trabajar a Costa Rica para recoger y comprar los bienes que hoy tiene en su hogar y poner su propio negocio para generar ingresos y mantener a sus hijos, el cual consiste en el destace de cerdo.
Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su vivienda, ella compra los cerdos en pie para luego vender la carne, elabora frito y chicharrones donde todos los pobladores de esta comunidad son clientes de ella.
María Alejandra cuenta con la ayuda de un joven que es hermano de ella el que se encarga de destazar los cerdos.
Esta actividad la realizan dos veces por semana e inician sus labores desde las cinco de la mañana.
María Alejandra se dio cuenta que hay unos inversionistas Kiva que prestan fondos a través de Ceprodel a personas de escasos recursos y tal es su caso porque necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de tres cerdos, ya que la demanda en esta temporada de diciembre es abundante por lo que necesita dinero para llevar a cabo su inversión.
Espera que estas personas apoyen su solicitud donde les agradecerá eternamente.
texts.en:
María Alejandra comes from the community of El Roble in the municipality of El Jicaral, where she has lived for 15 years. She used to live by the river El Tamarindo, but the hurricane Mith destroyed her house and a new one was built for her and her two children in this community. Her life has been difficult being a single mother. She spent many years working in Costa Rica to save money and buy what she owns today, and to open her business to support her family. Her butcher shop is located in her house. She buys the pigs and then sells the meat and the pork rinds that she makes to all the people in the community. María Alejandra counts on the help of her younger brother, who is in charge of slaughtering the pigs. They do this twice per week and start working at 5am. 

María Alejandra has found out about Kiva lenders who lend through Ceprodel to people with limited resources. She needs working capital to buy three pigs to respond to the high demand of December, and expects lenders to support her request. For this she would be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca es originaria de la comunidad El Bordo del municipio de El Jicaral, es una comunidad como su nombre lo dice ubicada a lo alto de un cerro donde el clima es helado, el aire fresco y puro y el aroma de la flor de madroño que predomina lo natural del campo.
Doña Francisca se desempeña como maestra de primaria en el colegio de esta comunidad donde tiene más de veinte años de dedicarse a esta profesión y le han enseñado a miles de niños a leer y escribir donde hoy son grandes profesionales que trabajan por el desarrollo de Nicaragua.
Uno de sus grandes retos de doña Francisca es preparar profesionalmente a sus tres hijos y en este momento se siente satisfecha porque su hijo mayor ya egresó de la carrera de Derecho por lo que necesita un crédito para la graduación de él.
Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva su apoyo para que a través de Ceprodel le financien este crédito para llevar a cabo su inversión donde quedará muy agradecida y contenta.
texts.en:
Francisca is from the El Bordo [The Edge] community in the El Jicaral municipality.  It is a community, like its name says, that is located on a mountaintop where the climate is freezing, the air is fresh and pure, and the aroma of the flowers of the strawberry tree is carried through the fields.

Francisca works as an elementary school teacher at a school in this community.  She has been devoted to this profession for over 20 years.  She has taught thousands of children to read and write.  Now they are great professionals who work for the development of Nicaragua.

One of Francisca’s biggest challenges is to prepare her three children professionally.  She is happy now because her oldest son has already matriculated with a law degree.  She needs the loan to pay for his graduation.

She is requesting the support of the Kiva lenders through Ceprodel to finance this loan.  She wants the loan to make this investment, and she will be very grateful and happy.

loans.use: to pay for her son's graduation expenses.

loans.name: Julideth

texts.en: Julideth owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in her community to make a living. Aside from this, she also sells fish that can help her earn additional income. She used her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) for motorcycle maintenance and with her efforts to save a portion of her earnings, she was able to successfully repay her loan. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy more fish to sell. She plans to improve her business to provide a better living for her two children in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables and rootcrops in the Philippines.

Estela has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and rootcrops to sell in her vegetable stall.

Estela has been in this business for 33 years now.

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and rootcrops to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es: Melissa es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, estudiante de universidad y dedicada a la venta de mercancía importada desde hace aproximadamente un año. Las utilidades que obtiene de su negocio le han servido para pagar sus estudios y para solventar sus gastos personales; aprendió la actividad de unos amigos que se dedican a la misma labor y su jornada de trabajo depende del horario en el que sus clientes la puedan atender. Su empuje, dinamismo y su energía positiva le han permitido cumplir los objetivos que se propone y por ello, se anima a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, chaquetas, blusas entre otros) y productos de catálogo (malteadas, suplementos dietarios, multivitamínicos, entre otros), así se podrá abastecer con más variedad de artículos para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de fin de año, generándole un mayor nivel de ingresos. De esta forma, Melissa desea seguir luchando para alcanzar sus sueños de terminar su carrera profesional y abrir un almacén para vender toda su mercancía, así mejorará la rentabilidad y podrá tener un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en: Melissa is a young, 21-year-old entrepreneur. She is a student at the university and has been selling imported merchandise for about a year. The profits that she receives from her business have served to pay for her studies and cover her personal expenses. She learned this business from some friends who do the same work, and her work day depends on the schedule on which her customers can meet with her. Her flair, dynamism, and her positive energy have allowed her to accomplish the goals that she has set, and for this reason, she was encouraged to apply for the support of a loan, with which she wants to buy merchandise wholesale (jeans, shirts, jackets, and blouses, among other items) and catalog products (malts, dietary supplements, and multivitamins, among others). Thus she will be able to stock a greater variety of articles to satisfy the demands that increase in the season at the end of the year, generating a higher level of income for her. In this way, Melissa wants to continue striving to reach her dreams of finishing her professional studies and opening a department store to sell all types of merchandise. Thus she will improve her profits and be able to have a more prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (jeans, shirts, jackets, and blouses, among other items) and catalog products (malts, dietary supplements, multivitamins, etc.)

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a young mother of two that lives with her family in Totolapan, Morelos.  Leticia works as an assistant in the kitchen of a tourist center nearby.  Her working hours are long, and she balances this work with cooking and other household chores.  Leticia lives with her husband Jesus, a construction worker, and their two children. 

Each time they have to use the restroom they have to walk a couple of blocks to the community facility.  To avoid this inconvenience when showering, they simply use a bucket and cup at their house.  The family has been living here for the last 5 years, working hard to save and continuously improve their house.  When they first moved into their house the family bought kitchen appliances, but they have been using and storing them on their front porch because they have no space inside the house.  

Since Leticia and Jesus do not have formal jobs and their income is low and variable, around $800 USD a month, neither of them has access to credit from banks or other organizations.  Leticia has been saving for the last three months to finish building the kitchen and a bathroom for the family.  She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment for required building materials.  The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  

The kitchen will provide a healthy space for the family to cook and eat and the bathroom will give a healthier way of life and privacy to the family.  Leticia and Jesus want to make sure they take the right steps to give better opportunities to their children, and support them as they work their way through school.

loans.use: to pay for materials to build a kitchen and a bathroom

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works with her husband, Felix, growing and selling avocados.  They have four kids and currently live in a house with a tin roof and no bathroom.  Josefina says she is used to having no proper bathroom.  She grew up not having one and never expected to.  But now, she sees her kids bathing with a bucket every morning and having to use a latrine which is not very sanitary. 

Felix and Josefina have been saving for some time to make the necessary additions to their home.  They know that a proper roof and a complete bathroom will not only make life more comfortable but also healthier.  They are asking for a loan to finish paying for the materials they need to build the bathroom and a cement roof instead of the tin roof they currently have. 

Josefina and Felix make around $600 USD a month, and they have no access to other types of credit.  The family will receive supervisory visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new construction will give their children and the rest of the family more privacy and a healthier life.  The family looks forward to cooler summers and warmer winters.  Josefina is aware that dedication and hard work is what and will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bathroom and a cement roof

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 28 years old and a single young woman with two children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, and green beans that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Terry needs a loan to buy rakes, bush knives, seeds, chemicals, and a wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. Terry will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and support her children's future education.

loans.use: to pay for rakes, bush knives, seeds, chemicals, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en:
Ryad is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and his child in Jenin, a Palestinian city in the northern West Bank. It is a major agricultural center for the surrounding towns. In 2007 the city had a population of 39,004.
Ryad is asking Ryada for this loan to build windows and doors for his house and to paint it, which will help him take a step forward, because he has a shortage of money to do these things he needs. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to build windows and doors for his house and to paint it, because he has a shortage of money to do these things he needs.

loans.name: Joeniel

texts.en:
Joeniel is married, with two children, and he earns a living from his transport service business. For four years in the business, he has earned well and he had successfully repaid his previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). This loan was used to add accessories to his motor, for better service. 

Recently, Joeniel borrowed a new loan to buy new tires for his existing motorcycle. He is hopeful to gain more profit, to meet the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una joven que vive en la ciudad de Chincha y la cual trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de una pequeña de 1 año.

Maribel está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que con su apoyo podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio en especial abarrotes al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, entre otros; de esta manera podrá atender mejor a sus clientes; así podrá seguir luchando por hacer realidad su sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Maribel is a young woman who lives in the city of Chincha and works in her small grocery store from which she receives income in order to get ahead, especially for her one-year-old daughter. 

Maribel is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she has been able to purchase goods for her business, particularly grocery items, at wholesale prices including rice and sugar. In this way, she will be able to better serve her customers and continue fighting to make her dream of owning a mini market a reality.

loans.use: to purchase goods.

loans.name: Ma. Nezel

texts.en:
Ma. Nezel is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Ma. Nezel works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nezel runs a buy and sell rice and charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell.

Ma. Nezel has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ma. Nezel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is a married woman with six children, two of whom still attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

She operates a clothes selling business, which she sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality, and she dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zedei Bestabe

texts.en:
Zedei lives in Totolapan with her husband Irving and their son Kevin.  They live near her mother and grandmother.  This makes it really easy for Zedei to drop Kevin with her grandma every morning and then walk to the market, where she sells cooked meals with her mother.  Zedei has been working at the market for over three years.  Irving works as a farmer in the fields of their neighbors.  Zedei and Irving have been married for a little more than three years. 

Every month they use some of their income to build more of their house.  They have come a long way but still there are some additions to be made.  Right now the family uses Zedei's mother's bathroom, next to their own house.  She is happy to help them and have them there every evening when they shower, but for the family this arrangement has become a little uncomfortable.  They also want to build a bedroom for Kevin since he is growing up very fast and may be joined by a sibling soon. 

Zedei and Irving make around $600 USD a month.  Since they are both informally self employed, they have no way of showing their income and therefore have no access to formal credit.  With their loan they will receive all the building materials they need as well as technical assistance and supervision from certified technicians, who will monitor and supervise the construction work to make sure that all quality and safety standards are met.  

Zedei is excited to see her house and her dreams grow, but most of all, she is excited to build a beautiful house where Kevin and her future children will grow up.

loans.use: to pay for materials to build a bathroom and a bedroom

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel works selling insoles for shoes.  He has been doing this for 60 years and is well known around town.  He has been living in a single room house for the last eight years and has saved for a while to make additions to his house.  He wishes to add a room for a kitchen, another for a living room, and a complete bathroom. 

Manuel has no technical knowledge of construction and he buys materials in small quantities, meaning he misses out on savings from bulk prices.  Manuel has been saving and is asking for credit to complete the payment of the materials needs.  By working with Ecoblock International he will also be part of a program that gives borrowers building materials at bulk prices, technical training, assistance, and supervision to make sure that construction meets all safety and quality regulations. 

From his business, Manuel makes $600 USD a month.  Given his age and the informality of his business, he has no opportunity for credit from other institutions.  Manuel has invested a lot of time and effort into his home renovations and he wishes to finish this work the right way.  This is the opportunity he has to make it right.

loans.use: to buy materials to complete building two rooms and a bathroom

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 61 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta tercer grado, lastimosamente no pudo seguir estudiando; ya que desde muy joven tubo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia, ella esta soltera se separo de su esposo hace muchos años y tubo que dedicarse a cuidar y mantener ella sola a sus tres hijos, un hijo vive con ella pero, ya esta acompañado trabaja de albañil también su nieta de 8 meses y su nuera pero ninguno depende de ella, ya que se ayudan mutuamente .

Ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas vivas, realiza esa actividad desde hace 40 años, con este negocio ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y construido su casita en la que ahora vive. El negocio viene de familia y pues teniendo la necesidad de llevar un ingreso a su familia empezó a vender gallinas y solamente se dedica a eso. Ella viaja 2 veces por semana, hasta la capital del país. Sus hijos le ayudan de ves en cuando, los días que va vender se va a las 5 de la mañana y regresa hasta por la tarde.     


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para la compra de mas gallinas; ya que en estas fechas la venta incrementa un poco mas, comprando mas la venta incrementa mas y esto hace que sus ganancias también se vean incrementadas.
texts.en:
Marina is 61 years old and has a third grade education. Unfortunately she was not able to finish her schooling because she began work at a very young age so she could support her family. Marina separated from her husband many years ago and has had to care and provide for her three children alone. One son still lives with her but is now married. He works in construction and his daughter is eight months old but they and his wife do not depend on her because they are able to support each other together. 

Marina sells live chickens, an activity that she has carried for forty years. With this business she has gotten her children ahead and built her own home where she lives. This work has been a family business and due to the need to make a living for her family, she began to sell chickens, the only economic activity that she carries out. She travels to the country's capital twice a week. Her children help her occasionally. On days that she goes out to sell, she leaves at 5:00am and returns in the afternoon. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more chickens because in these days her sales are increasing a little bit. By buying more, Marina will sell more and this will mean that she will also see her earnings increase.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a responsible mother of two children and a member of a three person lending group. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He owns a chicken shop in the market; this shop is the only income for the family. 

Presently he is in need of purchasing chicken from the poultry farm to continue his work. However due to lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife has requested a loan to help her husband continue his work. 

Surriya hopes that the loan will be a productive one for her husband. She dreams of providing a quality education to their children. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Surriya raises her hand.

loans.use: To purchase chicken to sell.

loans.name: Biverly

texts.en:
Biverly is a married woman with four children.  She is 41 years old and a diligent entrepreneur. Biverly has operated a retail store for over four years.

Biverly would like a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her general store. This loan will enable her to purchase  items such as soap, snack food, soft-drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell.  She hopes to obtain the loan to expand her retail store business, save enough money and further educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soap, snack food, soft-drinks, canned goods and noodles for her retail store.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a business woman who is very hardworking. She is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom are adults.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Dzame has operated a charcoal selling business for the past ten years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 41 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Geronima is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Geronima requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Geronima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia and her husband Gregorio live with their three children in Totolapan, Morelos.  Patricia works as a cleaner in a motel a couple of towns away.  She has long hours but says she would rather work there than in the field like her husband.  Patricia and Gregorio have worked really hard to have the house they live in.  However, their kids are growing, especially the two oldest Anastacia and Sara, and these girls need a bedroom of their own to replace the living room they currently sleep in. 

Patricia knows that the family can be protected against the cold weather in winter and hot temperatures in summer if they change their current tin roof to a proper cement roof.  This change will also help them keep the house in better condition and will improve the health of the family.  Patricia has been saving for the last three months to buy materials for the improvements she wants to make to house.  She is requesting a loan to finish paying for the materials. 

Patricia and Gregorio both have informal jobs and low incomes so many institutions will not give them credit.  The family will receive supervisory visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new construction will give this family a healthier life and a space for the girls to have more privacy.  Patricia is aware that dedication and hard work is what makes dreams come true.

loans.use: to build a bedroom for her daughters and a proper roof

loans.name: Senorino

texts.en:
Senorino has lived in Totolapan, Morelos, and has worked as a cactus grower for the last 30 years of his life.  His wife Maria Luisa used to help him but with four kids she is pretty busy at home!  To have some extra cash for household expenses Senorino started using his own truck as a unregistered taxi, taking take his neighbors that had no transportation to where they needed to go. 

With his two jobs Senorino makes around $1,000 USD a month.  Today the family lives in a house which they feel suits them well.  The only problem is that all the rooms in the house have a tin roof instead of a proper roof.  This has brought some problems to the family regarding their health, especially to their youngest child who has a respiratory disease. 

Senorino has been saving for the last three months to buy the materials needed to build a proper roof above their house.  With his loan Senorino will also receive technical assistance and supervisory visits to make sure the new roof meets quality and safety standards.  Senorino is sure that once the roof is done the high temperatures in summer will be more bearable and they will be shielded from the strong winds in winter.  Senorino is also sure that her daughter's health will start to improve.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper roof for his house

loans.name: Noren Alexander

texts.es: Noren de 40 años de edad vive en casa alquila con su esposa y sus hijos, el posee un taller de enderezado y pintura en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y amabilidad, Noren esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz y repuestos para compresor, para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noren is a 40-year old man who lives in a rented house with his wife and children. He has had a straightening and painting workshop at home for several years and has good clientele thanks to the quality of his work and his friendliness. 

Noren is requesting a loan to buy paint, varnish and compressor replacement parts, so that he can continue working. His job is his only income source to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish and compressor replacement parts.

loans.name: Olepa Mary

texts.en:
Olepa is 37 years old, a single woman with five children. She owns and operates a small business selling items such as pork buns and donuts. She has been doing this for three years. 

Olepa needs a loan to purchase a sack of sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour, yeast, a frying pan, icing cream, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. Olepa will use her profit to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour, yeast, a frying pan, icing cream, etc

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 39-years-old. He has spent five years in the business of farming. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 30-years-old. He is married with three children. With a Kiva loan, he would like to use it to buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: to buy fertilizers for use during maize production.

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 29-years-old.  He has been a maize farmer for the past six years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production.  With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. t

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Jinefer

texts.en:
Jinefer is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jinefer has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jinefer has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is 51 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, Macaria works very hard to provide for them.

Macaria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like eggs, soft drinks, biscuits, rice, etc. to sell.

Macaria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as eggs, soft drinks, biscuits, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, and cooking  oil for resale for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, and cooking  oil for resale

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 22 years old and comes from Yerevan. She lives with her parents and sister. Liana studies at Yerevan State Slavonic University and currently is in her 4th year of study. Liana doesn't work as she needs to study hard and can't manage work and study at the same time. Her parents are working at a local company and do their best to cover the family's costs. 

Currently, the family is facing difficulties which don’t allow Liana to pay for her education. So, she has applied for this loan to pay for university tuition of the first semester and be able to continue her education.

The loan is very important for Liana and she will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for the first semester

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio is a farmer in Totolapan, Morelos and the father two children.  Every morning Ignacio gets up at 3:00 am to work in the field.  He plants tomatoes, cactus and cucumber.  Ignacio and Aida, his wife, are always trying to find new products to plant and sell so they can give their family a better life.  Their hard work earns them roughly $700 USD a month.  

Ignacio has worked hard to buy a piece of land and start building his house.  He wishes to build a house where his family can live comfortably and he and his wife can grow old.  He has been saving for the last three months to build two additional rooms, and this loan will help him pay for the materials needed for construction.  Ignacio has no access to credit with other organizations because he has an informal job that does not pay much and his cash flows are irregular.  He and his wife will work together to build this addition to their home, and will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  

The new, closed bedroom they intend to build for their son will help him overcome his constant sickness.  In less than 3 months, as a result of this loan, Ignacio and Aida will be able to live in a better house and provide their children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bedroom for his family's house

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 15 años y dos años de edad.  María trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones habitacionales. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y hortalizas en el mercado central de su localidad. Tiene 7 años de dedicarse al negocio y esta es su principal fuente de ingresos. Desea reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera y vara de castilla ya que es lo que se ha dañado y necesita cambio lo antes posible. Espera poder tener este financiamiento para hacer las reparaciones lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is a 35-year old woman and single mother of two children, aged 15 and 2. María works very hard to support his family and to give his children the best living conditions. She has been selling vegetables in the central market of her locality for 7 years. This business is her main income source.
