She wants to repair the ceiling of her house, which is damaged, and is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy wood and sticks. She expects to obtain the loan to make the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy wood and sticks to repair the ceiling of her house.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es: María de 50 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos de 15 años, 14 años, 18 años, y 2 meses de edad. Ella es la cabeza del hogar ya que desde que su esposo murió es la responsable de la economía y educación de sus hijos. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. En la actualidad no cuenta con agua potable y desea hacer la introducción de la misma y construir una pila para poder almacenarla. Solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo, cemento y para la introducción del servicio de agua potable.
texts.en:
María is a 50-year old woman who lives in her own house with her four children, aged 18, 15, 14 and 2 months. Since her husband died, she has been the head of the house and responsible for the finances and education of the children. She has been selling vegetables and offering home services for many years. She currently does not have drinkable water and wishes to build a basin to keep it. 

She is requesting this loan to FUSIA to buy sand, bricks and cement to make drinkable water available to her family.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks and cement to make drinkable water available to her family.

loans.name: Thoraya

texts.en:
Thoraya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
Thoraya is a 25-year-old, married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and two kids; a son and a daughter in a small simple house in the city. Thoraya's husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Thoraya and her husband would like to improve the family living conditions and all necessities. 
Thoraya took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a water purification machine for her home. By taking this loan, Thoraya will be able to provide pure water for her family since the water in her area is not clean.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for her home.

loans.name: Merciditha

texts.en:
Merciditha works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a general store business for 39 years. 

Merciditha requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, eggs, noodles, can goods, etc.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, egg, noodles, can goods, etc

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 49-year-old married man with three school aged children. He has managed a corn farm in his village for almost twenty seven years. His last crop  earned a net profit of 22,000 PHP. His profits were used to build a deep well beside his house. Due to insufficient funds, Edwin would like to request a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that his farm will continue to grow and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 20 years old and has a live-in partner and one school-aged child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jean has run a general store business for 2 years and requests a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, sanitary napkins, diapers, laundry soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell. 

Mary Jean would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, sanitary napkins, diapers, laundry soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a farmer and lives with his wife Rosa and their son.  Every morning, he gets up before the sun rises to work in the field.  Meanwhile, Rosa stays home cleaning, cooking, and taking care of their child.  Every afternoon, Rosa goes out with their son to sell what Julio Cesar grows in the field.  Their hard work earns them roughly $600 USD a month. 

Julio Cesar has worked hard over the years and has been able to build a home for his family.  However, their house is small even for the young family.  They all live, cook, eat and sleep in the same room.  Julio and Rosa know that more children will come soon and they need to expand before that happens.  The family has been saving for the last three months to add two additional bedrooms and one bathroom to this house.  This loan will help them pay for the materials needed to finish the construction and get expert supervision. 

Julio Cesar has no access to credit with other organizations because he has an informal job that does not pay much and has irregular cash flows.  The family will work together to build this addition to their home.  They will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction, and to prevent them from losing all the time and money they have already invested.  In less than 3 months, Julio Cesar, Rosa and their child will be able to live in a better house with more space, that allows them to lead a healthier lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bedroom and a bathroom

loans.name: Maria Belen Elizabeth

texts.en:
Maria Belen lives with her husband, Mario, and their three children in Totolapan Morelos.  Maria has made a living selling prepared food in a stall at the market for the last 14 years.  Mario works in the field growing and cropping vegetables for other farmers.  Maria and Mario work hard to give their children the opportunity they didn't have to study, at least through middle school, and have a better life.  Their youngest son, Juan Pablo, still sleeps with his parents because of lack of space.  Meanwhile Maritza and Manuel, who are two fast growing teenagers, share the same room which has become a challenge.  They both need their own space to study, sleep and live.  

Maria is always looking out for her children and understands the importance of giving each of them their space at this critical age.  Maria and Mario make no more than $800 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible to them.  For the last three months, they have been saving to build a bedroom for the boys and finish the kitchen, which doesn't have a proper roof.  Maria needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials.  She and her husband will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  This new addition will give everyone in the family the space they need, and as a result will make it easier for her children to study and do their homework.  Maria is aware that dedication and hard work is what will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room and finish the kitchen

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 31-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned and successfully run an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidery by machine in the nearby town for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons for embroidery work on daily wages; he also brings some material to home for Fozia because she helps him with embroidery work. He is very expert in his trade, and is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art and are appreciative of his efforts. 

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses and that is why he wants to buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance.

Fozia requires some capital to buy the desired  inventory for her husband but she does not have a sufficient amount. So she has humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. With this loan her husband would be able to buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Fozia is very glad about the loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a forty-six-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is running a restaurant. The reason for starting this business was to get income to support her family. 

Betty is facing a challenge of limited space for her operations. However, she has a vision of having a well-equipped outside catering business.

Betty has asked for a loan to buy utensils to use for outside catering.

loans.use: to buy utensils to use for outside catering.

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Sandra está solicitando un crédito para poder hacerle una mejoras a su vivienda y es construir unos cuartos para sus dos hijos, ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita dio crédito y así poder comprar arena, cemento, hierro, ladrillos, pago de mano de obra, etc. y así puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 35-year-old single mother who lives in her own home with her two children.  She has made her living selling clothes for several years.  With her earnings she has managed to cover some of the household expenses.

She is seeking a loan so that she can make improvements to her home and build rooms for her two children.  Her current earnings aren't enough to cover these improvements, so she is seeking credit.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase sand, cement, iron, and bricks, as well as to pay for labor and other costs. This will enable her family to live in a more comfortable and secure manner.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, iron, and bricks, as well as to pay for labor and other costs.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María de 23 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de fruta partida en su lugar de residencia y de esta forma junto  su compañero de vida llevan la economía del hogar y tratan de sacar adelante a su hijo. Desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y no es muy higiénico. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava para dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María, 23, lives in her own house with her life partner and small 4-year-old son. She makes her living selling a variety of sliced fruit from her house, and in this way she and her life partner manage the household expenses and try to provide for their son. 
She would like to improve the conditions of the floor of the house, since it is currently a dirt floor and isn’t very hygienic. In order to do this, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy sand, cement, and gravel to start the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel to repair the floor of her house.

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es: Silvia de 36 años de edad  habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir desde hace 15 años por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Silvia es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, agujas, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 36-year old woman who lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She works in the dressmaking business and has sold clothes for 15 years, which has given her a lot of experience and, above all, regular clients that choose her more and more each day. Her business is located in her house. Silvia is a very hard-working and responsible woman and many people give good references about her, as a person and a professional. She makes clothes at affordable prices and of good quality. 

She has decided to request this loan to INTEGRAL to invest in her business and buy the necessary supplies: fabric, thread, elastics, needles, etc. to make the clothes. Her goal is to provide her clients with a better service so that they will be motivated to come to her when needed. She expects to see her sales and income increase and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastics, needles, etc.

loans.name: Logo

texts.en: Logo is a 50 year old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years. Logo has requested a loan to buy weed killer, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives and rakes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Logo hopes to improve her plantation and financially support her family and her children.

loans.use: to pay for weed killer, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives and rakes.

loans.name: Mesepi

texts.en: Mesepi is a 54-year-old woman who is married with eight children. She has a small business selling fish. She has been working in this business for three years. Mesepi needs a loan to buy fishing nets, canoes, spears, goggles,and knives etc. She will use her profits to support her family and her children's education as well. Mesepi joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, canoes, spears, goggles, and knives etc.

loans.name: Higuerón (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las 14 socias y 1 socio  del Banco Comunal  Higuerón. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, comercio en general  entre otras actividades. Ellas al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  hace un tiempo atrás para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la  señora Gema,  tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de  esta  relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y de 6  años que estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera. 
Doña Gema hace años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad, con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a solventar los gasto que genera el hogar  desde hace mas de 5 años instalo un pequeño taller de costura en su casa,  son muchas las personas que llegan hasta su hogar a que les realice arreglos o que les confesiones prendas de vestir, por lo general son ropa de niños y de damas lo que más confecciona, trabaja todos los días y le gusta ya además de ganar algo por el bien de sus familia también le permite estar en casa para poder ayudarles a sus hijos con las tareas de los estudios.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar una máquina de coser y así mejorar la calidad de sus trabajos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para seguir con su negocio. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su familia.
La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Higuerón is made up of fourteen women and one man.  They meet every fifteen days in a place named Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo.  The members are involved in a diverse array of business activities, such as agriculture and commerce.  Some time ago, upon learning about La Fundación Espoir, they decided to form their community bank so that they could take advantage of loans from this institution.

One of the members of this group is Gema.  She is twenty-five years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children who are 6 and 10 years of age.  The children attend a local school.  Her husband works at a gas station.

Gema learned the trade of tailoring a few years back at a school in the city, with the intention of being able to earn something through her own efforts and thus be able to help with the household expenses.  Over five years ago, she installed a small sewing shop in her home.  Many people come to her so that she can repair their clothing or make new clothing for them.  She mainly makes clothing for women and children.  She works every day.  She enjoys the work, since apart from allowing her to make some income for the good of her family, it permits her to be at home so that she can help her children with their homework.

She will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine and thus improve the quality of her work.  She has been with the community bank since the beginning, and she finds the loans to be helpful so that she can continue in her business.  Her dream is to give the best possible life to her family.

The small photo shows three members who were not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is 44 years old. He lives in Jenin with his wife and three children; all of them attend primary school. One year ago, he started to run his own grocery store which helped him in gathering money and improving his income. He sells different kinds of food stuff, like soft drinks and kids’ stuff. He hopes that this loan will allow him to buy goods to sell, and shelves. He hopes that this business increase continues and increases his income to be able to give his children a good condition in life, and meet their needs. He plans to open a supermarket in the future. Bilal is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell, and shelves.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina has worked in the field for as long as she can remember.  Being a single mom always gave her more responsibilities and more energy, she believes, to endure the hardships of labor.  Marcelina lives now with her two youngest children.  Although she gets a pension because of her age, she still does some work to cover the household expenses.  In total, she makes around $800 USD as her monthly income. 

When she started receiving her pension, she expanded her two room house to include a bedroom, a living room, and a larger kitchen.  However, she soon found that she miscalculated the expenses and did not have the right technical knowledge to do it alone.  Given her age and low income, Marcelina is not able to apply for a credit with other institutions.  She is asking for this credit to finish paying for the materials needed to complete the construction work she already started.  

Marcelina will receive technical assistance and supervision visits by expert architects to make sure the construction work is not only finished, but also built for lasting quality.  Marcelina is excited to see her house improvements completed; she has been investing for some years trying to complete it so she can live more comfortably.  Now, with guidance and help, she'll be able to do so.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building the kitchen, living room and bedroom of her house

loans.name: Santa Rosalia

texts.en:
Santa Rosalia is a young girl that has been saving and working hard to build her house.  Soon after she got a job as kitchen assistant at a nearby hotel, she started saving to get her own place.  Ten years later she lives in her own home which she has been developing little by little. 

Santa wishes to have a family soon and believes this is the perfect place for them to live.  Although Santa's house has enough space, she is still missing proper windows and doors for her house.  She has been saving and can cover almost all the cost, and is asking for a loan to complete the payment for the materials she need to finish and install the windows and doors.  Santa makes around $550 USD per month through a job that gives her no proof or regular income so no traditional institution will giver her credit.  With this loan, Santa will receive technical assistance and supervision from certified technicians to make sure that the work she does complies with all standards of quality and safety.

Santa wishes to see her house finished and feel proud of what she has been able to build with a lot of work and effort.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors for her house

loans.name: Ciro

texts.en:
Ciro is the owner of the local convenience store in Totolapan, Morelos.  He has been working there for over 35 years, first helping his father and now managing the business.  These days his wife Ema helps him with some tasks of the business.  Ema and Ciro have been married for a long time, and their children have flown the coop and now live with their own families.  

When they first built their current home, there was no water or sewage service so the thought of a complete bathroom was never in their plans.  Thirty years later things have changed in Totolapan.  For some time now they have been thinking about adding a bathroom to the house.  They also want to add a living room now that their grandchildren and their own kids come to visit their home so often.  The area where the grandchildren currently play is near the couple's stove, which makes Ema nervous.

Ema and Ciro have no access to credit through traditional banking because of their income and their age.  They have been saving for some months to pay for building materials and are requesting credit to complete the payment. With this credit they will also receive technical assistance and supervisory visits to make sure that the new construction meets quality and safety standards.  Ciro and Ema are excited to have a complete bathroom and a living room were they can welcome their extended family.

loans.use: to pay for materials to build a living room and a bathroom

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in Yerevan with her family. She is a mother of three children. Her elder daughter studies at Armenian State Agrarian University and is currently in her 3rd year of study. Gayane and her husband work hard to be able to sustain their children's living and cover their basic needs. Gayane is now applying for this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition. Because of family's current financial hardships, Gayane isn't able to save money and the loan will greatly assist her.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is 52-years-old, married with five children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anaclita has a general store business in the Philippines.  Anaclita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

Anaclita has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Anaclita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica works hard to support her family.  Monica is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Monica requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Monica has been in this business for thirteen years now.

In the future, Monica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Santos Maribel

texts.es: Santos de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad y su esposo, ella posee un negocio donde vende una variedad de productos como cinchos, correas y bósales para perros, espejos, etc. desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo  logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Sandra está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y poder surtir aun mas su negocio para poder obtener más ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children.  She has a business selling a variety of products, such as collars and leashes for dogs, as well as mirrors and other items.  She has done this work for several years, and with her earnings and the help of her husband, she has managed to support her family.

She is seeking a loan so that she can purchase more products at wholesale and stock her business with even more goods.  This will lead to higher earnings and greater financial stability for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase collars and leashes for dogs, as well as mirrors and other items at wholesale.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Candelario de 40 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 20 años, 17 años, 15 años y 13 años de edad. Candelario trabaja como jornalero desde hace mucho tiempo, esta ocupación le permite ganarse el pan de cada día y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Candelario habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea reparar el techo de la casa que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina, madera y  vara de castilla para dar inicio a la reparación del techo y así dar a su familia mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Candelario is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four children, ages 20, 17, 15 and 13. He has worked as a day laborer for a long time now, which allows him to earn a living and provide for his family.

Candelario lives in very humble conditions. He would like to repair the roof of his house, which has deteriorated with the passage of time. He is requesting this loan of FUSAI to buy laminated sheeting, wood and “vara de castilla”, which is a local cane/bamboo. Candelario will use these materials to begin to repair his roof and improve his family’s security.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting, wood and “vara de castilla” [a local cane/bamboo] to repair his roof.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Silvia de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos, los precios y al amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender Silvia está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más zapatos por mayor y así seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in the house that they own. She earns her living selling shoes; her business is located in her residence. She has a large clientele because of the variety of her products, her prices, and her courteous treatment of her customers. 

Silvia is requesting a loan to be able to buy more shoes at wholesale; this will enable her to continue with her work, since that is her only source of income, and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of footwear at wholesale

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is a 23-year-old, single woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Lupe has requested a loan to purchase a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush knives, fertilizer, and weedkiller. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. With her profits, Lupe hopes to improve her plantation and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush knives, fertilizer, and weedkiller.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is running a general store in her village for a living. She has been in her business for 27 years, and she earns well for the needs of her family. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. Merlyn always finds ways to augment her living. Hopefully she will offer a better life to her two children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. Aside from this, Shiela sells fish in her community to add to her income from farming. For five years in her farm she has earned enough for her daily needs and she was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC  successfully. She used her previous loan to improve the farm. Recently, she requests a new loan to buy more fish to resell. In the future, Shiela wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nyamekoma Group

texts.en:
This group is part of Nuru group of six farmers called Nyamekoma and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand is Joseph. He is 21 years old, and married with three children who attend school. Joseph has been a member of the group for three years and he is the group’s chairperson.

He has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains season. He is however constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase the farm inputs. He believes that the use of farm inputs will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Salamatu.  She is a widow and has three children aged 27, 23 and 20 years old. In 1988, Salamatu established her Maggi (flavor cubes), onions and cooking oil business. She began her business as her own means of generating revenue.

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy  cartons of Maggi, bags of onions and some containers of cooking oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to invest in her children as two of them are in college and one at senior secondary school so that they can take care of her during her aged period. Very hard-working, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of Maggi, bags of onions, and some containers of cooking oil.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet Marie, a 40-year-old woman from the eastern area of Waterloo2 in Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2011, Marie established her medical drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand it.

Marie requires a loan to purchase blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family welfare and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her pharmacy business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: Ariel, a sus 50 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos, a los cuales ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación. Durante los últimos años de su vida productiva trabajó por cuatro años en una empresa productora de lácteos muy reconocida en todo el país, como transportador, pero luego le exigían cambiar el vehículo para poder continuar trabajando pero él no poseía los recursos para hacerlo, por lo que tuvo que retirarse de la empresa. Poco tiempo después vendió su camión y con el dinero que recibió inició su propio taller de mecánica automotriz con los pocos conocimientos que había adquirido de manera empírica mientras trabajaba como conductor; de esta forma ha logrado generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar durante 7 años que lleva su negocio en funcionamiento. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar herramientas de trabajo, un taladro y surtido de repuestos al por mayor (bujías, luces, retrovisores, ejes, frenos, entre otros) y cancelar algunas deudas que tiene pendientes; esto le permitirá reponer la herramientas que se le han perdido y así poder mejorar la prestación de su servicio, pues contará con los insumos y las herramientas necesarias, optimizando así el tiempo de labor y logrando atender mayor número de clientes; que le generarán un nivel más alto de ingresos. De esta manera, Ariel desea seguir trabajando para darle continuidad a su negocio, fortalecerlo más y hacerlo crecer para que le permita generar mejores ingresos con los que desea abrir paralelamente, un almacén de repuestos, que complementará la entrada de dinero para llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ariel, who is 50 years old, is married and the father of two children whom he has taken care of with sacrifice and dedication. During the last years of his employment, he worked for four years at a nationally-known producer of dairy products as a deliveryman. However, at that point they required that he replace his vehicle to continue working. Since he didn't have the resources to do it, he had to resign from the company. Soon after, he sold his truck; with the money he received and the little bit of on-the-job knowledge he had acquired as a driver, he opened his own auto mechanic's shop. For the seven years that he has been running this business, he has managed to generate the income he needs to pay for the basic needs of his household. 

Currently, he is requesting the support of a loan; he hopes to buy work tools, a drill, and assorted replacement parts at wholesale (spark plugs, lights, rearview mirrors, axles, brakes, and other parts) and to pay off some outstanding debts. This will allow him to replace the tools that have gotten lost and improve the service he provides. With the necessary supplies and tools on hand, he will optimize his labor time and be able to serve a larger number of customers, thus generating additional income. Ariel hopes to keep working in that way to keep his business running, strengthen it, and grow it in order to generate greater income. With that extra income, he would like to open a parts shop alongside his workshop; this will supplement the money coming in to sustain his household and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work tools, a drill, and assorted replacement parts at wholesale (spark plugs, lights, rearview mirrors, axles, brakes, and other parts) and to pay off some outstanding debts

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married, with one child.  She manages their farm as an aid to her husband's income from employment as seaman. 

She grows and harvests bananas and also raises pigs to sell. From three years in selling pigs in town, she was able to provide the needs of her child in school. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMOC microcredit to buy feed in order to boost her pigs. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Turgunbuu

texts.ru: Тургунбуу 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Тургунбуу - высшее образование, работает учителем в местной школе. Супруг нигде не работает, помогает по хозяйству. Заготавливает сено и корма на зимний период для скота. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Тургунбуу занимается животноводством и садоводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тургунбуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров, 31 овца, а также есть на участке дома небольшой сад с яблонями и сливами. Каждый год от сада идут определенные доходы, так как Тургунбуу со своими детьми собирают плоды яблони и сливы и реализуют его на местном рынке. Все работы относительно ухода за садом ведутся. Супруг Тургунбуу белит и обрабатывает деревья. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тургунбуу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тургунбуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейного авто.
texts.en: Turgunbuu is 50 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband. Turgunbuu has a higher education. She works as a teacher at a local school. Her husband does not work, but he helps on the farm. He prepares hay and feed for the winter for the livestock. To make additional income for her family, Turgunbuu works in animal husbandry and horticulture. She started twelve years ago when she bought livestock for 15,000 KGS. Because of Turgunbuu's hard work, her farm now has eight dairy cows, 31 sheep, and a small garden with apples and plums. Every year, Turgunbuu  and her children gather apples and plums and sell them at the local market. They do all of the work to care for the garden. Turgunbuu's husband trims and cares for the trees. They get a monthly income of 12,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Turgunbuu approached the microfinance bank Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy sheep for breeding. Turgunbuu plans to invest her profits into expanding her number of livestock, and plans to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Khoeurn is 62 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. To make a living, her husband has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. They make an income of $13 daily. To improve her family’s finances, Khoeurn is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase brooms to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business of selling brooms to be able to stabilize her family’s economy.

loans.use: to purchase brooms to sell.

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en:
Leafa is 43 years old and married, with four children. 

She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, and sugar cane that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Leafa needs a loan to buy rakes, chemicals, bush knives, seeds, and a wheel barrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. 

Leafa will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and support her family as well as her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for rakes, chemicals, bush knives, seeds, and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es: A sus 55 años de edad María sigue trabajando muy duro para ganar el pan de cada día. Es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos de 15 años, 16 años y 12 años de edad. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos, la venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Su deseo es dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia por lo que trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mariscos con el fin de hacer crecer sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de mariscos como: camarones, pescado y conchas. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Maria, at age 55, continues to work hard to earn her daily bread.  She is a single mother and lives with her children, ages 15, 16, and 12.  She has been buying and selling seafood on foot for four years.  She wants to improve her family’s living conditions, but also works hard to support the household.  She has decided to buy a large quantity of seafood so she can increase her income, and is therefore asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy shrimp, fish, and clams.  She says that she will be able to repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 25 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business and raises livestock in the Philippines. Pamela requested a 6,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for five years and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Pamela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en:
Sallay is 25 years old and married, with two children. She runs a fish business in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She sells fish within her community. She's been in this business since just after she got married.  She says that sometimes she is faced with a scarcity of fish when the weather condition is poor.

Sally requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and renovate her house. 

In the future, she would like to build a fishing boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling beauty products. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Suzane

texts.en:
Suzana is a married 42-year-old mother of three boys, living in the Ashkali community in a very small house. She is a housewife taking care of the home and children while her husband works as an electrician master, working privately when he has customer demand. He also sells used shoes in the market. Because he is the main source of income, he tries to work as hard and as much as possible in order to provide the most for his family. 

They always wanted to build a new house because there is not enough space for them as it is now, giving the children their own room to sleep and study and play. Suzana is requesting a loan in order to build an annex on her house to expand the living area. The loan will help them to improve their living conditions and she hopes in the future to be able to offer a better life to her family. Her goal is to save money for a better family life and she wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To build an annex on her house to expand the living area.

loans.name: Igball

texts.en:
Igball is married, lives in the southern part of Kosovo, and is a mother of five girls. She is a housewife and her husband works as a guard. Based on family tradition, Igball works in an agricultural business, owning and maintaining cows. She currently has two cows and she plans to add three calves, which is why she is requesting a loan. 

Adding the extra calves will help her to produce and then sell more dairy products in her community and increase her profit and income. Her goal is to secure a future for her children and provide them with a better education. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy three calves.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Fadil is 30, married, and a father of five children: three boys and two girls, between the ages of 8 months and 9 years old. He is employed in a legal department of a private company and his wife is a student waiting to complete her studies. In addition to this work, Fadil also works in agriculture, keeping and raising cows in order to cut down on the family expenses and provide additional income and nutrition.
 
In anticipation of the increase in their family’s expenses, including the children’s school fees and plans for their future education, Fadil started his livestock business in the hopes that the profit would be enough to cover the extra expenses. 

He is requesting a loan in order to renovate his stable and purchase another milk cow. He is planning to sell fresh milk to a local dairy farm and has made a good profit so far. The loan will help him to increase his business. In the future, he plans to add more cows and to increase milk production. He really appreciates all the support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate his stable and purchase another milk cow

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is 54 years old and a residenit of Baray, Kampong Thom province. Her family includes Ra, her husband, and five children. Four of the children are married and live independently now. Ra works the land, cultivating rice in order to generate the necessary income to cover household costs. Ra learned this trade from her parents and older people. She has been doing this work for almost 30 years. Alongside the farming business, she also runs a small grocery store at home, to earn additional income.

Now, Ra is asking for a loan in the sum of KHR 4,000,000. She will use it to increase the merchandise she has available to sell in her store. She will buy different kinds of grocery products, snacks, sweets, and other miscellaneous household items. This way she will be able to satisfy her customers and increase her sales. Ra expresses her thanks to all the lenders who have helped her and her family to further develop their business and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of grocery products, snacks, sweets, and other miscellaneous household items.

loans.name: Cheak

texts.en: Cheak is 34 years old. He is married and resides with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a mechanic who earns about $10 per day. His wife stays home and looks after the children. To improve his family’s finances, Cheak is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk (motorcycle with cabin) to run a public transportation service when he is not doing repair work. By doing so, he will generate more income for the family. In the future, he would like to expand his repair shop and send his children to a good school. Moreover, he wants to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk to run a public transportation service

loans.name: Katsaka

texts.en: Katsaka has managed to go far with her business of selling charcoal. She has expanded her business and now she has many customers. Now again she comes to you requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy eight sacks of charcoal for sale in her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Milica

texts.en:
Milica is 24 years old and is living in a minority community of Kosovo. She is married and the mother of two children, a boy and girl, ages two and four years old. For a long time she has worked in an agriculture business, while her husband works as a security guard and also helps Milica with her work. Milica works on her land and on the land of others with her tractor, planting and harvesting crops. 

She now needs a loan to buy a seeder machine. The loan will help her to continue her business, which brings her a lot of profit and generates income for her family. She is also trying to save the money from this business for her family's future. She hopes in the future to hire an assistant to help her. Her goal is to have better living conditions for her family. Milica wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a seeder machine.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo  logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo. Francisca solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Francisca is 39 years old and sells tortillas out her home.   She has been doing this for several years and works seven days a week.  She has many customers and is a hardworking and friendly woman.  She uses her income to help her husband with the household expenses and lives with her husband and children.  Francisca is asking for a loan to buy quintals of corn and lime so she can continue making tortillas, increase her income, and have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy dried corn and lime.

loans.name: Motusia

texts.en: Motusia is a 22 year old and single young woman with no children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and egg plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Motusia needs a loan to buy rakes, bush knives, chemicals, seeds and a wheel-barrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Motusia will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for rakes, bush knives, chemicals, seeds and a wheel-barrow.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem is 49 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $10 per day.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $5 daily. One of her children in employed in an organization and makes an income of $3 each day. 

Rem is asking for a loan of $1500 to purchase a plot of land next to her house. This purchase will help her obtain a better place to build rooms for rental. By doing so, she will make more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a store at the market and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land next to her house

loans.name: Hajar

texts.en:
Hajar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. so her husband appears in the photo.

Hajar is a 35-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband in a small simple house in the city. Hajar works as an employee in the public sector where she gets a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family. Hajar and her husband would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the things they need.
 
Hajar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water for her home. By taking this loan, Hajar will be able to provide hot water for her family, especially in the winter, with less electricity cost and using clean energy

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for her home

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is 35 years old, married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns $6 each day. Due to a lack of funds, Phally asks for a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use for rice cultivation in the dry season. This money will help improve her husband's crop quality and provide higher yield. In the future, she would like to expand the farming business and help her children attain a higher education. Moreover, she is now saving money to build a new house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 37 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating agricultural crops and fishing for more than five years, earning approximately $13 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed. They are employed as a civil servant and a garment worker. They make an income of $7 each day. 

To improve her crop quality, Chea is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use for her rice cultivation. By doing so, she would be able to receive high yield from her crops. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of raising poultry and pigs. Moreover, she will push her children to study until they get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use for her rice cultivation.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and his three children in Gaza. He worked in the construction field for many years to gain some experience, and after that he decided to open his own business. Now he has a trade and contracting office, and he needs this loan to buy another quantity of cement to sell in order to meet his customers’ needs. This will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.  

Ahmad wants to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success; he believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: to buy another quantity of cement to sell in order to meet his customers’ needs.

loans.name: Louie Jay

texts.en: Louie Jay wants to work overseas in the future. He is studying for a bachelor of science degree in marine technology at Misamis Institute of Technology in Ozamiz City. He is 19 years old and is determined to finish his studies and build his own house in the future. To pay second semester tuition fees, he borrowed 8,500 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which he had joined recently. All of his efforts are not a burden to him because he want to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay second semester tuition fees

loans.name: Jessica Len

texts.en:
Jessica Len, 32 years of age, is married to a policeman. They are blessed with two children. 

She manages a hog-raising business and earns a net income amounting to 3,500 per hog. She also has a retail store for additional income, so she has two businesses. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase hog feed and also grocery items for her retail store. 

She ia hoping that her two businesses will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and also grocery items for her retail store.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for use in her restaurant business, like fish, meat, and vegetables.

Rovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like fish, meat, and vegteables

loans.name: Jovica

texts.en:
Jovica is 35 years old and comes from a minority community. He is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. His wife works as a cleaner in a clinic in their community, and Jovica is a technical worker in the same place of employment. Both of them are working with very low salaries and they don’t earn enough to provide all the needs of the family. 

Currently they live in a house which is in need of renovation, and they would like to repair the façade of the home due to the high cost of electricity, which would save costs on heating in the winter. Jovica, for the first time, is requesting a loan to renovate and repair the façade of the house. The loan will help Jovica and his family to improve their living conditions, and he hopes to offer his children a better life. Jovica and his family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate the facade of his house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a fifty-year-old hardworking lady with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling clothes (alongside farming) in order to boost her income. She is facing the challenges of limited capital and high rental costs. She has a vision of expanding her business to new market areas. 

Rose needs a loan to buy a stock of clothes to sell during the peak of this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to sell during the peak of this Christmas season.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala lives in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. She is married and has five children, three of whom currently attend school. Her husband works as a painter, painting buildings and houses. 

Like all members of the Ashkali community, her family lives in unacceptable conditions. Sala is in need of renovating their house before the approaching winter season, as it is well known that winters in Kosovo are very cold and wet. 

Sala needs a loan in order to buy gravel and cement and to build a façade for her house. Her goal is to improve the living conditions for her family. She really appreciates this opportunity and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate her house before the approaching winter season.

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en:
Sallay is 37 years old and married with four children. She runs a fish-selling business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells fish within her community. She says that sometimes she is faced with scarcity of fish when the weather conditions are poor.

Sallay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 66 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Lucena has been in this business for 40 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en: Bonefance is a 52-year-old hard-working man with three children living in Fort Portal,Uganda. His main business is selling firewood alongside farming. His main challenge is the rainy season whereby his firewood fails to dry, thus reducing his expected income.He has a dream of building a permanent home and generating a lot of income from all his businesses. Bonefance needs a loan to buy trees for splitting firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy trees for splitting firewood to sell.

loans.name: Wara

texts.en:
Wara is in her late 20s and married with two children. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, a western rural area of Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since leaving school and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits in her community. She says that the main problem in her business is the lack of capital to expand it.

Wara requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Myrna has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 37 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. Anabella works very hard to provide for them.

Anabella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, seasonings, diapers, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Anabella has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, seasonings, diapers, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. 

Anabella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, seasonings, diapers, soft drinks, detergent, etc. to sell

loans.name: Selnys

texts.en: Selnys has successfully started out his clean energy enterprise with EarthSpark.  He's very grateful for the first two loans which helped him to earn enough money to send his children to school for this year and adequately feed his family.  He would like to increase his stock to include more products, so is coming back for a third loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Gani

texts.en:
Gani is 55 years old, married, and a father of two boys. He is working in the private sector as a construction worker and his wife is a housewife, taking care of the home and the household needs. His job is the family’s main source of income and he does not earn enough to provide for all the needs of his family and then additional luxuries or unexpected costs. They have planned for long time to side their house and do the general renovations but they could not start without the loan. 

For this reason Gani is now requesting a loan for the material for the façade of his house and to renovate the floor before the wintertime so as to improve the insulation and retain the heat inside. He is hoping to improve the living conditions for his family, providing a healthier and warmer environment and cutting down on the costs of increased expenses and bills. His goal is to offer his children a better life! Gani and his family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy material for the façade of his house and to renovate the floor before the wintertime

loans.name: Malinka

texts.en:
Malinka is 55 years old and lives in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. She is a married mother with a son, staying at home to take care of him and the home while her husband works for the electric company to provide the main source of income for the family. 

Malinka’s family has had a longstanding problem with their toilet. The money her husband generates is not enough to pay for repairing the toilet so now Malinka is asking for a loan to renovate her toilet which is very important for the family's living conditions. She hopes this loan will improve the health of her family, providing a sanitary and clean environment. Her goal is to improve their living conditions. She is very grateful to KIVA lenders providing a way to improve the family's living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To renovate her toilet which is very important for the family's living conditions

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of one son. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is an electrician. He is an expert in his profession. Presently, he needs additional capital to purchase electrical goods for his shop.

For that, Nasira is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase electrical goods like electrical switchboards, switches, electrical wires, and tools so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Nasira hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase electrical goods like electrical switchboards, switches, electrical wires, and tools

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
Роман живет и работает в Дрогобыче. Он занимается перевозкой разнообразных товаров. Работает в этом бизнесе уже 3 года. Есть своя группа постоянных клиентов. 
Роман обратился за суммой в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы купить колеса для своего автомобиля, на котором он постоянно работает. Услугами Романа готовы пользоваться многие, но и постоянные заказы сказываются на автомобиле Романа. Износ машины требует своевременного ремонта и замены запчастей. Роман внимательно следит за своим транспортным средством, чтобы поддерживать бизнес на ходу. Мечта Романа – заработать на собственное жилье, ради чего он готов стараться и дальше, тем более, что бизнес этот – любимое дело Романа.
texts.en:
Roman lives and works in Drogobych, Ukraine.  He is involved in the transportation of various goods.  He has been working in this field for three years already and has his own regular customers.

He is taking a loan of 5,000 Hryvnia in order to buy tires for his car, which he uses regularly.  He is not afraid of offering many services, but the regular orders he receives affect the condition of his car.  Because his car is now showing signs of wear and tear, he needs to repair it and change some of its parts.  Roman carefully monitors the condition of his vehicle, in order to keep his business going.

Roman's dream is to make enough money to afford his own home.  In order to see his dream come true, he is ready to work even more, especially since he has a passion for his job.

loans.use: to buy tires for the car he uses to transport goods.

loans.name: Soloau

texts.en: Soloau is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Soloau has requested a loan to buy rakes, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizers and weedkiller. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Soloau hopes to support her family and improve her plantation.

loans.use: to pay for rakes, bush knives, chemicals, fertilizers and weedkiller.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Regina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Regina has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi operates a food kiosk business selling to her neighbours and passersby.

She is again requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling clothes in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional clothes to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Shareefa

texts.en: Shareefa is a 41 year old lady. All of her devotions are for her husband who earns very low income. Her husband provides services for sheltering for under construction houses.  Most of his work depends upon contracts and most of the time he unable to get any contracts for sheltering services. Recently her husband got a huge contract, but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services.  Shareefa requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services. Shareefa is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of loan raising.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material for services.

loans.name: Gordana

texts.en: Gordana lives in a small village in a minority community. She is 34 years old and a married mother of three boys between the ages of 5 and 11 years old. Two of them are attending school and Gordana works as a teacher in a school while her husband is employed in the electrical company. It is quite clear that unemployment is high in this region and the economy is not developed. They have been planning to improve the conditions of their house for a long time but they could not manage to save the money complete the internal facade. Gordana is requesting a loan in order to renovate the facade of her house. The loan will help her to improve their living conditions, which is her goal for her family. She is aware of Kiva lenders and wants to thank all of them!

loans.use: To renovate the facade of her house

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  

After she got married, Fatmata established her clothing material business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week, moving around the community to establish her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy wax cotton to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to own a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Saliha

texts.en:
Saliha is 27 years old and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of  six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible, however due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore Saliha has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Saliha is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of eight and nineteen. She started her business to get daily survival for her family.

Kadiatu runs a local food business. She sells cooked food within her area and she has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, palm oil and cassava grain to prepare food for her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and build a permanent structure. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, palm oil and cassava grain

loans.name: Jamson

texts.en:
Jamson is a 49-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income though he has another side business of farming, where he earns extra for his living. He faces hardships of competition, limited capital and bad debtors but has dreams of owning a wholesale shop and educating his children to university level.

Jamson is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, soda and beer for the shop to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 44 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo quien trabaja de albañil, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Teresa solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old and lives with her husband in the home of one of her relatives.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  For several years she has sold tortillas from her home.  She works every day of the week.

She has a lot of customers since she is a very hardworking and friendly person.  With the income that she makes, along with the help of her husband, she is able to cover her household expenses.

Teresa is seeking a loan in order to buy corn at wholesale prices so that she can continue making her tortillas.  This will enable her to increase her income and bring greater financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 58 years old and married.  He lives in Rafah city with his wife and their five sons and two daughters in a small simple house.

 Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mohammad and his wife would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.  He has taken a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for his home. 

By taking this loan,Mohammad will be able to provide a hot water for his family, especially in the winter, with less electricity costs and with using clean energy.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his home

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis is a 34 years old and married, from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and their four sons and two daughters in a small simple house in the city. 

Khamis works as an employee in a local firm, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Khamis and his wife would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.  Khamis took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for his home. 

By taking this loan, Khamis will be able to provide a hot water for his family, especially in the winter, with less electricity costs and with using clean energy 

Khamis appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his home.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 40 years old and married, with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vevencia has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, paints, wax, etc.

Vevencia has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy addtional materials like wood, paints, wax, etc

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is married and has been blessed with four kids. She lives i her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for her two children. 

She operates a fish-selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business, and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Phala

texts.en:
Phala is 52 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $7 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $10 every day. 

To improve her business, Phala asked for a loan of $1300 to purchase materials to produce fish paste to sell. This money will help her expand the business and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house’s roof and help her children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make fish paste

loans.name: Inailau

texts.en:
Inailau is a 32-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years.
