Inailau has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, spades, bush knives, weed killer and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Inailau hopes to improve her plantation and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: buy farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, shampoo, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar junto con su madre, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para su negocio ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguirá ayudando en su hogar en lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur sells all types of personal products such as lotions, deodorants, perfumes, creams, shampoos and other items.  She runs her business out of her home.  With the income that she makes, she is able to help with the household expenses.  She lives in the home of a relative along with her mother.

She wishes to expand her business.   She is seeking a loan so that she can purchase everything that is necessary for her business.  She already has many customers, since she offers her products at accessible prices.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to increase her income and thus continue helping provide her family with everything that they need.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, deodorants, perfumes, creams, shampoos and other items.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. Ahmad is the main income source for the family. He covers the expenses with the income that he earns from his blacksmithing business. He has been involved in this type of business for the past five years and owns his shop. 

Today, with this youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Ahmad will purchase a large quantity of metal which he needs urgently to continue to work properly and efficiently. Ahmad is very positive and tends to always satisfy his family’s needs by meeting their requirements constantly.

loans.use: buy metal materials

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and his two children in Jalboun village in Jenin.  Jalboun is located in the eastern region of the city of Jenin, about 12 kilometers away and has a population of 2500 people.  According to statistics in 2000, it is famous for the cultivation of cereals, legumes and olives, and is mostly woodland. There are two schools for boys and girls, and public education through high school.  There is a village council.

Ramzi is asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house.  This will help him take a step forward, because he has shortage in money to buy the things he needs.  Temporarily they live now in a relative’s house until their house being ready. Ramzi is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: buy flagstones to pave his house

loans.name: Lucky Group

texts.en:
Gemma is the featured borrower of Lucky group.  She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work in order to provide for their families with the necessary living needs.

Gemma is a 41-year-old widowed mother of five children, whom she sacrifices her living for their education and living.  She is a hard worker who puts so much effort in developing her children's living and education. Her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her children's necessary school fees.  She is their sole breadwinner since her husband passed away.  To make sure that they will get an education, she works hard to provide for them. 

Gemma is working as a housekeeper and hopes that one day she can go back to the Philippines and start her own business next to her beloved children.

Gemma is the lady at the left side of the picture with blue top.  As for the other group members, Erna is in the middle, and Claire is the first from the right.

loans.use: pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Welmie

texts.en:
Welmie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Welmie has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns more income from a general store and farming rice.

Welmie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy rice to sell

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is married and has children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  She operates a water selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she operates a food selling business to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this KES 50,000 loan, Mwanahamisi  wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: María Gumercinda

texts.es:
María de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, ya no pudo seguir estudiando por los escasos recursos económicos de su familia. Estuvo acompañada, pero se separo del esposo y hoy esta sola, no tiene hijos en su casa, ellos están casados y viven aparte, con ella vive una sobrina quien le ayuda en el negocio.

Tiene varios negocios, pero al que se dedica todos los días es a la tortilleria y venta de productos de belleza. Ademas, criá pollos de engorde en la temporada de fin de año y lleva haciendo lo mismo por 11 años, pues teniendo la necesidad de llevar un ingreso a su familia se decidió con el negocio de hacer tortillas y así de la misma manera fue involucrando los demás negocios que a la fecha se dedica. 

Ademas de los otros negocios destaza cerdos 2 veces por semana, las actividades la realiza en su casa no tiene que viajar al trabajo le ayuda solamente una sobrina y empieza desde las 5 de la mañana has ta las 3 de al tarde.


 El préstamo lo invertirá, para comprar de maíz para la tortilleria y la compra de pollos de engorde para venderlos en las fiestas de fin de año. Pues hará crecer  mas sus ingresos, ya que en la venta de pollo le queda mucha ganancia e incrementara mas su inventario para la venta de tortillas, pues no tenia todo el dinero para comprar todos lo pollos que ella vende y con el préstamo se le dará la oportunidad de que lo haga.

El Sueño de María, es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 57, studied up until the first year of high school but could no longer continue studying due to the scarce economic resources of her family. She was in a relationship, but separated from her husband and today is single. She does not have children in her home; they are married and live separately. A niece lives with her who helps her in the business.

She has various businesses, but the one that she works on every day is the tortilla shop and the sale of beauty products. In addition, she raises chickens for fattening in the end-of-year season and she has been doing this for 11 years. Since she needs to bring income to her family, she decided on the business of making tortillas. Therefore, in the same manner, she went involving the other business that she does to date.

In addition to the other businesses, she butchers pigs 2 times a week. She carries out the activities in her house; she does not have to travel to work. Only her niece helps her and she starts at 5 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.

She will invest the loan to buy corn for the tortilla shop and purchase chickens for fattening to sell them in the end-of-year holidays. Therefore she will increase her income further, given that with the sale of chickens she gets a lot of profit. She will further increase her inventory for the sale of tortillas, since she did not have all of the money in order to buy all of the chickens that she sells. With the loan, it will give her the opportunity to do so.

María's dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy corn for her tortilla shop and to buy chickens to fatten

loans.name: Walayat

texts.en:
Walayat is a 55-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 2 children. 

Walayat's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.   For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly.  Because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Walayat has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his  rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Walayat is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Fatu from Waterloo, an area east of Freetown. She is married and has 6 children.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. In 2007, Fatu established her business selling general items.  She works at her business from 8:00 am to 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her living condition. In the future, Fatu plans to own the biggest shop in her community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy items to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 46-year-old from Waterloo, an area east of Freetown. She is married and has 3 children.  

In 2007, Marie established her cake business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself.   She works at her business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to open a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make cakes to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with six children. She is 52 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Thelma raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested additional working capital to buy piglets and feed.

Thelma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 50 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Benjamin has a chainsaw operating business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to restock additional lumber to sell.

Benjamin has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Benjamin hopes to earn more, part of which will be allocated to his business.

loans.use: to restock additional lumber to sell

loans.name: Sweetheart

texts.en:
Sweetheart is 25 years old and married and has one child; she is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin. Her business is buying and selling corn. She has been in this business for almost four years now. The income sustains her family's needs.

Now, Sweetheart has asked for help with her financial needs from Paglaum MPC. She wants to purchase more corn to sell. 

Sweetheart wishes to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to sell

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia, 60 years old, is a widow and lives at Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs. She sells one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to producing good pigs, in order to sell them continuously.  

Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional feed and piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to maintain more sanitary conditions easily.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Veronica Liseth

texts.es: Verónica de 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, sus hijos y su suegro, desde hace 3 años ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. Verónica  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias, es una madre de familia muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia
texts.en:
Verónica is 33 years old and lives with her husband, her children and her father-in-law. For the past 3 years she has had a store where she sells basic goods like bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, vegetables, etc. She is very responsible and friendly. Her store has many clients even though it doesn't have a lot of variety.

Verónica is requesting a loan so she will have enough money to buy a greater quantity of products. Her greatest desire is to stock her store well and be able to make more revenue. She is a very responsible mother who wants to offer the best in everything to her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, etc.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 36-year-old engaged Lebanese man. He is a construction worker and has been working in this field for the past 15 years. He is a professional worker who always finishes his work proficiently and expertly, thanks to the wide experience that he gained over the years. His work consists in completing work related to concrete. 

Haidar looks forward to improving his business continuously.  That’s why he is requesting today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase wood to reinforce his operations and therefore earn higher income. We all know that wedding expenses are very costly, and Haidar is doing his best to be able to save the needed amount of money to get married. So help him out to achieve his dreams, which consist of getting married and earning a good income that will help him to own a bigger business.

loans.use: buy construction timber

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more stocks of garlic for her business. She has this business for only a year and it is continuously growing. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. The income from her business is assisting in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Erlinda would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy a larger stock of garlic for her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy garlic to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a twenty-year-old woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  She sells second-hand clothes to her friends, especially ladies around town.  She has been in the business for two years and her dream is to expand it.  Competition and seasonal customers are problems she faces.  Her other source of income is from her cocoa harvest and she uses the proceeds to add to her business to fetch more profits.

Rehema is asking for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married mother. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and rental bills.

For the past two years, Biasha has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she has a business selling food consumables like potatoes to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting for KES 20,000,  Biasha  wants to purchase bales of clothes and one sack of potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy clothes and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a woman who struggles to make both ends meet. She deals with property business in rental houses, in addition, she runs a food stall business, selling food stuff. She is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to buy potatoes, dry fish, cooking oil, and fruits for resale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, dry fish, cooking oil, and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is a 36-year-old from Waterloo, an area in eastern Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  

In 2007, Mariatu established her cake business. She began her business because she wants empower herself.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her cake business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a 50-year-old from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She is a widow with 4 children.  

In 2003, Kaditu established her firewood business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income for her living. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase bags of firewood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business.  In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Zainab from Waterloo, and eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 8 year and 13 years.  She started her business to get her daily survival for her family.
 
Zainab runs a food vending business.  She sells food that she makes within her area and has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Zainab says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy food ingredients like seasonings, oil and rice to prepare food for her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and build a permanent structure. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Rugiatu.  She is married and is from Waterloo, a rural area in eastern Freetown. She is blessed with 3 children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Rugiatu runs a palm oil business from home.  She sells palm oil and beans. She has been running this business for 15 years now. She works at her  business throughout the week, from morning to night. Hannah says that the main challenge to her business is the cost of transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: buy palm oil

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Isatu.  She is married and blessed with 6 children.  She lives in Waterloo, a rural area in eastern Freetown.   

Isatu runs a palm oil business from home.  She sells palm oil and beans.  She started her business to take care of her family, and has been running this business for 25 years. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is the cost of transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: buy palm oil

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 36 years old and married with two children. She runs a domestic product business in Waterloo, eastern area of Freetown. She started this business because she wanted to improve the conditions of her family.  

She's been in this business since after the war, and sells glass cups, knifes, and food containers to her community. She says that her major hardships to her business are high competition in the market and slow purchasing power of customers.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from Sibula, Lopez Jaena. She is 47 years old and is married with three kids. 

In 2004, Delia applied for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Hearing all the benefits, she did not hesitate to become a member. She maintains her status of member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Delia has asked for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy bananas to make snacks to sell. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance with her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy bananas to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Solangon, San Juan, Siquijor. She is 42 years old and married with five children. 

This year, Erlinda applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing of all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Now, Erlinda is asking for financial assistance of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional meats, vegetables and rice. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional meats, vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is married with one child. He is 57 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Isidro is a farmer and raises poultry to earn a living. He has been doing this for 13 years. He has requested a loan to purchase 800 day-old layer chicks.

Isidro has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, he hopes to support his immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase 800 day-old layer chicks

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario, 57 years old, lives in Tambisan, San Juan, Siquijor. She was gifted with five children. 

Rosario is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself raising pigs and other variety of agricultural commodity. 

In need of additional working capital, Rosario decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 6000 for buying additional feed and piglets.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Rosario is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a concrete pig cage someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 45 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagdaian City Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Ellen has a general store and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan simply to buy more goods to sell and to repair her store.

Ellen has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell and to repair her store.

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Porn is 62 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been running a motor taxi service for more than three years, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife sells Khmer noodle. She makes an income of $3 daily. 

Three of his children are employed. They are garment workers and a driver. They make an income of $11 each day. To improve his family’s finances, Porn is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase clothes to sell. In addition, a part of this money will be used to purchase a motorbike for commuting. 

This money will help him acquire the ability to run a new business and generate more income for the family. In the future, he would like to expand his clothes shop and help his youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. He will fix his house with the next loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena manages a motor transport business in her village, while her husband goes farming to earn a living. For five years in her transportation services, Filomena has been earning well for their daily needs. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a new set of tires for secure and better services. She plans to acquire another unit for expansion of her service-based business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Lady Gaga Group

texts.en:
Leove is the featured borrower of Lady Gaga group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown, Philippine, to come and work in Lebanon as house keepers, to provide their families with the necessary educational and living needs.

Leove is a 43-year-old single mother of three children. She works as a house keeper to provides her children with the necessary living needs and education. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to send to her children back in the Philippine to pay for their school education fees.

Leove's main aim is to make sure that her children get the best education she hopes she can provide, and see them presentable persons in their society.
Leove is the lady with blue top. As of the other group members, Olivia is the second from the left wearing grey top, Sarah is the first from the left, Arlen is standing in the center of the picture with light green top, and Geraldine is the first from the right wearing a black top.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Melagrosa

texts.en:
Melagrosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns more income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, soap, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Melagrosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 54 years old and from the suburb of the capital city. She is widowed and lives with her grown son who works as a car mechanic and earns a small monthly salary. Aida sorrows that she is unable to help her son in covering the daily expenses.
 
She is seeking an additional source of income, and now requesting a loan to start a clothing sales business. She will purchase apparel and household items, and sell them from her house among the community members and neighbors. She will offer her customers quality things at accessible prices. Aida will even take orders for some clothes and items, and hopes she will obtain a good income. She hopes her business initiative will give her a chance to earn savings for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy clothing and household items for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old and hard-working, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  

She is a farmer who grows cocoa, buys from other farmers, and sells to agents. She also trades in fish and Irish potatoes.

She wants to expand her business into a big cocoa store in town and supply the leading cocoa companies in town.  However, seasonal changes affect her profitability since the harvest will yield small output. 

Grace is requesting a loan to buy fish, Irish potatoes, and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish, Irish pototoes, and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
This is Mirriam, who is 54 years old and a resident of Intramuros, Manila, in the Philippines. She is married to Calixto, a seaman, and they have children. She manages their household while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mirriam operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Mirriam earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mirriam dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha is in her late thirties and married with 2 children. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since she left school and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuit within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Isha requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more sodas, milk, cigarettes and pure water to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, milk, cigarettes and pure water to sell.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine wants to thank all of the lenders for the loan that she used to change the doors and windows. This loan has helped Emine to reach and attain her dream of improving her family’s living conditions and she is very thankful for that. 

Now she is requesting a loan for the second time in order to insulate the inside of the house, to prevent drafts and loss of heat during the cold winter season. She hopes that this second loan will help her to complete any work needed on the house for a long time. 

Her husband is still working as a driver and she is still looking for a job. She thanks all Kiva lenders and very much appreciates everyone’s support!

loans.use: To insulate the inside of the house to prevent drafts and loss of heat during the cold winter season.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a domestic product business in Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She started this business because she wants to improve the condition of her family.

She's been in this business since after the war and sells glass cups, knives, and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem of her business is an improper business location.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
This is the second KIVA loan for Titin, who used to be a junior high school teacher and is presently a housewife.  Titin thinks that selling Nazava Water filters is a great business opportunity because she can augment her household income whilst fulfilling her household duties at the same time. 
 
Titin lives in Cikarang, which is part of the greater Jakarta conglomeration of over 28 million people.  In this area nobody has potable water from their tap.  Many people use well water which is often very dirty.  To get safe drinking water people have to buy water, which is very expensive.  That is why Titin started to sell Nazava Water Filters and has so far had great success.  She paid her first KIVA loan back on time and also made same prepaid orders in between. 

 “Selling the Nazava filters for drinking water and for filtering household water for washing and cooking is a very appropriate business opportunity here in Cikarang and the surrounding area.  I hope that with this KIVA loan, I can become the largest agent in the greater Jakarta region.”

This KIVA loan allows Titin to save on shipping costs, enables her to expand more quickly and will therefore provide more people with safe and affordable drinking water.

loans.use: to expand water purifier sales and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in Cikarang, West Java, Indonesia

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina ella es soltera y tiene 27 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurant, la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno, sopas y carne con arroz, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, pollo, carne y verduras para su negocio de venta de comida.


El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Qorilazo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de morayas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “QORILAZO” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Vicentina is single.  She is 27 years old, has a son, and sells food.  She has a restaurant and prepares dishes such as baked chicken, soups and meat with rice, and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She has been doing this for six years and things are going well for her.  She wants to get ahead through this business and she wants to expand her restaurant and is asking for this loan to buy rice, chicken, meat and vegetables for her food business.

The member whose photograph is attached was not able to attend the meeting due to work commitments.

The member whose picture is covered up is no longer part of the Qorilazo.

The other members sell food, morayas, groceries or taxi service.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane, 35 years old, lives in Cantaroc, Maria, Siquijor.  Rosario is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. She is industrious and raises pigs and a variety of agricultural commodities. In need of additional working capital, Mary Jane decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional feed and piglets. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Mary Jane is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a concrete pig cage someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with five children. Gloria is 64 years of age and lives in Sto. Nino, Pagadian City. 

She sells beauty products to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns only 15,000 pesos doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of only 20,000 pesos.
 
She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she would like to have her own stall to display her beauty products.

loans.use: To buy new beauty products.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en:
Mary Anne is 59 years old and lives in Tinaclaan, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Mary Anne has a bakery business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy additional needed housing materials.

Mary Anne has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Mary Anne hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy additional needed housing materials

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 56 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Candelaria has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail sale.
 
Candelaria has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Candelaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 58 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Natividad is engaged in a hog-fattening activity and earns approximately 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two piglets and five sacks of feeds for her hog-fattening business. 

Natividad has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Natividad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and five sacks of feeds

loans.name: Jonaphel

texts.en:
Jonaphel is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Jonaphel sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PHP for additional capital.

Jonaphel has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Jonaphel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell retail

location.town: Liloy- Baybay Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is 33 years old and lives in Patawag, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children. Geralyn wants to renovate her house. She has requested a loan for additional capital.

Geralyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for four years. In the future, Geralyn hopes to develop her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales patos, gallinas y cerdos, los adquiere en los caseríos aledaños a su distrito para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlo en el mercado de la zona, Alicia ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevo soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de animales, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and lives with her son in the Oyotun district, a community known for its hospitality where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She buys and sells animals such as ducks, chickens, and pigs and buys them in the surrounding parts of her area and sells them at the local market.  Alicia is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy balanced feed to have better production from her animals and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es: Noemy de 36 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 16 años, 12 años, 9 años y 2 años de edad. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta verduras negocio que le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar. Junto a su esposo quien es agricultor trabajan duramente para sacar adelante a su familia y cada día brindarles mejores condiciones de desarrollo. El techo de su vivienda se encuentra dañado por lo que desea repararlo  para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y polines ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso por su cuenta.
texts.en:
Noemy, who is 36 years old, lives with her husband and their children, who are 16, 12, 9, and 2 years old, in the house that they own. For six years, she has earned her living selling vegetables, a business that has allowed her to provide for her household. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, she works hard to support her family and provide them with increasingly better conditions in which to grow up. 

The roof of their house is currently damaged, so Noemy would like to repair it. She has requested this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting and beams because she does not have the capital to cover this expenditure on her own.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and beams to repair her roof.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Все население в селе Водяное по традиции  занимается выращиванием овощей. У Натальи также есть свое фермерское хозяйство -  теплицы, где она выращивает помидоры, огурцы. Еще с детства Наталья привыкла  много трудиться, родители передали ей свои знания, поэтому у нее всегда порядок и на огороде, и дома. Трудятся всей семьей целый день. 

В этом году второй урожай Натальи пострадал от заморозков, часть урожая погибла. Также  сын поступил учиться в Морское училище и стоимость обучения довольно высокая, поэтому Наталья обратилась за кредитом 30,000 гривен. На полученные средства она приобретет семена , пленку и удобрения для нового сезона. Наталья благодарна за помощь: « Хорошо, что вы  нам помогаете, иначе нам пришлось бы трудно». Наталья надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и продолжать оплачивать учебу сына.
texts.en:
The whole population of the village of Vodyanoye is traditionally involved in growing vegetables.  Nataliya also owns her own farm, which consists of greenhouses in which she grows tomatoes and cucumbers.  Nataliya has always worked hard, ever since she was a child.  She learned the business from her parents, and both her farm and her house are now very organized.  The whole family works all day.

This year, Nataliya's second harvest suffered from the frost, so part of the crops was lost.  Her son also left home to study at a naval college with high tuition fees.  For these reasons, Nataliya has decided to apply for a loan of 30,000 hryvnia.  She will use the money to buy seeds, plastic sheeting and fertilizers for the new season.  She is very thankful for the help she is receiving, saying "Thank you for all your help.  Without it, we would have a much harder time".  She  hopes to increase her income and wants to continue to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase plastic sheeting, seeds, and fertilizer for her greenhouses.

loans.name: Khuoch

texts.en: Khuoch is 25 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. This couple has been working in construction for more than five years, earning approximately $10 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Khuoch is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle to commute to work. This purchase will help reduce the transportation expenses and help her easily commute to work. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house for the next loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN JOSE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Maximiliana ella es soltera, tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de florez,la socia vende diferentes tipos de flores como margaritas,calas,rosas entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar rosas para su negocio.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SAN JOSE” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of the same name.

Maximiliana is 47 years old. She is single and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with her business of selling flowers. She sells different kinds of flowers like daisies, lilies, roses, etc. to people who request them from her.. She has done this for a long time and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wants to continue to do this in order to continue to support her family.

Maximiliana is requesting a loan to buy roses for her business. She thanks all those who participate in her dream through this loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

The members who appear in the inserted photos asked permission to be late for the meeting due to their work commitments.

loans.use: to buy roses for her business.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es conviviente y tiene 52 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes  los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuye. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de construccion, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de chicha.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Santa Rosa de Lima de Conchacalla" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Anta, part of Anta province and Cusco department.

The member is Juana. She has a common-law husband and is 52 and has 7 children. The member works in her business selling and raising animals. The member raises guinea pigs. She lets them grow and fatten and later sells them in different markets. By means of this small business, the member brings her children forward. The member's dream is to have a shop where she can sell the guinea pigs. The member is applying for a loan to buy guinea pigs and guinea pig feed.

The member that is superimposed on the group photo was taken after the photo because she asked to be absent for work reasons.

The other members work in the businesses of animal sales, construction, grocery stores and sale of chicha [sweet drink made from purple corn].

The member thanks those who form a part of this dream by this means and she is committed to fulfilling the monthly payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Clodenia

texts.en:
Clodenia is married, with three children.

She raises pigs as an aid to her income from farming. She has been raising pigs for five years, and she was able to repair her house from her profit. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase livestock feed to boost her pigs. She plan to use her profit to build a livestock shelter for business improvement.

In the future, Clodenia wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed for her pigs

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
This is Jerry. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan, which he utilized to buy more feed and other supplies needed to expand his product inventory. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more feed and other supplies needed to expand his product inventory. More items to sell will result for better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain their daily needs and his children's education. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jerry hopes to be more successful in his business and dreams to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. There, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more feed and other supplies needed to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 41 years old and has six children. Virginia is widowed and has three children who are still in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a 43-year-old widowed woman with three children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in a mobile trade of second-hand clothes as her main source of income. She also carries out agriculture in order to earn an additional income. She faces a challenge of competition, but has hopes that in the future, she will own a wholesale shop of second-hand clothes.

Jovia is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to resell in this Christmas season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary used her previous loan to buy spare parts to sell. She is a 46-year-old single mother living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is in the spare parts business for a living. She faces a challenge of a high rate of competition but has hopes of having a wholesale motorcycle and motor vehicle spare parts business.

Mary is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Dolores Orbelia

texts.es:
Dolores de 28 años de edad, es una mujer ejemplo a seguir por su gran coraje al trabajo, actualmente es parte de un grupo religioso, y además de llevar el rol de madre, se dedica a la ganadería, siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos, para la alimentación de sus 2 hijas de edades entre 8 y 10 años. 

Dolores, se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 5 años y este rubro lo aprendió de sus padres que se dedicaban a la crianza de vacas y a la elaboración de los derivados de la leche como: quesos y cuajadas donde los comercializan en el mismo cantón. A Dolores le venden la leche cuando no tiene en producción sus vacas y es así como ella no deja de tener esa fuente de ingresos, para la alimentación de sus hijas. 
  
El dinero de este préstamo, será invertido para la compra dos novillas de repasto, ya que cuenta con un potrero donde tenerlas junto con las 4 vacas que posee actualmente, y así poder darles venta el próximo año.

Dolores piensa seguir trabajando con ganado, ya que le gusta mucho este rubro.
texts.en:
Dolores, 28, is a role-model woman to follow for her great courage to work. Currently, she is part of a religious group and in addition to carrying the role of mother, she works in cattle raising. This is her greatest source of income for feeding her 2 daughters, ages 8 and 10.

Dolores has been making her living in cattle raising for the last 5 years. She learned this sector from her parents who worked raising cattle and making milk byproducts like cheese and curds; they sold them in the same region. People sell Dolores milk when she does not have production from her cows. This is how she does not lose this source of income for feeding her daughters.

The money from this loan will be invested for the purchase of two pasture heifers, given that there is already a pasture to keep them along with the 4 cows she currently possesses. This way she will sell them next year.

Dolores plans to continue working with cattle, since she likes this sector a lot.

loans.use: to buy two pasture heifers.

loans.name: Ernestina's Group

texts.en:
This group are part of "Elemawushie," which comprises three members, all entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities to move on in life. They live in the city of Accra, a beautiful place where trading is very popular and well established.

They are into the sales of soft drinks, electrical appliances, and fish. This is their first loan with Kiva and their sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

One of the members, Ernestina, has been in the group for the past four years.  She has established a good friendship with all her neighbors and friends. She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Ernestina is 40 years old and single; she has two dependent children, who are staying with her. She stays in the family house she lives in, and her children are school-going.

For 20 years, Ernestina, who is first from the right in the photo, has been selling soft drinks throughout the week at her bar to her customers. 

She plans to use the new loan to buy more drinks so that she can sell enough to take care of her children. Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working to take care of her children. 

The total loan amount of GHS 5,000 is to buy electrical accessories, drinks, and maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy and sell soft drinks at her bar

loans.name: Jane         S

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Jane from Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child, aged 6 years. In 2009, Jane established her general store business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Jane requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Jane plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her store

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata.  She is a late-forties-old from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with seven children.  

In 2007, Fatmata established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open a food stand table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan es un señor casado de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales son,  un hombre y tres mujeres, ambos aun se encuentran estudiando en el Departamento de Sololá.
Don Juan es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Comenta que se dedica a la compraventa de abarrotes en una tienda que tiene a pocos metros de su vivienda. Como también comenta que en sus tiempos libres imparte capacitaciones a personas que asisten a la iglesia católica, esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar la economía de su familia.
A través de lo que realiza obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le han ayudado a contribuir a la economía de su familia. Ahora él ha observado que en esta época del año las personas consumen más este producto por las diferentes actividades que realizan. De manera que está solicitando un préstamo  de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario y así podrá ampliar su negocio para ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño darle una educación de calidad a sus hijos, para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a 40 year old married man. He lives together with his wife and his four children, one boy and 3 girls. They all study in the Department of Sololá.

Juan is a hard-working man who fights for the well-being of his family. He buys and sells groceries from his store which is only a few meters from his house. He comments that in his spare time he also imparts instruction to people who attend the Catholic Church. He does this in order to improve his family's finances. With what he earns and with his profits he can contribute to the finances of his family.

Juan has observed that people buy more products at this time of year because of the activities that go on. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000 GTQ to buy daily use items to expand his store and offer better service to his customers. His dream is to provide a quality education for his children so they face a future with better opportunities in their lives.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Friends And Unity Group

texts.en:
This is a group of two women who are part of the general group called "Friends and Unity"; all live in the same neighborhood, and they work together whenever the need arises. 

Gladys is the group representative in this loan cycle, and she can be seen in the photo standing on the left. 

Gladys is a married mother who has more than seven years' experience in selling clothing. She contributes her part in the upbringing of her children and her younger sister.

Gladys will use her portion of the loan to buy wax-prints and resell them to her customers. She starts her working day at 7 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m. 

In the future, she would like to use further loans from this field partner to grow her business and increase her earnings. In this way, she could improve the living conditions of her immediate family.

They need a total amount of GHS 1,600 to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy wax-prints and resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 67 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines. He is married with 5 children. 
Samson works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 15 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fishing materials.
Samson has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  Samson hopes to immediately support his family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 38 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagdaian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Maria Teresa has a general store and earns approximately 11,000 Philippine pesos each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy more dry goods to sell.

Maria Teresa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy dry goods to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Nida Group

texts.en:
Nida Group is a group composed of five Filipino ladies wishing to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua. They all work in Lebanon to provide their families a better living. They decided to join hands and establish the group because they all truly need support with their financial expenses. 


Nida is the group leader and featured member of the group. She is the second lady from the right side of the picture and is wearing a yellow top. She is a 44-year-old single mother of five children, for whom she is sacrificing her life to provide them with the best living and education ever. They live back in the Philippines, where she dreams of going back and establishing her own business soon. She is the only financial provider of the family, since the children's father does not acknowledge the family any more. 


The fact that she has a very low income makes it impossible for her to be able to rightfully provide for her children, or even cover her own expenses. The Al Majmoua loan will be invested in supporting her in her own business, preparing and selling Filipino food. The loan will be used to buy necessary raw materials and special catering needs (plates, boxes and many other necessary required needs). This is a highly requested type of business in Lebanon, since it is a special foreign menu. She is very anxious about this loan, because she believes that developing her business will increase her income and help her develop her precious family's living.


As for the other group members, Sara Jane is at the center of the picture wearing a white top, Ederlyn is the first on the right with a white striped black top, Evelyn is the first on the left with a pink top, and Deveniel is the second from the left wearing a pink and white top.

loans.use: to support her Filipino food business through buying necessary raw materials and special catering needs (plates, boxes and many other required needs).

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr:
La dame Penda, âgée de 45 ans, évolue dans le commerce de divers produits susceptibles de générer un profit à la vente. Penda est veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Elle s’active depuis maintenant cinq ans et les bénéfices sont réservés à l’entretien de ses enfants puisque sont mari est décédée, c’est elle qui prend donc en charge leurs besoins au quotidien. 
Penda a eu à bénéficier de 2 crédits payés convenablement, et veut un renouvellement pour acheter de la marchandise comme des tissus, des chaussures, des bijoux, mais aussi de l’encens, de l’huile de palme…. Penda peut vendre tout ce que sa clientèle peut lui demander, l’essentiel c’est qu’elle puisse en tirer une marge bénéficiaire.
Elle veut avoir un jour, une autonomie financière et ne plus avoir besoin de faire des crédits.
texts.en:
Ms. Penda, aged 45, does commerce in a diversity of products likely to generate a profit. She is a widow and the mother of two. She has been active for five years now, and the profits are reserved for her children's care, since her husband is deceased. Therefore she is the one who meets their needs day to day. 

Penda has benefited from two loans, paid back appropriately. She wants a renewal to purchase some merchandise, such as cloth, shoes, and jewelry, but also incense, palm oil, … to resell. She can sell anything her customers ask of her. The main thing is that she is able to obtain a margin of profit. One day she wants to have financial autonomy and not to need loans anymore.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise: shoes, cloth, palm oil, jewelry, and incense to resell

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 26 years old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and a small daughter in a small simple house in the city. Majdi is a worker where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Majdi and his wife would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Majdi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for his home. By taking this loan, Majdi will be able to provide a hot water for his family especially in the winter with less electricity costs and with using clean energy. Majdi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his home

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan de 27 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, ya que a pesar de que tiene empleo como panificador, también sale a vender  pan en su tiempo libre. Actualmente, vive en la casa de sus padres, junto con sus 2 hermanos quienes tiene su propia fuente de ingresos para bien de la familia.

Juan tiene un año de trabajar como panificador, en la empresa y siempre trata la manera de ser responsable. Además, después de salir del trabajo, compra pan dulce para comercializarlo. 

El dinero de este préstamo, será invertido para la compra de un horno, ya que se lo venden muy cómodo y quiere aprovechar esa oportunidad y poner su propia panadería.

Juan tiene una visión de tener su propia panadería, dentro de 3 meses se ve haciendo pan en su propio negocio y así poder generar empleo a jóvenes que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Juan is a 27 year old hard-working young adult. Even though he works as a baker, he also goes out and sells bread in his spare time. Presently he lives in his parents house with his two siblings who all work and contribute to the well-being of the family.

Juan has been working as a bread maker in a company for the past year and always acts in a responsible manner. On leaving work he buys pastries to re-sell.

The money from this loan will be invested in buying an oven which is being sold on very good terms. Juan wants to take advantage of this opportunity to open his own bakery. He has a vision of having his own bakery and within 3 months he plans to be making bread in his own business. Then he can offer employment to young people who need the work.






El dinero de este préstamo, será invertido para la compra de un horno, ya que se lo venden muy cómodo y quiere aprovechar esa oportunidad y poner su propia panadería.



Juan tiene una visión de tener su propia panadería, dentro de 3 meses se ve haciendo pan en su propio negocio y así poder generar empleo a jóvenes que lo necesiten.

loans.use: to buy an oven and open his own bakery.

loans.name: Roció Ivon

texts.es:
Roció de 22 años de edad,  es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos, culmino sus estudios de técnico en computación en el año 2009, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora.

Es una joven emprendedora que a pesar de su corta edad, tiene visión de negocio en el cual decidió abrir un cyber, ya que saco sus estudios en computación quiso poner en practica lo aprendido poniendo este negocio, el cual ya tiene un año de tenerlo funcionando, el negocio está a dos cuadras de sus casa y el cual ella misma lo administra.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para la compra de más equipo de cómputo para su negocio, ya el negocio están llegando más cliente y le está generando más demanda de equipo de cómputo, con esto los ingresos del negocio mejoraran grandemente. 

A futuro tiene pensado en un corto plazo, seguir sus estudios universitarios para seguirse preparando, además tiene pensado casarse para formar su familia, ya que con el préstamo ve mejores ingresos y por lo cual piensa en expandir el negocio.
texts.en:
Roció is 22 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings. She finished her studies in computer science in 2009. She is an enterprising woman who is a fighter.   

She is an enterprising young woman who despite her youth has a business vision and decided to open an internet cafe, since she has a degree in computers and she wanted to put what she learned into practice by starting this business. It has already been open for a year and the business is two blocks from her house and she runs it herself. 

The loan she is asking for is to buy more is to buy more computer equipment for her business. More customers are coming to the business and that is generating more demand for computers. With them, the business will improve greatly. 

In the future her short term plan is to keep going to college to keep learning and also to get married to start a family. With the loan she will see better income and with it she plans on expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy more computer equipment for her business.
